loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old and married with two children.  She has been selling scrap metal for five years while her husband does printing.  She was introduced to Baraka Ukweli group under Faulu Kenya by her friend.  In this group, Joyce has learned how to manage her money by saving on a weekly basis. She is glad to be a member of the group where she can easily obtain loan from Faulu Kenya. The loan grouop members guarantee each other's loan.   

Joyce is requesting for a loan of 20, 000 KES.  This will be her first loan from Faulu Kenya. She wants to increase her supplies of scrap metal.  She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita lleva toda la vida rodeada del turismo. Sus vecinas y ella ven en el turismo una forma de negocio rentable. En la ciudad de de Ollantaytambo se encuentra una de las ruinas más importantes del Incanato y también es paradero obligatorio para los turistas que se dirigen a ciudadela Inca de Machu Picchu. Desde los 19 años, Anita se las ingenio para vender artesanía en la ciudad, actualmente vende en dos sitios, el primero es en la estación de trenes y el segundo en la plaza de principal de Ollantaytambo. La pueden encontrar en sus puestos de venta que está equipado con mercadería surtida como por ejemplo mantas, chompas, mochilas, bordados, sombreros, maletines desde las 8 am hasta 4pm, los 7 días de la semana. 

Anita desprende  una imagen de alegría y amabilidad. Un flujo de regular de turistas nacionales y extranjeros que visitan su puesto. Ella vende sus productos de calidad y de un buen acabado. 

Con su próximo crédito, Anita espera recibir $500 USD. Por el momento, su puesto está bien equipado de mercadería porque en  esta época del año hay una alta vista de turistas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para comprar una computadora personal para el estudio de sus hijos. Anita pertenece hace 7 años al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo”.
texts.en:
Anita has been surrounded by tourism her entire life. She and her neighbors recognize that tourism offers an opportunity for profitable business. One of the most notable Incan ruins is located in the town of Ollantaytambo. This is also the location of a mandatory stopping point for tourists who are on their way to the Incan city of Machu Picchu. Since age 19, Anita has sold artisan crafts in the city. She currently works at two different sites, one being located at the train station and the other in the main plaza of Ollantaytambo. Anita can be found at either of her locations from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., 7 days a week. Anita sells assorted merchandise such as blankets, sweaters, bags, embroidered goods, hats and small cases. She maintains an attitude of joy and kindness. Tourists, both domestic and foreign, regularly visit her locations for the high-quality products. Anita hopes to receive $500 for her next loan. Because this time of year is a season of increased tourism, her operation is currently well-stocked with merchandise. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy a personal computer, which will aid her children in their studies. Anita has been a member of the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" for seven years.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a personal computer to aid her children's studies.

loans.name: Milenka

texts.es: La Señorita Milenka vive en casa de sus padres donde tiene su pequeña pensión que atiende mayormente por las noches ella comenzó desde pequeña a trabajar con su mama y aprendio mucho su especialidad es el  Silpancho plato típico de la región. Saco el crédito para mejorar su negocio comprara un televisor, dvd, y manteles ahora ella es un cliente mas de emprender y kiva. Ya que se le dio esta oportunidad para que crezca mas y mejore sus ingresos y por ende su economía, la Señorita tiene muchos deseos uno de ellos es poder tener un restaurante grande y reconocido por los clientes.
texts.en:
Milenka lives in her parents’ house where she has a small eatery that she opens mostly in the evening. She started working since a very young age helping her mother and she learned much. Her specialty is Silpancho, a dish that is typical of the area (consists of a base layer of rice, followed by a layer of boiled and sliced potatoes, followed by a thin schnitzel-style meat, followed by another layer of chopped tomato, onion and parsley mixed together and topped with either one or two fried eggs.) She took out the loan to improve her eatery; she will buy a television set, DVD player and tablecloths. She is now one more client of Emprender and Kiva. Having gotten the opportunity to grow more and improve her income, the young lady has many wishes among which is to have a large restaurant that is well-known by customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a television set, DVD player, tablecloths and others.

loans.name: Confianza Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Eligio is the coordinator of his group Confianza y Desarrollo (Truth and Development) 1 & 2. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and nine children. He says that his most difficult challenge is to raise and provide everything his family needs. In the meantime he enjoys working in the livestock business.

Eligio has been in business for around seven years, starting with a calf he bought and raised. He is excited to be taking his tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to buy another calf. He will use the profits to invest in other animals such as pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas.

Eligio began his association with Esperanza because "the program came to my community and I was invited to participate." His story is generally representative of those in his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of the latter having recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. His group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The area’s main economic activity involves a free trade zone, a cement factory and others in an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: Serapio, de 43 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, de quienes es el único sustento, ya que hace unos años su esposa falleció. A lo largo de su vida, Serapio ha trabajado en muchas cosas, ahora se decida al trabajo de albañil y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos. Es así que cuando se necesita hacer el techo de un inmueble o se tiene que levantar una pared siempre recurren a él, por la experiencia que tiene. Serapio disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión puede pagar la educación de sus hijos, lleva 10 años realizando esta profesión y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que mezclar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente, por tanto desea renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará tablones nuevos y aumentar el número de puntales, con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Serapio, 43, is an unassuming, hard working man. He lives in a rented house with his four beloved children. He is their only means of support since his wife died a few years ago. Throughout his life Serapio has had many different jobs. He is currently working as a bricklayer and his services are highly sought after by his neighbors. When someone needs a roof installed or a wall erected they always call on him because of his experience. Serapio enjoys working in construction because he knows that with this honorable profession he is able to educate his children. He has been in this profession for 10 years and considers the most difficult part having to carry the heavy bricks and to mix the cement sometimes even with his hands which has caused his hands to age quickly. This is why he’d like to upgrade his work tools in order to improve the work he does. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he doesn’t want to miss repaying it for lack of money so he is already making contacts for more construction jobs. He is the only male in his communal bank so he always tries to be responsible and respectful towards the other members. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy new beams and supports so that he can work on more jobs at once thus improving his income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beams and some tools for better efficiency in his job as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to repair her house

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe S. D. A. tiene 46 años, vive en la zona D. Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento D. Cochabamba.
La señora S. es una persona trabajadora, que ha sufrido la pérdida D. su esposo en un accidente y tiene 3 hijos que cuidar. 
Al estar viuda, ella se dedica a la agricultura, cría vacas y chanchos en poca cantidad para mantener su familia.  

Al ser la agricultura su principal actividad económica, la Sra. S. ha visto la necesidad D. tener más agua porque este elemento vital ha ido disminuyendo en los últimos años.
Esto le ha perjudicado bastante y sus ingresos han disminuido, teniendo problemas para alimentar, educar y vestir a sus 3 hijos. 
Es por esta razón es que ha solicitado un crédito para poder ser socia D. un pozo D. agua que le permita regar sus plantas incrementando su producción cada seis meses y haciendo que tenga mayores ingresos para alimentar, educar y vestir a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe S. D. A. is 46 years old and lives in the Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe zone of the Quillacollo province in the Cochabamba department.

Mrs. S. is a hard working woman who lost her husband to an accident and who has three children to care for.  As a widow, she raises cattle and hogs in small numbers to support her family.

Because agriculture is her primary economic activity, Mrs. S. needs to have more water because it is a vital resource that has diminished in recent years.  This has affected her income substantially and she has had problems educating and dressing her three children.

For these reasons she has requested a loan so that she can join a community well that will allow her to water her crops, thereby increasing her production and income every six months.  This will help feed, educate, and dress her family.

loans.use: Join a community well

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia T. is 60 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Purok Everlasting, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000.

Dionesia is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her fish selling business. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dionesia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of fish selling.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a 59 year-old married woman who supports a family of nine. She is married to Danson Kandagor who is a gardener for Sacho High School. She has seven children aged between 28 and 9. She has been selling charcoal for 10 years and earns a monthly income of around Kshs 8000. She will use her loan to purchase more charcoal and expand her business. With the anticipated profits, she would like to open a retail shop.

This is her first loan with Kadet, and her hope is to open a retail shop and to ensure her children receive an education.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
José de 41 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Comenzó a vender láminas papelería, cuadernos, plumas en la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco fue comprando más papelería y útiles para venderles a sus vecinos y conocidos del sector donde vive. Para conseguir dinero adicional también recorre las calles vendiendo accesorios para celulares.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
José, who is 41, has a small stationery store. He lives on the outskirts of the city, in a zone called Paraíso de la Flor (Paradise of Flowers), which is characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

He began by selling laminated educational materials, notebooks, and pens in the front part of his house. Little by little, he bought more stationary items and tools to sell to his neighbors and acquaintances in the area where he lives. To obtain additional money, he also sells accessories for cell phones as a street vendor.

With the loan, he wants to buy stationery and notebooks for his business. In the future, he wants to increase his business and make improvements on his house.

loans.use: Buy stationery and notebooks for his store

loans.name: Kyosimba Onaanya Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
50-year-old N. Hadijah is affliated with the Kyosimba-Onaanya Women's group in Lugazi, Uganda. For 13 years she has been engaged in a banana and sweet potato selling business in Buikwe. It is a business which in many ways compliments her farming activities in the sense that, unlike other people who buy foods to resell, she just sells what she harvests. 

This widowed mother of two comes across as a hardworking and good-natured woman. This business generates about $35 weekly, and with this loan Hadijah says she is going to rejuvenate her business. She is thinking about buying high grade manure for her farming gardens to improve her harvests, and also getting a permanent stall at a nearby market from which to operate her business.

loans.use: The purchase of high grade manure for her farming gardens

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub C., age 44, is a housewife. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Her husband manufactures and sells cement pipes and steps, earning an income of USD $6.00 per day. The family has to spend USD $40.00 on food, USD $5.00 on electricity, and USD $38.00 on other necessary expenses every month. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase more supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy supplies to improve her husband's business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, tiene 37 años, vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos, ellos viven en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

David se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, él vende sus animales y productos agrícolas en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal, Anta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. David espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar semillas, animales críos y muchas cosas más.

David pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
David, 37, lives with his wife and three children in Anta province which is in Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

David is a farmer and cattleman.  He sells his animals and farm products at the community of Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city, Anta.

He has been in this line of work for several years and does excellently thanks to the effort he puts into it.  He hopes to get 1500 new soles in the loan and he will buy seed, newborn animals and many other things.

David is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is well managed by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy seed, newborn animals and many other things.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent O. is 35 years old and married to Henry. They have three children who are all in school.

Millicent has a business of selling second-hand clothes and she has been doing it for the past seven years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. Her monthly income is Kes 30,000. 


Her desire is to see her children through school.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 48 años de edad y con 5 hijos, Antonio Z. C. quien desde hace 15 años era vendedor de dulces ambulantes en las afueras de un centro comercial de Medellín- Colombia. Sus ganas de superarse, de salir adelante y de ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia lo impulsaron a conseguir un local para ampliar su oferta de productos, estar en un lugar fijo y así aumentar sus ventas. 

Actualmente Antonio necesita de un préstamo para comprar más surtido para su tienda, pues hace poco su esposa enfrentó un embarazo riesgoso que le demandó altos costos, lo que lo descapitalizó su negocio. 

El sueño de este emprendedor a futuro es ampliar su negocio, ofrecer cada vez más productos para la canasta familiar y comprar una finca para cosechar diferentes hortalizas que también pueda vender en su tienda.
texts.en:
At 48 and with 5 children, Antonio Z. C. used to be a street candy vendor for 15 years on the outskirts of a shopping center in Medellín- Colombia. His desire for self-improvement, his desire to get ahead and to offer his family a better future propelled him to obtain a business space in order to expand his selection of products, to have a fixed location, and in so doing, boost sales.

Antonio currently needs a loan in order to purchase more products for his store because his wife recently faced a costly high-risk pregnancy, which deprived him of capital.

The dream of this entrepreneur is to be able to expand his business in the future, offering more and more basic need items and purchasing a farm to grow different crops that he can sell in his store.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Frederick Boima's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of borrowers from the Eastern Polytechnic school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Staff of this institution have come to SMT for a loan of SLL 9,500,000 in order to improve  their standard of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children, and so on.  At the end of each month, the institution’s bursar is directly responsible to deduct their repayment amount and pays SMT on their behalf.  This is the first loan that this institution has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders.

Frederick Boima K. is the leader of this group. The 43 year-old Frederick was born in a village called Dawa, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 8 years. Frederick is married and has 5 children – 2 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 1 in college. Frederick has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for his child and to invest the remainder in business.

loans.use: To pay college fees for his child and invest the remainder in business

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Él siempre alegre Mario, de 39 años. Vive junto a su esposa Raquel y sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). Una vez al año cosecha  “achiote”, producto que siembra desde hace 20 años. En todo este tiempo de arduo trabajo y empeño logró adquirir con la ganancia de sus cosechas; 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder negociar sus productos en el mercado de compradores de la ciudad de Pichanaki, pues siente la motivación en cada venta que realiza. Ahora él se está preparando para la cosecha del mes de noviembre, ya que el precio del producto está subiendo en el mercado. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde tiene muchas expectativas de poder mejorar sus cultivos con el apoyo de su asociación. Mario, tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos para que puedan crecer y dar buenos frutos. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar herramientas para podar sus plantaciones y sacar la maleza que entorpece su crecimiento.
texts.en:
The always-happy Mario is 39 years old and he lives with his wife Raquel and their 2 children.  They live in their own house located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian jungle).  Once a year he harvests achiote. It is a product he has been growing for 20 years. During this time of long and arduous work he managed to acquire with the earnings from his harvests: 3 hectares of farm land. What he most enjoys about his work is to be able to sell his products at the buyers market in the city of Pichanaki. He is motivated by each sale that he completes.

Currently he is getting ready for the harvest in the month of November. The price of the product is rising in the market. He is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo", meaning "A New Dawn in Guacamayo". It is the first loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has great expectations to improve his plantations and have good harvests. With his loan he thinks to purchase tools to use in his plantations in order to remove the brush that impedes growth.

loans.use: to purchase tools to remove field brush

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Doña Arely, es una señora de 45 años de edad, que reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, vive con sus tres hijos de 22, 17 y 15 años, ellos dependen económicamente de ella, por su parte se dedica a la venta de tortillas, leña, bebidas refrescantes, trabaja en este negocio hace 15 años, de 8:00am a 2:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Ella necesita de un préstamo, pues quiere compra maíz, leña y dar mantenimiento a la cocina donde hace las tortillas, este será una gran ayuda para ella, pues estará abasteciendo su inventario de materiales y su principal herramienta para hacer las tortillas estará en mejores condiciones.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte, para ver a sus hijos formados académicamente, para luego se estabilicen en un empleo, que les garantice un mejor futuro y en condiciones diferentes.
texts.en:
Arely is a 45-year old woman who resides in the city of San Miguel.  She lives with her three children, ages 22, 17 and 15, who are financially dependent on her.  For her part, she dedicates herself to selling tortillas, firewood, and beverages.  She has been in business for 15 years, working from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.  To date, she has had no difficulties with the business.  

She needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, and to make some repairs to the kitchen where she prepares her tortillas.  This would be a great help to her, allowing her to supply her inventory of goods and making her primary tool for preparing tortillas to operate in better condition.  Her objective is to work hard in order to see her children complete their educations, so that they can later find stable employment that guarantees them a better future and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and maintain the kitchen where she prepares her tortillas.

loans.name: Yaguaron Poty Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Guayaibyty, en la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunió un grupo de mujeres con el fin de informarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, presentándoseles una oportunidad para tener un nivel de vida mejor decidieron realizar la reunión para la conformación del comité.
El comité lleva por nombre Yaguaron Poty por haberse creado en el Día de la Primavera, ellas se comprometieron a mantenerse unidas y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mutuo entre todas; actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo con calificación excelente, el grupo está integrado por 14  mujeres que en cada etapa anterior han invertido sus créditos en sus actividades diarias.
Hoy día, solicitan de nuevo otro préstamo para seguir aumentando sus negocios y por ende trabajando de manera mejor.
La sra. Maria Isabel se dedica a la cria y venta de gallinas, es un negocio que le ha dejado siempre muy buenos ingresos, pues como productos las gallinas son de muy buena calidad, y eso la ha ayudado a mantener la economía de su familia de manera estable.
Ella solicita el crédito especificamente para comprar medicamentos y comidas para aves de corral.
texts.en:
In Guayaibyty neighborhood, in the city of Paraguarí, a group of women came together in order to find out more information about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya.  As they were presented with an opportunity to enjoy a better standard of living, they decided to call a meeting in order to form a committee.

The committee is called Yaguaron Poty because it was founded on Spring Day.  The women pledged to remain united and to work with mutual respect for each other.  They are currently in their sixth loan cycle and have an excellent record.  The group has 14 members (all women) who in each previous stage have invested their loans in their daily activities.  They are currently requesting a new loan to continue growing their businesses and, consequently, to continue working in a better manner.

Maria Isabel raises and sells hens.  This is a business which has always made her very good income as her hens are very good quality.  This has helped her to support her family's finances in a stable manner.  She is requesting this loan specifically to buy medicines and feed for her birds.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, medicines and feed for poultry

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes H. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,050 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like soft drinks, sugar and rice to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like soft drinks, sugar and rice to sell

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Linkito Samba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LINKITO SAMBA est à son quatrième cycle de le programme des bancs villageois.il est composé de 46 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame SALIMATOU  (assise à extrême gauche et en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  66 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle vend de la pâte d’arachide et de l’huile de palme dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle a plusieurs années d’expérience de ce domaine d’activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des pâtes d’arachide et de l’huile de palme pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des membres de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
The Linkito Samba group is on their fourth loan in the bancs villageois program. It consists of 46 women who live in the same village. Their primary business is small commerce.

Mrs. Salimatou (seated to the far left, inset) is the head of the group. She is 66 years old, married, and a mother of three.

She sells peanut butter and palm oil in the weekly markets. She has several years of experience doing this.

With her new loan, she is going to buy peanut butter and palm oil to sell.

The profits from this business will allow her to support her husband in paying for their family’s food, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is from the town of Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. Joy owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling  food & daily use products in the local community. Joy has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery items for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Исроил занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает запастные части автомашин. Кроме того на сегодняшний день рядом с магазином Исроил открыл обслуживающую точку, вулканзацию. Для расширения своей деятельности ему необходимо взять кредит в Хумо. Поэтому он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых аппаратов.
texts.en: Isroil lives in Dangara. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife, and his children study in high school. Isroil works in trade. He has a shop where he sells spare parts for vehicles.  Additionally, near his shop Isroil has opened a tire repair center.  In order to expand his business, he has to take out a loan from MLO Humo and Partners.  He is taking out a loan to buy necessary tools.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools.

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.en:
Sharafniso is married and the mother of two children. She is an honest and responsible woman. For 25 years she has been running her business buying and selling seeds.  Sharafniso wants to expand her business and to make a good profit. She would like a loan of 5500 TJS for purchasing seeds in order to increase the assortment of seeds. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds for retail

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 40 years old and married with four children ranging in age from 9 months to 21 years old. Ines is the owner and operator of a restaurant that serves local Peruvian dishes such as lomo saltado and various types of soup. Her restaurant is still in its early stages, as she just opened it half a year ago.

Ines is requesting a loan in order to generally improve the aesthetics of her restaurant. She plans on purchasing paint to make the restaurant more colorful. Very committed to the success of her new restaurant, she promises to make all the necessary repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint to improve the decor of her restaurant.

loans.name: Margarita Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Margarita, tiene 54 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive con su mamá y su hermana. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio aunque luego se retiró pero regreso porque los créditos son una gran ayuda en su negocio.

Nuestra amiga lleva más 30 años administrando un bar en una escuela de su localidad, en el vende todo tipo de productos preparados por ella, nos cuenta que solo vende comida saludable para que los niños tengan un buen desarrollo, allí vende corviches, empanadas, arroz con pollo, ensalada de frutas, ceviches entre otras cosas deliciosas, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que trata de no repetir sus productos en la semana para darles más variedad y que sus niños estén contentos, próximamente espera comprar lo necesario para poder vender almuerzos para los profesores que tienen que quedarse hasta más tarde.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos y frutas para los jugos.
 
Su sueño es seguir dando lo mejor a los niños que son sus mejores clientes..
texts.en:
In the Portoviejo settlement of the Crucita parish we find a place known as “Los Arenales.”  This is where the members of the “Nueva Generación” get together every two weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, it’s food, and the warmness of its people.


Here we meet Margarita.  She is 54 years old, single and lives with her mother and sister.  She was part of the group since it began, left, and then rejoined because the loans are of great help for her business.

Our friend has been running a pub at a local school for more than 30 years, where she sells all types of products that she prepares.  She says that she only sells healthy food so that the children develop well.  She sells corviches, empanadas, chicken with rice, fruit salads, and ceviches, among other delicious things.  She also says that she tries not to sell the same things daily so that she can keep the kids happy by giving them a variety.  Now she wants to buy what she needs in order to sell lunches for the teachers who have to stay until the evenings.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her food and also fruits for juices.  Her dream is to continue giving the best to the children who are her best customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and fruit.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Eddy tiene la edad de 41 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Él quiere  comprar mercadería de bazar para ofrecer a su clientela más productos. Además cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y  tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio. Eddy  no ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Él también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos mayor oportunidad de educación, lo suficientemente necesaria  para que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor, que sean personas  preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Eddy is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are his highest priority. He wants to buy bazaar merchandise so that he can offer more products to his customers. Eddy has an established customer base and several years of experience in his business.

Eddy has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate. He also wants to provide his older children with the opportunity to pursue an education, which is necessary for them to have a better future, become prepared individuals, and deal with life in a much easier manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a bazaar.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is a mother of a two year old child. She has been farming for the past four years and was taught farming by her parents. 

She will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally for harvesting. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will increase her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for her rice farming.

loans.name: Padppa Dedokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PADPPA DEDOKPO est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent la même maison au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Oumè Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Oumè Séraphine est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Oumè Séraphine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de José. Le couple a quatre enfants, qui sont encore tous à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Oumè Séraphine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Oumè Séraphine vend depuis quarante ans des boissons non alcoolisées et de l'"Akassa", une pâte préparée sur la base de l'amidon de maïs. Oumè Séraphine s’approvisionne  dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Oumè Séraphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PADPPA DEDOKPO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
PADPPA DEDOKPO group comprises four persons, who live in the same house in Benin. The group leader, named Oumè Séraphine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 52 years old and married to a fisherman named José. The couple has four children, whom they still have to support. Some of them attend school.

Oumè Séraphine never went to school. To provide for herself and her children, she's been selling non-alcoholic beverages and "Akassa" (a paste made out of corn starch) for forty years. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's market.

In order to meet customer demand and increase her revenue and income, Oumè Séraphine, together with the other members of the group PADPPA DEDOKPO, is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy non-alcoholic beverages and corn

loans.name: Gladys Ximena

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector camino al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y fue nombrada así por la belleza de su arquitectura.

La Señora. Gladys tiene 29 años, es casada  y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en su propio taller, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Gladys labora como empleada privada y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa, realiza sus ventas ambulantemente y lleva 4 años en esta actividad.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de  blusas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa de niños para crecer en esta actividad.
  
Su meta es construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the communal bank Las Caleras. She lives in the Camino al Tejar area in the city of Cuenca, which is the third-most important city in the country. Since 1999 it has been listed as a UNESCO Cultural Heritage Site, due to the beauty of its architecture. 

Gladys is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children from her marriage, 13 and 11 years of age, who study at a school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic, and works in his own shop. She does not have her own house, and lives with her parents and shares the household expenses. 

Doña Gladys works as a housekeeper Monday to Saturday from 8 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon. In her free time, she sells clothing door-to-door, and has done so for 4 years. 

This is her fourth loan through the communal bank, and she plans to invest it in purchasing blouses, T-shirts, pants, and children's clothing to grow her business. Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, T-shirts, pants, and children's clothing

loans.name: Hanson

texts.en:
Hanson is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his small farm, which raises poultry. 

To help expand his business, Hanson has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hens, and will help Hanson to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Hanson hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger farm. 

Hanson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hanson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more hens for resale.

loans.name: Progresar Al Futuro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del banco comunal Progresar al Futuro viven en el sector nor-oriental de la provincia del Azuay en el cantón Paute (Cuenca), donde su gente es laboriosa y emprendedora, han sabido afrontar los desafíos, adaptarse a los cambios e innovar para liderar nuevas líneas de producción. Cuenta con gastronomía típica y gran variedad de platos. Las ferias de domingo son llenas de color por la vestimenta de su gente y por la variedad de productos que se venden. La producción frutícola es parte de la gran oferta de Paute, como la producción de flores que hacen de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación rosas de la más alta calidad y una gran variedad. Cuenta con varios miradores que facilitan vistas panorámicas del centro cantonal y sus alrededores.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora Rosa Elena, es socia del banco comunal Progresar al Futuro, vive por una comunidad del cantón Paute, tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, dos estudian en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Rosa Elena se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, y como pasa en casa tambien cría cuyes los cuales vende, otra de sus ocupaciones es la agricultura pero lo que produce es solo para su consumo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.

Por esta ocasión nos acompañan en la foto del grupo cuatro niños que son hijos de algunas de las socias. Un bebé que esta en brazos de su mamá, un niño que esta sentado con un pañuelo en la cabeza, un niño que esta parado en la segunda fila con chompa gris y una niña que esta parada atráz con una chompa café.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Progresar al Futuro” (Progress Toward the Future) live in the northeastern section of Azuay Province in the canton of Paute (Cuenca). The people who live there are hardworking, enterprising, and know how to confront challenges, adapt to change, and find new and innovative methods of production. This area offers traditional cuisine and a wide variety of dishes. At the Sunday fairs, people wear colorful outfits and sell a wide variety of products. The canton of Paute is truly known as a garden because of its fruit and flower production. A wide variety of high-quality roses are grown for export. There are several locations that provide panoramic views of the canton and the surrounding areas.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Rosa Elena. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Progresar al Futuro” and lives in a community within the canton of Paute. Rosa is 35 years old, married, and has five children (ages 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10). Her oldest daughter is married and independent. Two other children are in high school and the remaining two attend a smaller school in town. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Rosa’s family does not own a home, so they live at her mother’s house and share in the household expenses.

Doña Rosa Elena takes care of the household chores, but she also spends time raising guinea pigs to sell. She also devotes some time to farming, but what she produces is only for consumption by her family.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after having been invited by a friend. Her loan will be invested in construction materials so that she can finish her house.

On this occasion, four children are included in the photo since they are related to some of the members. There is a baby in the arms of her mother, a little boy who is seated with a bandana on his head, another boy on the second row with a gray sweatshirt, and a young girl standing at the back wearing a coffee-colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy materials for finishing the construction of her house.

loans.name: Duishokan's Group

texts.en:
The village of Kyzyl Suu is located on the southern shore of Lake Issyk Kul and is home to 15,000 people, most of whom make a living by farming, fishing, livestock breeding and tourism. Duishokan and her family have lived here for more than a decade. She has one son and earns a living as a farmer who cultivates a wide variety of crops. Today, she grows mostly potatoes because demand for them in Central Asia is quite high. By applying new technology, she manages to grow more potatoes every year, and this has allowed her to buy new furniture for her house. She earns about 2,000 soms a month and supplements her income by raising livestock. She is applying for this loan to buy fuel, lubricants and hay to feed to her livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fuel, lubricants and hay to feed to her livestock.

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en:
Tuyatsetseg is 22 years old and lives with her husband and mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her hairdressing business, which she started in 2008. Her salon is known for providing excellent service at an affordable price. However, her equipment is in unusable condition. 

Tuyatsetseg is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I never thought that I could go this far. Now that I have, I will work as hard as possible." She is requesting 1,500,000 to buy new equipment for her hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long, 31, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Long is a construction foreman, and his wife is employed at a garment factory in the city. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Long is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more construction supplies to expand his construction business. By doing so, he will be able to generate more income. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies to expand the business.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is married and blessed with three school aged children.  

She has been selling shoes for the last three years to support her family.  Stellah also does farming to supplement her income.  She has employed one person to assist her. 

Stellah has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. With 30,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy leather shoes to resale.

loans.use: to buy leather shoes to resale.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som is 46 years old and a single parent living with four children in Kompong Speu province. 

To earn a living, she grows rice crops in the rainy season but the profit is barely able to cover her daily cost. Therefore, all of children decided to help their mother in earning income by working in various careers. Three of her sons are now working together with a construction team that travels from place to place, while the daughter is on a sewing staff in a garment factory. 

With the loan of $1,000,  Som will buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family. She hopes that with it, her children can get to work easily without taking the motor-taxi service as in the old time.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, de 48 años, es una mujer amable y muy buena, esta casada desde hace muchos años y de su matrimonio tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y el menor de 12 años, ellos viven juntos como una familia muy unida en su casa propia que pudieron comprar en base a esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Laura consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, desde perfumes hasta cosméticos y productos de arreglo personal. Trabaja sola y vende a sus clientes quien en su mayoría son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, además de sus compañeros de trabajo, ya que labora en la municipalidad de la ciudad. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues le permite generar doble ingresos a su hogar y con eso poder pagar de manera puntual sus cuentas además de dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Cuando se inicio en su trabajo le era complicado pues tenía que convencer de la calidad de sus productos a sus clientes pero al fin pudo lograrlo y ahora es una excelente vendedora. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, entre los planes que tiene esta el de poder crecer con su actividad, además de empezar a vender en mayor cantidad y tener una pequeña boutique en su casa. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas como en sus créditos anteriores que tuvo, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos de belleza para tener en stock y así poder tener mas ingresos y ganar mayor porcentaje.
texts.en:
Laura is 48 years old and a very nice and friendly lady.  She’s been married for many years and has three children, ages 20, 17, and the youngest is 12.  They are very close and live together as a family in their home, which they were able to buy after much effort and sacrifice.

Laura’s work consists of selling beauty products, from perfumes to cosmetics, and personal grooming products.  She works on her own and most of her customers are her friends, neighbors, family, and co-workers, since she also has a job in town.  She really likes what she does because it allows her to have a double income, which allows her to make her payments on time and also provide a better quality of life for her children.

Things were complicated for her when she first started working because she had to convince her customers about the quality of her products.  In the end she was successful and is now an excellent salesperson.  She has many plans for the future, among them is growing with her business, selling in quantity, and opening a small boutique in her home.

This will be her third loan through MFP and she’s hoping for your help so that she can continue her objectives.  She is committed to making her payments on time, as she did with her previous loans.  She’s glad to be a part of the communal bank, since all of the members are united and responsible.  She will use the 1,500 PEN ($575) to buy beauty products to have them in stock, increase her income, and earn a higher percentage.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Five are studying, while her eldest son is working. Her second son is illiterate and stays at home. Her husband is a building contractor and a mason by profession.

A very supportive and talented lady with much passion for her work, Khalida operates a decorative embroidery business, having learned the art of embroidery from her mother before marriage. Her skills enable her to contribute financially to the family, as she earns a reasonably good income every month.

Khalida is now requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to purchase embroidery material such as beads, embroidery thread, etc. in bulk. These purchases will allow her to make better-looking embroidered clothes and increase her sales and income. Hoping that the loan will be productive, she aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beads and embroidery thread for embroidery business.

loans.name: Lorena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Lorena, Tiene 28 años de edad,  está  casada y de  esta bonita relación procreó 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años de edad, los dos mayores  están estudiando en la escuela.  Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella  junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, trabajan desde la madrugada hasta la tarde, ella vende en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño puesto y su esposo recorre la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo los martes, jueves y viernes, ella antes acompañaba a su esposo en sus recorridos pero ahora que sus hijos están en la escuela no puede porque tiene que ayudarlos y cuidarlos. Los productos los compran en Portoviejo porque allá se consiguen más baratos y de mejor calidad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas y verduras para su negocio. Este es su 8 ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The members of the "María Auxiliadora" communal bank meet in Sequita parish, in prosperous Montecristi canton, in Manabí province. This is a place full of dedicated, hard-working people, proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are decent eople, who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.

Lorena lives here. She is 28, married, and has three children, ages nine, seven, and four. The two eldest go to school. Her husband is a small business owner. 

She and her husband have a business selling fruit and vegetables. They work from dawn until evening. She sells from her house, as she has a small stand, and her husband travels through the city of Manta in a tricycle, on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays. She used to accompany her husband on his rounds, but now that her children are in school, she is unable to, because she has to help them and look after them. 

She buys her products in Portoviejo, because there they can be obtained more cheaply, and are of better quality. 

She is going to use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business. This is her eighth loan with the communal bank, and she likes it because of the support that the loans give them. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
Nancy Elena ha sido una persona golpeada por diferentes adversidades en la vida, pues desde hace ya un tiempo su esposo murió y quedó viuda a cargo de su hijo. Actualmente Nancy Elena, una madre soltera cabeza de familia, trabaja fuertemente con el ánimo de que su hijo pueda tener la mejor calidad de vida posible y pueda acceder a una buena educación que le permita desempeñarse laboralmente en un futuro. 
Nancy Elena es muy reconocida en su sector por ser una persona muy amable y con un corazón muy noble, pues siempre quiere ayudar a las personas que más lo necesitan. 
Nancy Elena desde hace 7 años montó su taller de confección, donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, y lo montó porque trabajaba en una empresa de confección donde aprendió la actividad, pero era muy mal remunerada. Desde entonces Nancy Elena viene trabajando fuertemente en su taller de confección y siempre busca que su negocio crezca para que pueda generar empleo y contratar a las personas más necesitadas. Actualmente Nancy Elena cuenta con 4 trabajadores y sus clientes son fieles a sus servicios, pues son de muy buena calidad. 
Nancy Elena en la actualidad requiere de la compra de una fileteadora para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller, y realizarle mantenimiento a otras 2 máquinas de su taller. Sin embargo, Nancy Elena no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que espera que un crédito le permita acceder a la compra de una fileteadora y a realizarle el mantenimiento que requiere 2 máquinas más. 
Nancy Elena espera que con la compra de la nueva máquina pueda generar otro puesto de trabajo, y seguir contribuyendo para que más personas puedan acceder a un trabajo remunerado y mejoren su calidad de vida. 
Nancy Elena tiene el gran sueño de que su taller crezca y pueda seguir ofreciendo más empleo y que su hijo pueda heredar una estabilidad económica que le permita progresar en un futuro.
texts.en:
Nancy Elena is a person who has been hit by life’s adversity. Some time ago, her husband died and she was left a widow with a son to support. Nowadays, she is a single mother who is head of the household. She works hard driven by the desire that her son have the best quality of life possible along with a good education that will enable him to get a good job in the future.

Nancy Elena is well known in the area as being a very kind person with a very noble heart. She is always ready to help those who most need it. Seven years ago she started her tailoring workshop where she offers services to third parties and she started it because she used to work in a tailoring business where she acquired the skill but was very badly paid. Since them she has been working very hard in her tailoring shop and she is always looking for ways to grow her business so that she can generate jobs and contract those most in need. Currently Nancy Elena has four workers and her customers are faithful because her work is of very good quality.

At present Nancy Elena needs to buy a threading machine to increase her shop’s productive capacity. She also needs to service two other machines in her workshop, however she lacks sufficient capital and hopes that a loan will enable her to buy the new machine and do necessary maintenance.

Nancy hopes that with the purchase of the threading machine she can generate another job and continue enabling more people to have access to paid work so they can improve their quality of life.

She has a big dream that her workshop will expand and she can continue offering employment and that her son will inherit economic stability enabling him to succeed in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a  threading machine and to service two machines in her workshop.

loans.name: Carlos Ulises

texts.es:
Carlos es propietario de un taller mecánico y enderezado de pintura para vehículos, tiene su negocio desde hace varios años, trabaja junto a tres empleados, su horario de atención a los clientes de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, ya cuenta con muchos clientes y por el momento no presenta dificultades en desarrollar sus trabajos. Carlos es casado vive con su esposa y un hijo de cuatro meses de nacido.
Con el capital comprara un soldador y un autógeno, podrá tener un mejor equipo para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, de esta manera su negocio será más competente y atraerá a nuevos clientes con lo que espera tener estabilidad económica.
Sus proyectos son adquirir un vehículo, seguir mejorando su taller y apoyar a su esposa a que tenga su negocio propio.

loans.use: comprara un soldador y un autógeno, podrá tener un mejor equipo para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock in saloon Equipments

loans.name: Makhira

texts.en:
This 52-year-old dairy woman has been in this business for 10 years. She is married and has 4 children, lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region . This business is the sole provider for her family’s livelhood.
Through her experience, Makhira has gained a great deal of knowledge and skills to improve her business.
She requests a loan of $800 to buy 2 milk cows.

loans.use: To buy 2 milk cows

loans.name: Ami

texts.en: Ami is married and lives with her husband and three small children in a small Samoan village.  Ami had previously lived in New Zealand, but she was eager to return to her native country to raise her family.  To support her family in Samoa, Ami opened a small village store in the front of her house.  She has used previous loans to launch her store and keep it stocked.  Ami has a strong history of repaying those loans in full and on time, and so she qualifies for another loan.  Ami would again use this loan to purchase shop inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to re-stock shop

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Mbalu K., is a married mother of two children and lives in Magburaka town in Northern Sierra Leone. Both Mbalu and her husband work at running a business of producing and selling smoked fish. Her husband deals mostly with the purchase of raw materials and smoking of the fish while Mbalu does the selling in the market.

With the income from their business, the couple is able to meet family expenses, but this forty-one year old mother is determined to provide her children with a good education. With the additional input of capital from this loan, Mbalu is confident that she will be able to make more profit and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for smoked fish production

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano O. Sosa, 41, is a married father of four children. In addition to owning a despensa (Spanish for 'pantry'), he has about 30 chickens and 1 pig. He bought the chickens about four years ago and plans to buy more from San Lorenzo in the following months. Each day his chickens produce about 25 eggs that he sells in his despensa.

Sinforiano sells a variety of food and household products such as sugar, rice, oil, bread, cookies, candy, drinks and soap at his dispensa. With the help of his wife, Sinforiano has been able to successfully run his business for the past five years. His wife is a seamstress and a haircutter.

Sinforiano is seeking a loan to expand his business. He plans to buy sugar and rice for his despensa; purchase more chickens to increase his profit margin; and to buy another pig by the end of the year. Every six months Sinforiano buys a new pig to resell in the future after it has grown. He also needs to buy more lettuce to feed his chickens.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, chicken, lettuce

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Morodjon is a music teacher. He teaches children to play the traditional tadjik instrument the rubob. He works in 3 schools simultaneously. In addition to that him and his two sons sells men's clothing and shoes at the main market in Spitamen. This year Murodjon has turned 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His elder son is in Russia earning money. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. He plans to continue working with MicroInvest and borrowing more money.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: To increase business size

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Nearly every single day, one can find Catalina nestled behind a fragrant pile of herbs and flowers that she sells in the city center of Ayacucho, Peru. As one walks past Catalina and the other women lined up on either side of her on the busy city sidewalks, the relaxing scents of mint, thyme, and oregano waft into the air. Catalina brings these herbs and flowers fresh cut from the countryside every single morning and continues selling until the sun sets. Her clients consist of everyone from mothers preparing the daily meal to lovesick boyfriends buying flowers for their sweethearts. She even sells to traditional healers who use these herbs as medicines, as each one has a specific healing property, explains Catalina. For example, thyme is often used in teas to ease an upset stomach.

Flowers and herbs are not the only thing Catalina sells in the busy city. She and her husband own a small field just outside the city where they plant and raise several different types of potatoes which are then sold in Ayacucho and two times each year taken in large loads to the capital Lima where they are also sold in the markets. Additionally, Catalina buys large supplies of cereals such as corn and barley which she sometimes sells along with her flowers and herbs.

Catalina says it is only thanks to her village bank that she has been able to venture into so many markets. Thanks to the economic support she has received through loans, she was able to purchase her field and begin growing potatoes, as well as begin buying and selling cereals. With the money she has been saving in the bank, Catalina has many goals she wishes to accomplish. First and foremost, Catalina is intent on funding the education of all 9 of her children, three of whom are already studying in the local university. In addition to this, Catalina would also like to make improvements to her home. She is currently requesting a loan of US$ 500. The majority of this money will be spent on fertilizer for her potatoes, as they have just recently been planted and are beginning to grow. The rest of the money will be spent on the purchase of large supplies of cereals to be sold in the city.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for potatoes and cereals to sell in the city

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida U. lives in Khujand. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and recommends herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial services and trade. She has a business in sweets selling (sweets, sugar, condensed milk, etc). Mrs.U. works in  the Panjshanbe bazaar, where her trade outlet is located. She has a wide assortment and permanent clients because she is very polite and well wishing. She is experienced in the business. Working in Panjshanbe bazaar she has stiff competition, which is why she wants to widen the existing assortment with a New Year goods purchase (gift sets). Now Mrs.U. requests a loan of 1,000 TJS  (US$300) for business development by the New Year good purchase. It permits her to increase the family's income and to plan further business modernization.

loans.use: business support and purchase goods for the New Year

loans.name: Nasuti A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for eighteen months. Catherine is 40 years old and a single mother with five children. She owns a small bar and she intends to use the extra business profits to pay school fees for her children. Florence has a bakery and wants to use the loan to buy more flour and other baking ingredients. Margret has a poultry business and Ruth makes and sells bricks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay school fees and increase the capacity of the group's businesses.

loans.name: Loth

texts.en:
Mrs. Loth S. is 57 years old. She is the owner of a grocery store and also takes care of one child. She earns about $2.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Tep Lan, is a junk stuff broker and earns about $5.00 dollar a day. Her 18 year old daughter is a student.

Mrs. S. needs more income to pay for her daughter's school fees and daily expenses. Along with her husband, she will use this loan to increase their stock of junk stuff. They request $1,200.00 and appreciate HKL's help.

loans.use: To buy junk stuff stock to generate more income

loans.name: Norma Marcela

texts.es:
Señora Norma Marcela López R. is 43 years old and studied completely through secondary school. Now she has three kids but only one still depends on her. She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Perú.

Señora Norma travels on Tuesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays to the district of Casa Grande in the province of Ascope in La Libertad, Perú. She makes sales with a little travelling shop that she attained many years ago. She takes advantage of the summer to carry around all types of sandals, which she sells at a very affordable price that's within reach of her clients. She began her business together with her husband. Before she worked for other people in shoe shops, and while she worked there, she learned how to make this product. From there grew the idea of opening up her shoe business.

She is a member of the community bank "Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos" (God Guides Our Steps), where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With that money she bought all the material necessary to make sandals for children and adults.

With the loan of 300 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she has planned to buy five dozen shoe soles, eight meters of leather, glue, and special boxes for shoes.

Her great dream is to have a bigger shop for making all types of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Norma Marcela López R. tiene 43 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Actualmente tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Norma viaja los días martes, sábados y domingos al distrito de Casa Grande en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú, vende en condición de ambulante en un pequeño sitio que consiguió hace muchos años. Aprovecha el verano para llevar todo tipo de sandalias el cual lo vende a un precio muy cómodo, que esta al alcance de sus clientes. Su negocio lo inicio junto con su esposo. Anteriormente trabajaba para otras personas en talleres de calzado; mientras permaneció allí aprendió a elaborar este producto. De esa manera nace la idea de emprender el negocio del calzado.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo el material necesario para elaborar sandalias para niñas y adultos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses tiene pensado comprar cinco docenas de planta, 8 metros de cuero, pegamento y cajas especiales para calzado.

Su mayor sueño es tener un taller mas grande para elaborar todo tipo de calzado.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products for making shoes.

loans.name: San Juditas 2 Group

texts.es:
Flor de Maria is 22 years old and for the past two years has been selling soft drinks out of her mother-in-law’s house since she does not own her own home. With the loan, she would like to buy a second hand refrigerator and more soft drinks. With the profits, she will sustain the business and provide for her son.

The other members of the group are Rosa del Carmen S. R., who sells fruit and vegetables; and Maria Elena D. M., who sells soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

FLOR DE MARIA DE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS VENDE REFRESCO EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRA, YA QUE NO CUENTA CON CASA PROPIA, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR UN REFRIGERADOR DE MEDIO USO Y MAS REFRESCOS, LA GANACIA LA DESTINA A MANTENER EL NEGOCIO Y A LAS COSAS QUE NECESITA SU HIJO, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. ROSA DEL CARMEN S. R. VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS Y MARIA ELENA D. M. VENDE REFRESCOS.

loans.use: Purchase a second hand refrigerator and merchandise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 31 years old, she is single and supports only herself. She sells clothes, especially for ladies, she buys at the market and sells on credit with weekly payments. She has been carrying out this activity for 5 years. In spite of the competition Hilda has established a business with many customers who buy from her on a regular basis. With the present request she will buy merchandise to increase her sales. This is her third loan from Agrocapital y during the commercial relationship with the institution she has proven to be a very responsible person, and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda tiene 31 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de prendas de vestir especialmente ropa para damas, compra en la feria y entrega al crédito con pagos semanales. Hilda es una persona soltera y no tiene dependientes. Tiene una experiencia de 5 años en esta actividad.
