Si existe bastante competencia, Hilda ha logrado establecer una buena clientela que demanda sus productos de manera constante. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá mercadería para incrementar sus operaciones. Esta es su tercera actividad en Agrocapital y durante el tiempo de relación comercial con la institución demostró ser una persona muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim Bangural is 50 years old and a father to 6 children. He has been self-employed as a tailor for 30 years. With his previous loan from Kiva, he purchased 2 sewing machines and employed two tailors to assist with the business. Ibrahim is happy that his business is growing and 2 of his children will soon enter college. He is requesting another loan to purchase more materials as his clientele has increased.

Other group members are engaged in various retail businesses and would like to expand their businesses. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.3,800,000.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine, sewing materials, and inventory for general stores

loans.name: Altine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Altiné K. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her 6 children in a monogamous household in the Hérémakono Nord district in the city of Bougouni (Sikasso region in the Republic of Mali). Since she was young, she has tried many businesses without success but ended up specializing in making wheat donuts, which she has learned from her grandmother over the last 20 years. She enjoys an unparalleled reputation in her area, one of the most populated in the capital of Banimonotié Bougouni. In her search for complementary financial resources, she decided to try the loan program from microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having obtained 3 group loans with a local association, she moved on to individual loans; she is on her 3rd loan. Each of her loans were repaid without difficulty. She would like this loan to buy 2 bags of wheat flour, 20 liters of cooking oil, and 2 loads of firewood. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the big market in Bougouni and cooks in front of her door, located in the Heremakono district. The donuts she makes are sold at a set price in front of her home, and the clientele consists of every social class in the city. With the help of the loan, she plans to be able to earn 50,000 CFA francs per month, which will be used to pay interest on her loan, improve her business, and contribute to her family’s expenditures.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Altiné K. est agée de 40 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (Région de Sikasso République du Mali). Dès son jeune age elle tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès mais fini par se spécialiser dans la fabrication des baignés de farine de blé apprise auprés de sa grand mère depuis 20 ans.Elle jouit d’une réputation sans pareille dnas son quartier un des plus peuplés dela capitale du Banimonotié Bougouni. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso Après avoir bouclé 3 prets de groupe(pret solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est passée au prêt individuel ou elle est à son 3e.Tous les précédents ont été remboursées sans difficulté Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle veut ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de farine de blé, 20 litres d’huile de cuisine et 2 chargements de bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossiste et fait sa cuisine devant sa porte sise au quartier Heremakono Les baignés ainsi fabriqués sont vendus de facon fixe devant la dite concession conjugale et la clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de la cité. Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. qui sera utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt, améliorer son entreprise et contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.

Aurea es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Aurea vende quesos de casa en casa, los quesos los adquiere de intermediarios que compran en las ferias, en el ultimo mes dejo de vender porque el queso ha subido mucho de precio. Aurea también viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende cereales, quesos y tiene terrenos en donde cultiva cacao. Además Aurea y su esposo tienen una carpintería en su casa.

Aurea necesita un préstamo de 2000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de maderas y para el pago de peones.

Aurea sueña con equipar su carpintería con más maquinarias, que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, construir su casa e implementar una tienda.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Aurea is a partner in the Communal Prosperity Bank.

Aurea is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. Aurea goes house to house selling cheese that she acquires from middlemen who sell them at markets; in the last month she stopped selling because cheese has risen significantly in price. Aurea also travels to the Ayacucho jungle where she sells cereals, cheeses and cocoa. Aurea and her husband also have a carpenter workshop at home.

Aurea needs a 2000 loan to invest in the purchase of timber and for the payment of workmen.

Aurea dreams of having her carpentry workshop with more machinery so that when her children finish their studies they can build their home and implement a store.

loans.use: She needs a 2000 loan to invest in the purchase of timber and for the payment of workmen.

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es: La profesora Johana del Socorro, soltera de 37 años de edad, con una hija de 6 años la que está estudiando 1er. Grado, es trabajadora del INTAE, se desempeña como responsable de certificación.  Está solicitando su crédito No.7 el que utilizará para compra de  materiales de construción como piedra cantera y hierro, posteriormene comprará el cemento y otros materiales para realizar la contrucción de un cuarto. Johana ha demostrado responsabilidad y honradez en los créditos que hasta ahora se le han otorgado, y entre sus compañeros es reconocida también como una persona trabajadora y servicial.  Le gustaria optar por un crédito mayor y a mayor plazo para poder resolver el problema de su vivienda, no cuenta con ningún apoyo, ella es madre y padre para su hija.
texts.en:
Johana del Socorro, a teacher and 37 year old single woman, has a 6 year old daughter who is in first grade. Johana works at INTAE, and has the responsibility of certification. She is asking for her seventh loan, which she will use to purchase construction materials like stone quarries and iron. Next, she will buy cement and other materials in order to build a room. Johana has demonstrated responsibility and honesty with the loans that she has been granted so far. Moreover, she is known as a worker and helper among her friends. She would like a bigger loan and a longer period of time in order to solve her housing problem, not to mention that she is without help as both the mother and father for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone quarries and iron

loans.name: Espigas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Espigas de Oro” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo su tercer ciclo de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes, de la ciudad de El Alto a la fecha el grupo  cuenta con 18 socias, que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos  lastimosamente  sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar  la escuela. Ya que estos deben ayudar a sus padres en sus pequeños negocios.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, la venta  de lácteos, ropa ligera, pero la actividad principal es la venta de papa, Lucia por ejemplo al igual que sus compañeras, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, vende este producto junto a su padre en el mercado de la Ceja (zona central de la ciudad de el Alto). La asociación Espigas de Oro necesita de  capital  para comprar productos en mayor cantidad, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The association "Espigas de Oro" belongs to the same business family of Pro-Mujer. Many years ago they completed their third loan cycle. The association is located in the region of Los Andes in the city of El Alto. To date, the group consists of 18 members and they have shown themselves to be a well-organized group especially when dealing with their loan.

The members of the group are mostly married women with children, most of whom are school-aged. There are a few children that were sadly forced to leave school because their family lacked financial resources, and they end up helping the parents run the small businesses.

Many types of businesses are being run by the members of the group, such as: food sales, dairy sales, and clothing sales. But the most common business is the sale of potatoes. Lucia, for example, much like her other colleagues, she has been selling for a great long while alongside her father in the markets of Ceja (the central region of the city of El Alto). The association "Espigas de Oro" requires working capital to purchase products in greater quantities, with the aim of increasing their earnings to establish a better financial situation for their homes.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase products in greater quantities.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Née en 1985 à Agoè, madame L. Adjovi est une jeune commerçante qui a en charge 03 enfants. Résidant à Adétikopé avec son mari, où elle vend de l’arachide, activités qu’elle gère bien. Honnête, elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son activité. 

Pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter en quantité suffisante de l’arachide qu’elle pourra vendre en temps de rareté. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Agoè, Ms. Adjovi L. is a young merchant who has three children in her care. She lives with her husband in Adétikopé, where she sells peanuts, a business she manages well. An honest woman, she has perfect command of her work.

To bolster her business and to make it profitable, she is requesting a loan for buying enough peanuts to sell whenever they are rare. This will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and sale of peanuts

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary K., 44, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Khem, 43, live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have five children: one son and four daughters. One daughter is married and lives outside the family home. One daughter is learning beautician skills, their son is a worker in the village, and the other two daughters study at the local school.

Mrs. Sary and her husband have been raising pigs for six years.  Besides raising pigs, they also mill rice in front of their house to get extra income. Now, the couple needs to create another business of raising ducks. Therefore, Sary is requesting a loan to run her business of raising ducks.

loans.use: To purchase ducks for raising.

loans.name: Noella

texts.en: Noella T. is 32 years old and married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience with preparing and selling chips. She sells to the people of her village and the general public six days of the week. She has had no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Noella’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.The purpose of the loan is to purchase a frying pan, a cooking pot and other cooking equipment.

loans.use: To buy a frying pan, a big spoon, a cooking pot, vegetable oil, and salt

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K., 45, and her husband, Mr. An Nao, 61, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1983 and have seven children. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home; one of her daughters attends school and another one stays at home.

Pov has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old, a skill she learned from a relative. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer. He grows jicamas and corn in the farm a distance from his house. Pov is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: P., 40, lives with her child who attends school everyday. P. is married to Vanna who sells ice-cream with his tri-wheel motor. P. owns a house which contains many rooms for renting. Recently, in order to meet her customers' demand, P. wants to build a few rooms upon the available space of her land. To do so, P. is looking for a loan of $700 to build the other rent rooms for another income for her family.

loans.use: To build the other rent rooms

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 35 years old. She is married and has given birth to one daughter and two sons. One of her children is in senior high school while the rest are in the basic school. She lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband works with a local forest division.

Ama sells beverages to support her husband financially. She prepares porridge, tea, wheat porridge, rice porridge and oats, and fries doughnuts as well. She sells on a table by the roadside from the afternoon until evening.

Ama procures her materials from Kumasi at cost-effective prices. She has been in business for six years. Ama says she wants a loan to buy the ingredients in bulk. It is her dream to help her children have access to a good education.

loans.use: To procure ingredients

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El negocio del señor Adrian Zambraba es el de fotógrafo. Su actividad se lleva a cabo por lo general ambulantemente en diversas actividades tomando fotografías y filmando algún evento especial siendo este trabajo el sustento de su hogar en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Es de importancia destacar que hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito porque requiere de la compra de los materiales de trabajo como lo son los rollos para revelado, cassettes y películas de videos para continuar con su actividad de fotografía.
texts.en:
Adrian Zambraba is a photographer. He usually conducts business at various events taking pictures and filming special events. His work allows him to support his family in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino. It is noteworthy that he has approached Ceprodel for a loan because he needs to buy materials for his business such as rolls of film for developing, cassettes and videotapes in order to continue with his photography business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his photography business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Ann is a hardworking woman who has been engaged in the business of selling women's shoes for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more women's shoes for sale. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Mrs.Alejandra M., 36, is married and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has two children and her husband is a “sikad” (bicycle with a cab) driver. Because she could not get a good job, she decided to open a food-vending business.

With the family's financial difficulties, Mrs. M. joined Paglaum MPC for financial assistance, but she was also happy knowing that she will also be able to save part of her income and obtain other benefits offered by the Cooperative. Now she requests PHP 10,000 for additional capital for her food-vending business. Her greatest desire is to see her children finish their studies and live a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: Addtional capital for food vending

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Абдукаюмова Саломат-женщина 28-ми лет,замужем , имеет двоих детей. Занимается продажей муки на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района. Один  раз в месяц она закупает муку у оптовиков и продаёт на рынке по розничной цене. Раньше у неё хватало денег только на 10-12 мешков муки, теперь расширив свой товарооборот она закупает около 100 мешков муки.Кроме этого Саломат работает в школе, преподаёт родной язык  в одной из сельских школ. Пока она на работе  на рынке торгует её муж. Они с мужем рады ,что обратившись в нашу организацию, получили возможность расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Salomat A. is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is involved in selling flour at a food market in the Spitamen district. She buys flour wholesale once per month and sells it retail at the market. Before, she could afford to buy only 10-12 bags of flour, and now, after increasing her product turnover, she buys close to 100 bags of flour. Besides this business, Salomat teaches Tajik language at one of the village schools. While she works at the school, her husband sells at the market. Salomat and her husband are happy that they requested a loan from our organization and were able to expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Touni

texts.en: Mrs. S. R. is 29 years old. She stays at home to take care of her two children and is responsible for the daily routine. She currently relies on income from her husband's taxi business and uses this income to manage the entire family's daily food. Her husband owns a car to provide a taxi service. S. R.'s husband can't generate as much profit as before because their old taxi is not attractive. Because of this bad condition, S. R. is applying for a $1200 loan to add to her savings to replace their existing taxi. She also proposes to run a suitable business as a fake jewelry seller in the market using some of this loan.

loans.use: To replace their existing taxi

loans.name: Muslh

texts.en:
Muslh is a successful 24 year-old entrepreneur. He is single and lives with his parents. He manages a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs, including sweets, soft drinks, and juice.

Muslh needs a loan of $2000 to be able to increase the stock of goods in his store. He is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods in his store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita O. lives in the town of Plaridel. She is 50 years old, married, and makes a living by owning and running a small grocery store where she sells snacks and other delicacies to people of her community. Julita has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2004, Julita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid six prior loans from PMPC, which she has used to buy items to sell. Julita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to increase her inventories and supply of working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and working capital

loans.name: Dorm

texts.en:
Dorm P., 40, is married and has two school-age children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works as a farmer, typically earning $3 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a skillful fisherman who works hard every day at nearby fishing spots, typically earning $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her husband’s business. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase fishing tools, a purchase with which she sees an opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 39 years old. She is married with a child who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in her community. Leticia trades in soft drinks like Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Pepsi, etc. She buys the drinks from wholesale points and sells them to her customers. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy drinks in bulk to expand her business. She desires to give her child a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 34 años, está separada de su pareja y tiene 2 hijos; uno de ellos cursa estudios primarios y el otro es un bebé de 9 meses. Ella tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes (arroz, leche, huevo, azúcar, etc.), golosinas, bebidas y productos de primeros auxilios como alcohol, algodón, vendas, gasas, entre otros. Esta tienda la implementó hace 5 años en un espacio de su propia casa, a raíz de su separación conyugal, lo cual no impidió su progreso. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es aprender sobre técnicas de venta, además que con esta actividad puede solventar las necesidades familiares. Afortunadamente, su tienda se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona por donde transitan muchas personas, por lo que tiene varios clientes que le dejan considerables ganancias diarias.
Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo más le gusta es que se lleva muy bien con sus compañeros, hay comunicación y todos son responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Domitila is 34 years old, is separated from her partner, and has two children: one of those is in primary school, and the other is a baby of 9 months. She has a store where she sells groceries (rice, milk, eggs, sugar, etc), candy, drinks and first aid products such as alcohol, cotton wool, bandages, gauze, among others. She opened this store 5 years ago in a space in her own home. Her separation has not impeded her progress. What she would most like for her business is to learn about sales techniques. In addition, with this activity she could address the family's needs. Fortunately, her store is located in a good zone where many people pass by, and because of this she has many customers who spend considerable sums daily. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. She is part of a communal bank and what she likes the most is that she gets along very well with the other members, there is good communication and everyone is responsible in their payments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more products in order to increase the stock of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame n’est pas mariée mais a un enfant à sa charge ; c’est pour subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi à ceux de son enfant qu’elle s’est lancée en 2000 dans la vente de maïs dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle dispose dans le marché d’un entrepôt de maïs qu’elle a loué. Elle vend en gros mais aussi en détail à des revendeuses ambulantes du marché ; elle réalise ces temps-ci de très bonnes affaires ; elle a même recruté une jeune fille pour l’aider dans on commerce. Elle a un besoin urgent en ce moment de constituer des stocks en provisions ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 15 sacs de maïs. Elle  a une réelle assurance qu’elle remboursera le prêt à temps.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs

loans.name: Osaigbovo

texts.en: H. is 55years old and married with 7 children, She sells frozen food, foodstuff and provision. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions and frozen food. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and provision to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora ANA MARIA P. P., tiene 47 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS AURORAS EN ACCION. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ro. de secundaria no pudo continuar sus estudios porque a temprana edad quedo embarazada y tuvo que dedicarse a las labores del hogar y a la crianza de sus hijos. Ana  es madre soltera por lo cual desde joven tuvo que trabajar para criar a su hijos sin ayuda de nadie, tiene 5 hijos  de los cuales 3 y 1 nieto dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de combustibles de las lanchas del puerto. Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles empezó a  vender menús y comprò productos alimenticios al por mayor como: arroz , azúcar, papa, menestras, aceite, fideos, etc.
Con este crédito de 2,300 nuevos soles comprará un moto taxi para poder así repartir y transportar el combustible que vende a las lanchas.
Ana sueña con comprar más moto taxis y alquilarlas para así poder aumentar sus ganancias y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y nieto
texts.en:
Ana Maria P. P. is 47 years old and lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad. She belongs to the “Las Auroras En Acción” Communal Bank. Ana went to school up to the third year of high school but could not continue because she became pregnant and had to devote herself to the home and the raising of her children. She is a single mother and has had to work from an early age to support her children without help. She has five children, and three of these, plus a grandson, depend on her economically.

Ana’s business is selling fuel to boats in the port. With her first loan of 300 soles, she began also selling food, and she purchased wholesale foods: rice, sugar, potatoes, beans, oil, pasta, etc.

With this credit of 2300 soles, she will buy a moto-taxi (a motorcycle with attached cab) to deliver the fuel to the boats. Ana dreams of buying more moto-taxis and renting them out. This would increase her earnings and allow her to buy the necessities for her children and grandson.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a moto-taxi

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
El Sra. Mariana la cliente antigua en la institucion, es nacida en Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, vive en la localidad D. Santa Martha, aproximadamente a 20 Kms D. El Torno. Su actividad economica principal es la venta D. ropa nueva en el Mercado Central; el esposo es chofer asalariado D. profesión; pese a que son jovenes tienen 5 hijos todos en edad escolar, por lo tanto el esfuerzo D. ambos tiene que ser el doble para tratar D. sacar adelante a su familia.
El destino del crédito es para la compra D. un puesto en el mercado El Torno, ya que en que estan actualmente es alquilado.
texts.en:
. Mariana has been a client of the institution for a long time. She was born in Santa Cruz D. la Sierra and lives in Santa Martha, which is approximately 20 kms. from El Torno. She sells new clothing in the Central Market. Her husband is a salaried driver. Despite their youth, they have five school-age children which means that both parents must work twice as hard to see the family get ahead. This financing will be used to buy a stall in the El Torno market since they currently lease the one they are using.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market.

loans.name: Julian Reyes

texts.es:
Julián Reyes y su esposa son una familia unida que inspira confianza. A pesar D. L. edad ellos no han dejado D. trabajar para mantenerse, hace cuatro años buscaron L. manera D. ganar dinero y decidieron poner un negocio D. abarrotes, por que en L. colonia donD. viven las tiendas son muy escasas. Esta tienda es nombrada “Miscelánea Los tres Vallejos” que da honor a su apellido y a L. cantidad D. hijos que tiene. 
Sus hijos lo apoyan económicamente; desD. hace varios años ellos decidieron cruzar a los estados Unidos para obtener un mejor trabajo y dar mejor calidad a sus hijos como a sus  padres que viven en México. Julián se ve el necesidad D. surtir su negocio por L. época naviD.ña por que viene mucha gente D. fuera D. L. ciudad y hay más compra D. refrescos, frituras y abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Julián Reyes and his wife are a close family who inspire confidence. In spite of their age, they haven't stopped working to support themselves. Four years ago, they looked for a way to earn money and they decdied to start a grocery business. In the area where they live, stores are very scarce. This store is called, "Miscelánea Los Tres Vallejos" (The Three Vallejos Miscellaneous), which honors their last name and the number of kids they have. Their children support them economically. Several years ago, their kids decided to go to the United States to get better jobs and to improve their children's quality of life as well as that of their parents, who live in Mexico. Julián sees the need to supply his business for the Christmas season because many people come from outsiD. the city and they will buy more soft drinks, fried foods, and groceries in general.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock merchandise

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Nyoka is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
N. Azam is 41 years old. He is married and has two children His wife is a housekeeper. Azam is processing and selling dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making the dried apricots. As a rule he purchases dried apricot in the market and processes them himself. Because he buys dried apricot wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Azam to make his business quite successful and it brings the stable income for the family. Today Azam requests $1500 USD for purchasing dried apricot further to process it and to sell. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Azam expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase his range of goods.

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Magna es soltera, tiene 29 años y vive con sus padres, trabaja en una Municipalidad, Magna viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales y lo venD. en el mercado D. abastos, actividad que realiza los días sábados.
Magna necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cereales.
Los sueños D. Magna son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Magna is a member of the Communal Bank “Pura Vida” (Pure Life). She is 29 years old, single, lives with her parents, and works in the city. Magna travels to the fairs where she sells grain at the food market. She engages in this business every Saturday.

Magna needs a loan of 900 soles in order to buy more grain. She dreams of purchasing a car for transporting her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Parima Group

texts.en:
Asifa is the group leader of Parima group.She is married and she lives in a family of three members.She, her husband and her son. She lives in Kabul Aghanistan. She wants to take this loan for her son. He has a general store and he is involved in this business for more then three years.Although, his business has been steady the demands of the market has expanded. Also, he is determined to support his father and her mother Asifa who is a hard working woman.Her son needs this loan to purchase more stock for his shop.
She hopes that her son will grow his business through this loan and stand on his feet. 
Asifa is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing stocks

loans.name: Evans Wangila

texts.en:
Evans W. is a 40-year-old widower with four children who are all in primary school. He repairs bicycles in Chekulo, a small town in the Western Province, and has been in this business for the last 10 years. Evan’s wife died and left him with the responsibility of looking after the children single-handedly, which is a great task for him.

Evans is taking out his second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first one. He is thankful for the Kiva lenders who assisted him. He is now looking for a Kiva lender to help him get another loan to enable him to buy more bicycle spare parts and inventory for his bicycle repair shop. This will enable him to improve his business by repairing all the bicycles that are awaiting spare parts. 

He hopes to use the profits made to pay school fees for his children, pay rent and for family upkeep since his children are dependent on him. Evans also hopes to diversify into the bicycle spare parts business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is 36 years old, married and has a child aged 6 years. She sells 'fairly used' clothes and has been in business for the past three years. She is focused on making sure she meets the demand of her customers, which she said will also lead to increase in profit. She wants to expand the size of her business and improve her living standard.

Suzan is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more 'fairly used' clothes to sell as this will enable her to get a better discount and make more profit on each sale. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To buy more 'fairly used' clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Basilia R., tiene un tramo en el mercado central ubicado en el sector madera lleva mas de de 20 años de estar con su negocio.
Los financiamientos la señora R. los solicita para comprar mercaderia que le llegan a vender a su negocio  y para comprar madera para que con la ayuda de su esposo elaboren los productos que en su negocio venden ya que con la ayuda de Dios tienen un taller en su casa y ahí elaboran algunos de los productos que venden o que les encargan.
La señora R. es madre de cinco hijos todos en edad escolar lucha por vender y sacar el bocado diario para sus hijos, en la entrevista nos manifestó que con estos créditos ella ha mejorado su calidad  de vida,  tambien ella se ayuda con la elaboración de piñatas.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Basilia R. has a section in the wood sector in the central market. She has had her business for more than 20 years. She is seeking financing to buy merchandise that she will sell in her business and also to buy wood so that with the help of her husband they can make the products that they sell in their business, since, with the help of God, they have a workshop in their house, and there they make some of the products that they sell or are ordered.

Señora R. is the mother of five children, all of school age. She works hard to sell and to obtain daily food for her children. In the interview, she declared that with these loans she has improved their quality of life. She also helps herself by making piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her buisness and wood for furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her business

loans.name: Phai

texts.en: Phai S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman in the province, earning an income of USD 5.8 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase cows. She will breed and raise the cows for calves to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to build a new house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise.

loans.name: Margie's Group

texts.en:
Margie J. is from Bautista, San Agustin. She is the leader of a 16-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Margie J.'s group.

Margie is 29 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be Margie’s second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rina Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Rina es una excelente socia muy responsable del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército, se desempeña como comerciante, desde hace 2 años tiene   cabinas telefónicas a cargo de un sobrino, mientras que ella se dedica a su restáurate que lo tiene desde hace 10 años en la terminal terrestre de la ciudad de Portoviejo, sus dos negocios quedan juntos y desde muy temprano en la mañana empieza atender.

Nuestra socia Rina es una mujer que le encanta trabajar y que no importa todo el sacrificio que  tiene que hacer para mantener sus negocios, a las 4 de la mañana ella va al  mercado central de la ciudad para comprar todo lo necesario para su restaurante y a las 7 está atendiendo a sus clientes con el desayuno, y una vez que termine de vender el desayuno empieza a preparar los alimentos para el almuerzo, a las 5 de la tarde está desocupada de sus actividades.

La señora Rina se mantiene desde hace dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y con los créditos a sabido mantener sus negocios, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en comprar productos como víveres, legumbres, embutidos y carnes para preparar los diferentes platos a sus clientes, además quiere invertir en un nuevo negocio que sería un bar, donde pueda vender batidos, tostadas en el mismo sector que tiene sus otros dos negocios.

Todo lo que ella hace es por el bienestar de sus hijos, cuenta la señora Rina que una hija estudia en la Universidad y sus otros hijos están con el papá en Quito, el sueño para ella es tener una finca y disfrutar de la vida.
texts.en:
Rina is an outstanding and very responsible member of the "Av. Del Ejército" ("Army Avenue") communal bank. She works as a businessperson; for the past two years, she has operated telephone call booths, which are managed by her nephew. At the same time, she also runs a restaurant, which she has operated for the past 10 years in the bus station of the city of Portoviejo. Her two businesses are next to each other, and she starts work there very early in the morning. Rina is a woman who loves to work, and she does not mind all the sacrifices she has to make to maintain her businesses. At 4 in the morning, she goes to the city's central market to buy everything she needs for her restaurant, and at 7, she is already serving breakfast to her customers. Once breakfast is over, she begins preparing the food for lunch, and at 5 in the evening she ends her workday. Rina has been a member of her communal bank for two loan cycles, and she has been able to maintain her businesses with the loans. With this new loan, she will invest in buying products such as fruits, beans, meats, lunch meat, and other grocery items to prepare the various foods she offers her customers. She also wants to invest in a new business: a snack bar where she can sell fruit smoothies and toasted sandwiches in the same area where she has her other two businesses. Rina reports that everything she does is for the well-being of her children; one daughter is studying at the university, and her other children are with their father in Quito. Her dream is to have a farm and enjoy life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, rice, beans, potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion J. is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Consolacion plants and harvests rice to sell. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Consolacion joined ASKI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from ASKI. Consolacion is requesting her third loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
N. Gorretti is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera, in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has one child. Gorretti has a business selling fish around her village in Kyotera. She has had her business for about five months.  

To expand her business, Gorretti is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of fish, which Gorretti will then resell in town. Gorretti hopes to expand and diversify her fish-selling business, selling other types of products and generating more profits.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and to improve their prospects for the future. It targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance organizations. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and it gives Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and to support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Concepción

texts.es: Elizabeth Concepción P. de 40 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por: su esposo, el cual trabaja como agricultor, así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 20, 14, 12 y 8 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor trabaja como mecánico y los tres menores que se dedican a estudiar. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de verduras, y su puesto esta ubicado a las afueras del mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, frente al parque Daniel Hernández, un lugar en el cual existe gran afluencia de personas ya que es un lugar muy céntrico en el cual existen diferentes paradas de buses y diferentes tipos de ventas. Ella es una persona muy inteligente, la cual también se dedica a la plantación de pepino en su casa de habitación, cosecha la cual luego incluye en sus ventas. Elizabeth solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras para invertir en su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, ella cuenta con la gran ventaja de estar ubicada sobre calle principal, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas ganancias, y es por esto que ella espera poder contar con más verduras y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Concepción P., 40, lives in Santa Tecla, La Libertad department. She lives with her family which is composed of her husband, who is a farmer, and their four children who are 20, 14, 12 and 8 years of age. Their oldest son works as a mechanic and the other three children are students. Elizabeth is a vegetable merchant; her stand is located outside Santa Tecla’s municipal market in front of Daniel Hernández park. This is a place with lots of foot traffic because it’s centrally located and several bus stops are there as well as many businesses selling a variety of items. She is a very intelligent person. She also grows cucumbers in her yard that she includes in her sales. Elizabeth is asking for funds to buy larger amounts of vegetables to invest in her business so that she can have more variety to offer. She has the great advantage of being located on the main street so her profits are good so she hopes to stock more vegetables so that her sales will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Sumac Puririsun” actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta de comida, venta de cuyes y gallinas, venta de artesanía, venta de pasto, venta de rocoto relleno y venta de tamales. Otros socios brindan servicios de cuidado de niños y obrero. 

Neil, tiene 24 años y tiene un hijo, ella nació en el distrito Cusipata que esta ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Neil desde los 11 años está rodeada del negocio de venta de tamales. Su cuñada Nayda se dedicaba a la preparación de tamales y Neil le ayudaba a su cuñada a vender los tamales en los buses que se dirigían de la ciudad de Sicuani a la ciudad del Cusco. Ella subía a los carros y se suplicaba a los choferes para que ella pueda ofrecer sus tamales. Hace varios años atrás se caso y tuvo que venirse a vivir a la ciudad del Cusco para esta al lado de su esposo. 

Decidida a empezar una nueva vida, se mudo al Cusco. Utilizo sus ahorros para preparar y vender los tamales en el terminal terrestre de buses de la ciudad del Cusco, donde ella sube a los buses y ofrece a los viajeros. La pueden encontrar en el terminal, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde o hasta que se agote los tamales, Ella  vende tamales de dos sabores de sal y de azúcar a un costo de 0.50 soles cada tamal.

Con su próximo préstamo, Neil espera recibir S/. 1000 soles. Le gustaría comprar maíz, hoja de planta de maíz, azúcar, huevos, pasas y muchos insumos más. Por ahora, Neil está preocupada porque el director del terminal le quiere desalojar y le está obligando a alquilar un puesto D. venta pero ella no cuenta con suficiente dinero para alquilar.  El sueño de la socia es abrir una pequeña tienda de venta de comestibles en su domicilio y desea convertirse en una microempresaria.
texts.en:
The “Sumac Puririsun” communal bank is currently in its third loan cycle. It is made up of hard-working and enterprising people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and to give their children a better future through their daily efforts. The communal bank's meetings are held every 30 days at the central office of the Arariwa Association. The economic activities of some of the members are, for example, selling food, selling hens and guinea pigs, selling handicrafts, selling hay, selling stuffed peppers, and selling tamales. Other members provide services such as child care and manual labor. Neil is 24 years old and has one child. She was born in Cusipata district, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and she currently lives in the city of Cusco. Since she was 11 years old, Neil has been surrounded by the business of selling tamales. Her sister-in-law Nayda went into the business of preparing tamales, and Neil helped her sell the tamales in the buses that travel from the city of Sicuani to Cusco. She got into the buses and asked the drivers if she could offer her tamales to the passengers. Several years ago, she got married and had to come live in the city of Cusco to be with her husband. Determined to start a new life, she moved to Cusco. She used her savings to prepare tamales and sell them at the bus station in Cusco, where she gets on the buses and offers them to the travelers. She can be found at the terminal 7 days a week, from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening, or until the tamales run out. She sells tamales in two varieties, sweet and savory, at a price of 0.50 soles each. For her next loan, Neil hopes to receive 1000 Peruvian soles. She would like to buy corn, corn husks, sugar, eggs, raisins and many more ingredients. At present, Neil is worried because the director of the bus terminal wants to evict her; he is requiring her to rent a sales stand, but she does not have enough money to rent one. Her dream is to open a small food store in her home, and she would like to become a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, corn husks, sugar, eggs, raisins and many more supplies

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Luisa R. es soltera tiene un hijo pequeño labora para LOTERIA NACIONAL como cajera su labor consiste en recibir efectivo producto de la venta de billetes de lotería.
De los dos préstamos obtenidos en CEPRODEL  he logrado mejorar algunos detalles como hacer el baño de mi casa y reparaciones en general.
Me siento contenta ya que poco a poco he ido dando respuestas a las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa R. is single and has one small child. She works as a cashier for the national lottery. Her work consists of receiving cash proceeds from the sale of lottery tickets. She used her two previous loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL to make some improvements to her home, such as building the bathroom in her home and making general repairs. Luisa feels happy because little by little she is managing to meet the needs of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for making home improvements.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza de 39 años, ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso”.  

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia y tener una mejor estabilidad económica, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería en su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, libros y papelería, en el futuro quiere darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 39 years old and has a stationery shop (also known in Ecuador as a “bazaar”) in her home where she sells beverages, paper goods, and notebooks. She lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called “Paraíso”.

Maritza started her stationery shop because she needed to support her family and have better financial stability. She began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to neighbors and acquaintances. When she accumulated enough money, Maritza was able to open a small stationery shop in her home. She works every day from 7am to 9pm.

In order to increase her inventory, Maritza will use this loan to buy notebooks, books, and stationery. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, books, and stationery

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 29 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Denia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Aunque Elizabeth no pudo cursar estudios superiores, siempre trato de sobresalir y demostrar que podía llevar una vida normal, actualmente se dedica al cultivo de plátano y café, actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeña y que ahora le brinda los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace siempre con una sonrisa, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la cantidad de sus cultivos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y la guiarán, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 29, is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Denia. What she wishes for most is to improve her quality of life. Even though Elizabeth was not able to get a higher education, she always tried to excel and demonstrate that she was able to lead a normal life. She currently grows bananas and coffee. She learned this activity when she was very little. Now, it gives her the necessary income to support her family. What she likes the most about her work is harvesting her fields. This always makes her smile. She has been doing this work for nine years. She considers the most difficult part to be having to take care of the plants so that they are not harmed by insect infestations. In time she wishes to buy new land to increase the quantity of her crops. This is her third loan with MFP. She wants to make her payments on time because she wishes to access more loans. She can improve her business with the loans. She knows that her communal bank will support and guide her because she is a very well-liked member. She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy fertilizer to make her fields more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer to take care of her coffee crops

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
This is Ursula F., 44, who is married to Arnel F. and is the mother of a high school-aged teenager and an elementary school youngster. She is a resident of Caloocan City just north of Manila on the island of Luzon. By the grace of God, Ursula has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to support both of her children and continue sending them all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Ursula, as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Ursula operates a buy-and-sell business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell items piecemeal, thus resulting in a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options they are offered. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Ursula dreams of giving her all of her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and varieties of products

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Joana P. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada mãe de 6 filhos de 12 aos 31 anos, 5 destes é que vão a Escola o mais velho já esta empregado. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

Apos o seu casamento começa a fazer o trabalho agrícola como base de sustento da sua família ha mais de 25 anos, é proprietária de 25 hectares de terra, não tem empregados conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e enteados. Tem plantado (milho, feijão manteiga, feijão nhemba, amendoim, melancia e aboboras) para venda, outra para o consumo familiar assim como para usar como forma de pagamento quando solicita mão-de-obra para sacha. Vende mais milho a lata e saco (120mt x30latas e a 360mtx50sacos) conseguindo um lucro de cerca de 21.600.00mt por cada época que aplica nas despesas de casa e devido a doença do seu marido que encontra se internado ela fica sem fundo suficiente devido as despesas hospitalares e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo para sustentar a sua atividade.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Joana na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agrícolas (sementes, fertilizantes e outros) para aumentar o volume de produção na sua machamba. O anterior no valor 25.000.00mt foi usado para lavrar a terra e comprar insumos agrícolas.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto pois conta com ajuda da família. Pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para aplicar na produção de hortícolas em breve.
texts.en:
Joana P. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 6 children between 12 and 31 years old.  Five of the children go to school, and the eldest is employed.  Joana only finished seventh grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties.  She lives in her own house and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

After her wedding, more than 25 years ago, she began farming as a means of supporting her family.  Joana owns 25 hectares of land.  She has no employees and counts on help from her children and stepchildren.  She has planted corn, butter beans, cowpeas, peanuts, watermelon and pumpkins for sale, as well as some for her family to eat and some to use as payment when she requests labor for the harvest.  She sells mostly corn in cans and sacks (120 meticais for 31 cans and 360 meticais for 50 sacks), earning an income of around 21,600 meticais for each period.  She uses this money for household expenses, and owing to her husband's illness (he is currently hospitalized), she does not have enough money because of the hospital expenses.  Joana approached Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan to keep up with her work.

This is Joana's second loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy farm supplies (seeds, fertilizers and other items) to increase production on her machamba (small farm).  The previous loan, for 25,000 meticais, was used to plow the land and buy farm supplies.

She is confident that she will repay the loan ahead of time because she has her family's help.  She intends to ask for another loan soon to put toward agricultural production.

loans.use: compra de insumos agrícolas (sementes, fertilizantes e outros)

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yessenia del Carmen S. H., tiene 34 años, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casado, y tienen un hijo que pronto estará preparado para entrar a la universidad, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de productos de ferretería desde hace mas de 20 años que tienen su tienda, ya ha tenido a lo largo de estos años muy buenos resultado con el alza de los precios de los últimos años se ha visto en varias ocasiones con bajas en las ventas, la razón por la cual solicita este préstamo es para la compra de mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita surtir su negocio, aumentar su capital de trabajo y favorecer a su único hijo con los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos universitarios para su debida formación académica.
texts.en: Yessenia del Carmen S. H. is 34 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is married, and they have a son that will soon be prepared to enter university. They have a business selling hardware and have had their store for over 20 years. Over the years they have had good results. With the rise of prices in recent years, sales have dipped on various occasions. The reasons she is requesting this loan is to buy a greater inventory of merchandise that will allow her to stock up her business, increase her working capital and help her only son with the resources necessary to cover the costs of university for his proper academic training.

loans.use: To buy hardware items for her business.

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe C. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Bernabe is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Bernabe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bernabe has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Bernabe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernabe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. Bernabe is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Bernabe from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Wilfrido Antonio

texts.es: Wilfrido M. es un hombre viudo, padre de 5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 19 años, que asumió él solo el negocio “Reciclaje Ronaldiño”, después de su muerte su esposa. Desde hace 7 años había iniciado esta tarea acompañándola, pues era ella quien estaba vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, labor que él continuó con el propósito de hacer crecer su negocio con esta organización, para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar a sus hijos. A lo largo de sus 7 años Reciclaje Ronaldiño ha crecido y es la fuente principal de sus ingresos en el hogar. Con los financiamientos ha logrado invertir en la compra de productos reciclables de contado como vidrio, papel, hierro, cartón y plástico, pero últimamente ha dirigido su énfasis hacia el cobre, pues le da una rentabilidad es de un 70%. Por eso con su credikiva comprará este metal que venderá a empresas transformadoras del mismo, que fabrican tubería, rejas, adornos y que últimamente venden a la China. Wilfrido compra al menudeo a s recicladores individuales que lo recogen y llevan a sus manos; el cuenta con basculas y pesos para desempeñar esta labor. La rotación de sus compras es diaria y de sus inventarios es dos veces por semana por lo que se siente satisfecho con su negocio, pero aspira a lograr aumentar sus ganancias permanentemente, y esto es mediante la inversión, por eso está vinculado a la Fundación para tener un capital en efectivo con el que comprar en volumen, porque sus sueños y gran desafío es sacar solo a sus hijos adelante por el gran vacio que dejó la ausencia de su esposa y madre de estos jóvenes
texts.en:
Wilfrido M. is a widower.  He is the father of 5 children aged between 12 and 19.  He took on the business 'Reciclaje Ronaldiño' (Ronaldiño Recycling) alone after his wife died.  He had started this task, together with his wife, 7 years ago as it was his wife who had links to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo but he has continued the work with the intention of making the business grow with this organization so that he can offer his children a better well-being.

Throughout its 7 years, 'Reciclaje Ronaldiño' has grown and it is the main source of income for Wilfrido's household.  With the help of loans, he has managed to invest in the purchase of recyclable products such as glass, paper, iron, cardboard and plastics.  However, lately he has been directing his focus more towards copper since it provides 70% profits.  For this reason, he will use his Kiva loan to buy this metal which he will sell to companies who transform it to make pipes, bars, decorations and ultimately sell it to China.

Wilfrido buys retail from individual recyclers who collect the material and bring it to him.  He has scales and weights to carry out this task.  The rotation of his purchases is daily and the rotation of his whole inventory is twice a week.  He feels satisfied with his business but he aspires to increase his sales permanently through investment.  This is why he is with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that he can have capital in cash with which he can buy in volume because his dream and his greatest challenge is to get his children ahead in life on his own faced with the enormous hole that the absence of his wife and the kids' mother has left.

loans.use: To buy copper which he will sell to be transformed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 49-year-old lady, married to Kevin, who is 52 years old and a farmer. They are blessed with six children, ages eight, 15,18, 20, 23 and 25. She has been running this retail shop for the last 10 years, which earns her 5,000 KES monthly. Due to the fact that her husband has been able to meet most of their expenses, this gives her room to grow the business.

She was introduced to Kadet by a friend, and this is her first loan. Francisca plans to add more stock, such as sugar, kerosene, rice and soda, to her retail business. She plans to use the expected profits to educate her children at the highest education level, and hopes to grow the retail business to wholesale in future.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her retail store

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen E., 39, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples. Khen raises pigs at home, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 15 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 28 on other necessary expenses every month.

Khen is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase duck eggs to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy duck eggs to resell

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the mother of four children. She lives in a compound with her children and her longterm partner. Maria is one of the members of the Union y Desarrollo 1 & 2 (Unite and Development) group located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. In this town, as in many others, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants.

Maria has been selling clothing and accessories for around ten years. She started her business with her own savings. She is receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional after having paid off her previous loans satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of different clothes and accessories. Maria tells us that her most difficult challenge is to work hard and move forward for her children’s sake, yet she says her favorite activity is working in her business.

Maria plans to use her profits to save and invest in her house by making it more comfortable. Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy clothing and accessories to sell

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twenty years, she has operated a food stall from home; neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Bibi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season the demand for foodstuffs is lower. She hopes to operate a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of beans, wheat flour, cooking oil and rice. She decided to join Yehu because it has not too much legalities.

loans.use: To purchase stock of beans, wheat flour, cooking oil and rice

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel K. est agent de Compassion International, une organisation Rwandais qui aide les enfants, commerçant des accessoires téléphoniques, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 37 ans, il est marié, et né a Congo (RDC).  Il a 4 enfants entre 2 ans et 11 ans, 3 de qui vont à l’école, et il a fini 5 ans d’école secondaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de 60 téléphones, 1 ordinateur, 1 amplificateur, 1 radio, 100 batteries, 200 chargeurs, et 300 housings pour son commerce des accessoires téléphoniques à Gisenyi.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solliciter ce crédit tout en augmentant les quantités vendues dans son atelier, il achètera aussi les matériels de technicité.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer lui-même, développer son secteur, et construire sa propre maison commerciale.  Pour la vie, il voudrait assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Pour gagner plus de revenue, il loue une maison pour 60,000FRW par mois.
texts.en: Daniel K. is an agent of Compassion International, a Rwandan organization helping children, a vendor of phone accessories and a client of ACD since 2009. He is 37 years old and married. He is born in Congo (RDC). He has four children between two and 11 years of age, three of whom are in school. He has finished five years of secondary school. He is going to use his loan to purchase 60 phones, one computer, one amplifier, one radio, 100 batteries, 200 chargers and 300 cases for his phone accessories store in Gisenyi. His business strategy is to take out loans allowing him to increase his sales volume. He also buys electronic parts. He would like to be able to become financially independent, grow his business and open his own company. As to his private life, he would like to ensure the well-being of his family and provide for his children’s school fees. In order to increase his revenue, he rents out a house for 60,000 Rwandan francs per month.

loans.use: Purchasing 60 phones, a computer, batteries for mobile phones, etc,

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with seven children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a groundnuts sales business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells firewood which is her other source of income. Eva faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to establish a greengrocery shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of groundnuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of groundnuts for sale

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth, es una dichosa mujer de 21 años. Junto a su esposo Hilder recibieron la llegada de su primogénita a la que aún no la pusieron un nombre. Pero prometen amarla y cuidarla en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). Hace unos días fue bendecida por Díos, con el nacimiento de su hija. Su prioridad ahora es cuidar de su bebé a la que llamará Prisma, según menciona entre risas. Pensando en el futuro de ella, desea comenzar a sembrar en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por lo pronto seguirá trabajando arduamente como hace 2 años, en la venta de productos de belleza, perfumes, y cosméticos de toda variedad. Además de las ganancias que gana se suma a las de su esposo, quien trabaja en una hacienda de cítricos obteniendo ingresos semanales, con ellos espera concretar sus objetivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente feliz de poder pertenecer a una asociación, que velará por el progreso y desarrollo de sus integrantes. Lisbeth, siempre aprovecha las ofertas que traen las empresas de cosméticos para poder tener un stock. Por ello con el crédito esta pensando comprar una variedad de productos para está temporada de verano que se avecina.
texts.en:
