Lisbeth is a happy 21 year old woman. She and her husband Hilder recently celebrated the arrival of their firstborn daughter, whom they have still to name. But they vow to love and care for her in their home in the community of Guacamayo (in the central Peruvian forest). 

A few days ago, God blessed Lisbeth with the birth of her daughter. Her priority now is to look after her baby. Laughing, she says she plans to call her Prisma. Thinking of her baby’s future, she wants to start planting her farm land. For the immediate future, she will continue working hard, as she has done for the past 2 years, in selling beauty products, perfumes, and all types of cosmetics. The money she earns is added to the money earned by her husband, who works on a citrus fruit farm and is paid weekly. With both streams of income they hope they can achieve their goals. Lisbeth belongs to the “New Dawn of Guacamayo” communal bank. This is her first loan with [field partner] MFP, and she is happy to be able to be part of an association that promotes the progress and development of its members. Lisbeth always tries out the offers that cosmetic companies bring her, so as to have a stock. With the loan she is planning to buy a variety of products for the approaching summer season.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long R. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. R. rents out houses, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 50 on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to build more rooms to rent. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to build more rooms for rent.

loans.name: Darling Maria

texts.es:
La joven Darling, es originaria del departamento de   Masaya localizado  a 30 minutos de la capital Managua pero vive en Estelí lleva 6 años viviendo en este departamento, ella tiene 21 años de edad , es soltera, esta estudiando su segundo año de la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, vende dulces, jugos, frutas . Inicio su negocio por medio de una tía que se dedica a vender frutas y dulces en la calle central de Estelí, Darling  como cada mañana le gusta vender cerca de la calle central ya que a escasos 100 metros se encuentra un colegio donde la mayoría de los estudiantes le comprar a ella sus caramelos  por las tardes se transporta caminando con su carretón de frutas y golosinas  a vender el resto de su mercadería buscando como llevar sus sustento alimenticio diario. A ella le  gustaría  poder tener una tienda de frutas y golosinas en el mercado municipal de Estelí.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mas frutas y surtir su mercadería de dulces ya que se acerca la temporada de semana santa que es considerada una buena época de venta para el comercio. Le será de gran ayuda esta inversión pues espera aumentar sus ventas, clientela y mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar sus estudios ella sola. Tiene como planes futuros poner un salón de belleza, pues ella estudia cosmetología los fines de semana es una actividad que disfruta mucho. Su próxima meta es terminar sus estudios en la secundaria para poder optar a una carrera universitaria pues sueña con ser una profesional emprendedora y útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Darling is originally from the Department of Masaya, which is located 30 minutes from the capital, Managua; however, for the past 6 years she has lived in the Department of Estelí.  Darling is 21 years old, single, and is in her second year of secondary school.  She makes a living selling foodstuffs, including sweets, juice, and fruit.  She started her business with the help of an aunt who makes a living selling fruit and sweets on Estelí’s central street.  Every morning Darling likes to sell her products near the central street, since it is only 100 meters from a school where most of the students buy sweets from her.  In the afternoons she takes her cart of fruit and sweets and walks around in order to sell the rest of her merchandise and thus earn her daily bread.  Darling would like to have her own fruit and sweets shop in Estelí’s municipal market.  

Darling is asking for a loan so that she can purchase more fruit and stock up on sweets, since Holy Week is approaching and that is considered an especially good time of year for business.  The loan will be of great help to her, and she hopes it will allow her to increase her sales and clientele and improve her income so that she can pay for her studies.  Darling’s plan for the future is to open a beauty salon, as she is studying cosmetology on the weekends and that is an activity she enjoys.  Her immediate goal, though, is to finish her studies in secondary school so that she can apply to a university course, since her dream is to be a professional who is both enterprising and useful to society.

loans.use: Purchasing more fruit and stocking up on sweets

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Hohenau - Encarnación y surgió por contacto de las señoras  con la fundación, es un grupo excelente y se encuentra en el 18º ciclo, pues opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2006.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Maria R., tiene 4 hijos, su marido es camionero y  ella tiene una despensa muy surtida en su barrio, en este negocio trabaja ella con la ayuda de todos sus hijos, gracias a esto también la despensa es muy conocida en la zona.
Cuenta la Sra. Maria que el crédito que solicita lo quiere utilizar para la compra de mercaderías a fin de surtir mejor la despensa, de esta manera puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las señoras del grupo también realizan actividades productivas y comerciales, por eso necesitan del apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Hohenau-Encarnacion, and got together after making contact with one of the women from the Fundacion.  This is an excellent group that is in its 18th loan cycle and has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2006.

One of the members of the group is Maria R..  She has 4 children and her husband is a truck driver.  She has a well-stocked neighborhood store where she works with all of her children.  Thanks to this her store is very well-known in the area.

Maria tells us that the loan that she requests will be used to purchase merchandise to better stock her store; in this way she can improve her family's income.

All of the members of the group also have productive and commercial activities, and for this reason they need the support of the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy groceries, bakery products, canned goods, drinks, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jafred

texts.en:
Jafred is a farmer in Kitale town in Western Kenya and has been in  farming for 27 years. He is aged 60 and married, with 13 children between 26 and 4 years old, five of whom are still in school. His farm produces milk, maize, vegetables, fruits and eggs. He has employed one farmhand and sells his produce to the local market. 

Jafred has made a loan request of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow. His says the milk produce will supplement the family meals and generate additional income to help him educate the remaining five children. He is focusing on having five cows of a better breed in the  future.

Jafred is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan facility but points out that the high cost of animal feeds during dry spells is a great challenge to the farming business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr: Né le 08 juillet 1974, Mouhamadou est marié à Faossath, une marchande. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont les leurs. Mouhamadou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Mouhamadou  subvient ensemble avec sa femme, aux besoins de la famille. Mouhamadou n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, puis par la suite a appris la couture, une activité qu’il exerce depuis seize ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Parallèlement à cette activité, Mouhamadou vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Mouhamadou s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Mouhamadou sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux équiper son atelier de couture à travers l’acquisition d’une machine à coudre et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mouhamadou was born on 8th July 1974 and is married to Faossath, a trader. The couple has five children in its care, all at school, and four of which are their own children. Mouhamadou lives with his wife and children. He and his wife provide for their family's needs between them. Mouhamadou went to primary school only, and then learned how to sew, a business which he has been carrying out for the past sixteen years and which enables him to provide for his needs and those of his children. In parallel with this activity, Mouhamadou sells telephone recharge cards. He gets his supplies in Nigeria, a neighboring state of Benin. It is the second time that Mouhamadou is requesting a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to get better equipment for his workshop in the form of the acquisition of a sewing machine, and to be able to satisfy better his customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Katiereton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KATIERETON 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Nimprodioula un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région  administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées par ce groupe d’homme  sont généralement  le maïs    tes avec KALIFA SIBIRI. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter des intrants ( engrais et herbicides), les petits matériels pour entretien des champs. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 KALIFA SIBIRI compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 FCFA par campagne et souhaite entretenir sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
The members of the Katiereton 2  group are married men who are on average 49 years old and have an average of 7 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages in the Sikasso community, (third administrative region of Mali)
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry their agricultural activities through the winter.
This is their third loan with the institution and the previous loan was repaid correctly.
The crops grown by this group of men are usually corn,like Kalifa Sibiri.
With this new loan, he plans to purchase products for the earth (fertiliser and weed killer), and small tools for the maintenance of his fields.
After the harvest the produce is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso to men and women customers.
Kalifa Sibiri hopes to make an average profit of 110 000 FCFA for each field and wishes to continue his cooperation with Soro Yiriwaso.
His aim is  to build a house for residence in the future.

loans.use: pay for fertiliser ,weed killer, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of tamarind for making spices and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Ma. Nilda

texts.en:
Ma. Nilda is 58 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Nilda has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Ma. Nilda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 53 years old. She has seven children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hoa's husband has been sick for some time. Hoa takes care of him and feeds her family members through the income she earns selling vegetables in a small market. Hoa has sold vegetables at the market for nearly 30 years. Hoa would like to have a loan to invest in her current business and purchase a wider range and greater quantity of vegetables to sell. She hopes that this will permit her to generate a higher income and enable her to save for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.name: Terecita De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Terecita es socia del banco comunal La Gran Amistad, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen a trabajar diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
La Señora. Terecita tiene 39 años, es madre soltera de una hija de 7 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus padres pero independiente. 

Doña Terecita trabaja en la atención de su propio restaurante, esta actividad  la realiza hace 15 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga y vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Terecita is a member of the La Gran Amistad communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish. This area has a cold climate and has a beautiful view of nature. The residents are kind and maintain their culture and the tradition of their forefathers. They work in trade, raise animals, or farm, and many go to work in the city of Cuenca every day.

Mrs. Terecita is 39. She is a single mother of one daughter aged 7 who is studying in a school in the city. Terecita does not have her own home, so she lives in her parents' home, but independently.

Mrs. Terecita runs her own restaurant. She has done this for 15 years. She works every day of the week from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

This is her first loan from the communal bank. She was invited by a friend and neighbour. She will invest her loan in the purchase of dishes and supplies for her business.

Her dream is to have no debts.

loans.use: to purchase dishes and supplies.

loans.name: Angela Noelia

texts.es:
La Señorita Angela es soltera, sin hijos estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con su madre, la cual trabaja de limpiadora de una Fiscalía. Angela por su parte trabaja en una empresa de materiales de construcción de la ciudad de Pilar.
En cuanto a sus estudios está cursando actualmente el primer año de la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad San Lorenzo, de la ciudad de Pilar. Uno de sus mayores sueños en convertirse en una gran abogada y de esa forma, y por medio de su trabajo poder retribuir a su madre todo el esfuerzo y sacrificio que ella ha pasado para hacerla estudiar.
Ella solicita el crédito para el pago de las cuotas de su universidad y así también para la compra de sus materiales didácticos, como ser folletos, libros y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la gran oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Srta. Angela is single and has no children.  She works and goes to school at the same time.  Angela is a native of the city of Pilar.  Her mother lives in La Fiscalía and works as a janitor.  Angela works for a company that sells construction materials in the city of Pilar.  

She is currently in her first year of studies toward earning a law degree from the University of San Lorenzo in Pilar.  One of her greatest wishes is to become a successful lawyer.  Through her work, Angela hopes to repay her mother for all of her efforts and sacrifices.  

She is requesting a loan to pay her university fees and also to buy study materials such as pamphlets, books, and other items.  Angela is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this great opportunity being given to her.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and school materials

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is married, with no children. He is a Rwandan rice farmer and has been growing rice for the past three years. His parents taught him how to grow rice.

He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor which will facilitate his rice farming for this season.

loans.name: Bethy Hornela

texts.fr:
Cliente  mariée âgé de  22 ans, n’ayant pas de soutien pour poursuivre ses études supérieurs, elle ouvre un dépôt et  se lance dans la vente des légumes, oignons, échalotes, tomates fraiches, céleri et persil..
Elle vend chaque jour de très bon matin , elle encaisse en moyenne 10 000 à 17 000 F par jour.
A l’octroie de se prêt , elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 1 filet d’oignon jaune , des tomates fruits  échalote, un carton de boite de tomate, carton de cube jumbo et magie, de la  ciboule en gros. 
Avec un bon accueil des clients, elle a une bonne réputation dans le marché . 
Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle pense épargner et à la longue devenir grossiste en vue de fournir les denrées aux  autres vendeurs de la place. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle pense acheter un terrain pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is married and twenty-two years old. Lacking financial support to pursue higher education, she opened a warehouse and started selling vegetables, onions, shallots, fresh tomatoes, celery and parseley.
She starts selling very early every day, collecting an average of 10,000 to 17,000 XAF daily. When this loan is granted, she will increase her stock of merchandise by purchasing from a wholesaler one mesh bag of yellow onions, fresh tomatoes, shallots, one box of canned tomatoes, one box of Maggi and Jumbo stock cubes, and chives.
Being welcoming to her customers, she has a good reputation on the marketplace.
With the profit from her sales, she is planning on saving and in the long run wants to become a wholesaler in order to provide merchandise to the other  sellers on the marketplace. As a good mother, she is thinking about purchasing a plot of land for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh tomatoes, red onions, shallots, chives, celery and parsley

loans.name: Thelma Llena Group

texts.en:
Thelma is married, with 1 child.  She is 48 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudeela, Misamis Occidental.
Thelma sells shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and canned goods to earn a living, and has had this business for 3 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 10,500PHP to purchase goods such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods.
Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Thelma hopes to save money.

Thelma is the leader of a 3 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase goods, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 11 years, Shakirah has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help her generate greater profits and meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a second business. 

Shakirah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Noel Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Noel tiene 27  años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y una hija.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años, cultivando maíz, fríjol, plátano y hortalizas. Su padre fue quien le enseño, ya que desde muy pequeño lo llevaba a trabajar con él. Y eso le ha servido para hoy en día ganarse la vida y darle lo necesario a su familia.  

Don Noel necesita de insumos, para que sus cultivos puedan desarrollarse, por lo que debe desplazarse durante cuarenta y cinco minutos en autobús, para comprarlos. Él esta  solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar fertilizantes y abono, con esto les dará mantenimiento a tiempo a sus cultivos y hasta el cultivo de plátano, ya que quiere aumentar el área de la huerta de plátano, debido a que es muy rentable. De esta forma él podrá obtener una mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos, ya que don Noel desea ofrecerles mejores oportunidades a su hija, para que se supere académicamente, ya que él solo pudo terminar sus estudios de la primaria.
texts.en:
Noel is 27 years old and lives with his life partner and daughter.

Noel has been farming for 13 years.  He grows corn, beans, bananas and vegetables.  His father taught him this business as he would take him to work with him from a very young age.  This has helped him to earn a living and provide for his family.

Noel needs supplies so that his crops can develop.  He must travel 45 minutes by bus to buy his supplies.  He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizers and manure which will enable him to provide timely care for his crops and bananas.  He would like to increase the size of his banana farm as it is very profitable.  In this way, Noel will be able to obtain a better production and, thereby, more income.  Noel would like to provide his daughter with better opportunities so that she does well academically as he himself only managed to finish elementary school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his crops

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда замужем имеет троих детей. Муж столяр. Для содержания семьи она занимается сушкой фруктов. Сухофрукты очень востребованы их закупают оптом для продажи в Российской Федерации. Прибыль, который она получила от данного бизнеса, она отремонтировала свой дом, а теперь она хотела бы получить займ для расширения бизнеса и пополнения товарооборота. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Khursheda is married and has three children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  In order to support her family, Khursheda is involved in drying fruits.  Dried fruits are in very high demand and bought wholesale for resale in the Russian Federation.  She used the profit that she made from this business to make repairs to her house and now wants to obtain a loan to expand her business and increase turnover.  Khursheda thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase turnover

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en: Odonchimeg is 30 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband has a private business. Her children are high school students and kindergarten attendants. She was a waitress at the local business center in 2006. In 2008, she started selling food and products at the local market. She rents a commercial space at the market and sells both food and hygiene products at the retail price. She is planning to improve her business in the future. She is a diligent and hard working woman who says, "I want to provide a good education to my children and expand my business successfully." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Debra Wachuka

texts.en: Debra Wachuka 72 years old, widowed and has three children. She sells clothes to new and frequent customers in the town of Nakuru. She has been in this business for the last five years and has one employee.The business is faced with the challenge of insufficient capital to allow the purchase of more stock. Debra is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more clothes as there will be a high demand during December holiday. She describes herself as a determined and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Khaitgul

texts.ru: Хайтгул умная и целеустремленная женщина, она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она выращивает пшеницу, лук, кунжут, кукурузу, морковь, тыкву и рис. Она является владельцем данного бизнеса и ей помогают муж и дети. Она хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения, ГСМ и оплатить труд  работников.  С этой целью Хайтгул запрашивает займ в размере 4500 Сомони.
texts.en: Khaigul is an intelligent and goal-oriented person. She is married and the loving mother of three. She  cultivates crops. She grows wheat, onions, sesame, corn, carrots, pumpkins and rice. She is the owner of this business; her husband and children help her. She would like to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel as well as pay the cost of labor. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of 4500

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel as well as  pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kitintali in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past five years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food products for resale, and it will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop.

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Kairaba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Alimatou qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de savon et de détergent. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This microcredit group was formed on the 9th July 2002. It is made up of eleven women who live in the same quarter. Their main line of trade is retail. 

Madame Alimatou - who is on the left of the photo with her hand raised - is the group leader. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children. She sells soap and detergent for a living. She has been successful in her line of work, in which she has been involved for several years. This loan will enable her to boost her working capital and to better develop her business. 

The profits she generates will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothes etc) and to boost her savings.

loans.use: to purchase soap and detergent

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is a married woman with three children. She is 53 years old and lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 
Noli owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting flowers for sale to earn a living. She has been running this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP from the business. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 
In 2011, Noli joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Audelia

texts.es:
La señora Audelia es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  ropa  desde hace tres años, ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio  es tener su negocio limpio.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Aurelio un señor trabajador que la ayuda antes de irse a trabajar y después de trabajar  para que doña Audelia no se canse tanto.
Tambien se dedica a la venta  de flores  y a la vende de adornos para bodas y xv años.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más  ropa  para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir haciendo más grande su negocio.
texts.en: Audelia is hard-working and has been selling clothing for the past three years. What she likes most about her business is that it's her own. She is happily married to her husband Aurelio, a hard-working man who helps her before and after work so that Audelio doesn't get too tired. Audelio also sells flowers and decorations for weddings and quinceañeras. She has requested a loan to buy more clothing to sell. She is grateful to the foundation for the support it has given her in growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SALUD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Nicanora ella es soltera y tiene 61 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de tejidos , la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos . 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de productos de belleza.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the Salud community bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.
 
One member, Nancy Nicanora, is 61-years-old and single and has 2 children.  She has a business selling different kinds of fabric from 8 A.M. to 7 P.M.  She has been doing this work for 8 years and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to expand her fabric business.  She is asking for a loan to buy fabric.

She is grateful to those who are a part of her dream through this loan and she is committed to making her payments within the established period. 

The other group members run various businesses selling fabric, handicrafts, groceries, and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego ha sido un joven muy dedicado, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años.

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja solo todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de ropa y calzado, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Diego manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia.

loans.use: comprar surtido al por mayor de ropa y calzado

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two Children. She lives with her family in kiserian. Their family owns the plot on which they have constructed their house. Veronica is a strong member of the local PCEA church.  Veronica takes care of her niece who is an orphan; she pays for her school fees and other necessities. She promised her that she will look after her until she joins college.

Veronica has one dairy cow that gives her 6 liters of milk per day. She supplies the milk to the Kiosks in Rongai.  She gets on average $ 2 per day from the sale of milk. This assists her to cater for her day to day expenses. Veronica has a small stall in Rongai where she sells Tomatoes, Carrots, Onions, Kales and Peas. Though much of her stock is bought from the city market, Veronica also sells Kale from her garden. Veronica’s stall is a long Tuesso route. This route is the main entrance to Kware slum area-Rongai and many people use the same route. Veronica is able to make a sale of $ 7 per day. Veronica would wish to buy a hybrid dairy cow which will give her more milk. With good livestock management she believes she would be in a position to supply 30litres of milk per day. This will definitely increase her income and will reduce the burden of sourcing school fees for her children in future.

loans.use: Veronica would like to buy a hybrid dairy cow.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir is an IDP from the Armenian occupied district of Fizuli since 1993. In 2004 he started his service business in Baku city. In 2006 he borrowed $500  from Normicro, Baku branch and bought some equipment for his business. Now he wants to borrow $700 to buy more equipment for his barber shop.

loans.use: To buy new business equipment

loans.name: Faatietie

texts.en: Faatietie lives with her husband and four children in the small Samoan village of Malie.  She operates a small banana plantation.  Her banana trees are located very far from her house, so she must walk many miles each day to tend the plantation.  She hauls her banana crop to market twice a week.  There she is usually able to sell between ten and twenty bags of bananas and bring in revenues of ST 300 – 400 each week (approximately USD 120 – 160).  This income is the main income source for her large family, and she is committed to continuing to invest time and money into her plantation.  Thus, she has applied for a small loan to buy some basic equipment that will help her keep her plantation in good condition.

loans.use: Buy equipment: fencing, knives, and gloves

loans.name: Jimmy Franz

texts.es:
Jimmy has two grown daughters, one is 19 years of age and the other 11. He is unmarried but lives with his partner. With the help of his business, he has been able to provide for his family but he needs to continue to grow to offer his daughters a better education and support the household. He started his business with skills he learned from his father. Jimmy learned quickly and was good at the job, so he decided to continue with it. He is a very hard worker and a family man without vices. He sought out the microfinance program in hopes of finding the means to support his business.

Jimmy is seeking a loan in the amount of $475 to purchase equipment for his work, including a larger grill and a bell to speed up production, thereby continuing his growth and improving his sales. He is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family appreciate your support in helping them get ahead and continue to better themselves to offer their daughters a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Jimmy tiene dos hijas mujeres, una de 19 años de edad y la otra de 11 años de años de edad, no esta casado vive con su pareja en unión libre y con su negocio a podido sacar adelante a su familia, pero el necesita continuar creciendo para ofrecerles una mejor educación a sus hijas y mantener a su familia. Él empezó con su negocio como herencia de su padre, el le enseño el oficio y Jimmy aprendió bien así que continuó con el mismo, él es muy trabajador y es un hombre de familia sin vicios y muy trabajador quien se acerco al programa microcréditos en espera de un buen apoyo para su negocio.

Jimmy esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder comprar equipo de trabajo que consta de un asador más grande y una campana para así poder agilizar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le des para poder salir adelante y mejorar cada vez más para ofrecerles a sus hijas y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase production equipment

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is a woman who lives in free union with her partner who gets out of debt working as a solderer in a blacksmith's. They have no children and she began her business to help her partner with the family expenses and at times to be able to come to form a patrimony for them both. She started her business four years ago, begininning with a small investment because of which she had little merchandise, but little by little she reinvested her profits in the business and grew to provide herself with more supply of products to offer in her shop.

Sara is requesting a loan of US $1,100 to recondition her business and suplly it with merchandise to be able to offer greater variety of products to her customers, offering to repay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support that you give her to be able to expand, better and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara es una mujer que vive en unión libre con su pareja, quien se desempeña trabajando como soldador en un negocio de herrería, ellos no tienen hijos y ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos familiares y a la vez para poder llegar a formar un patrimonio para ambos. Ella inició con su negocio hace ya cuatro años atrás, empezando con una pequeña inversión por lo que tenía poca mercancía, pero poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo sus excedentes en el negocio y fue creciendo haciéndose de más surtido de productos que ofrecer en su tienda.

Sara está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,100 para acondicionar su negocio y surtirlo de mercancía para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder ampliar, mejorar y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Remodelación

loans.name: Nenden

texts.en: Nenden is 20 years old and is a widow with one child. To support her family, Nenden sells food, soft drinks, and other goods in her kiosk. She has been an active member of Yamida for one year. She earns $20 per day from her business. Nenden needs to borrow $120 to expand her business. She will repay the loan within a 12 month period.

loans.use:
$50 to buy more food, $50 to buy more goods,
$25 to buy more drink products

loans.name: Manuela Ysabel

texts.en:
Ysabel, mother of four, has the true spirit of an entrepreneur. Her husband paints houses for a living, and up until recently, Ysabel contributed a small income from selling cosmetics through a company called Esika, similar to Mary Kay or Avon. Six months ago, a friend invited her to her village bank, and Ysabel went to a meeting just to meet new people. While she was at the meeting she became inspired and thought ‘I could do this, I could start a real business!’ She loves to cook and decided to turn this passion into a means of building capital. She now prepares a different dessert each week, such as picarones (similar to a doughnut), mazamorra (made with corn and fruit), and arroz con leche, and sells them from a cart on the street. She also cooks carne de res, a type of meat.

Ysabel and her husband have four children, ages 18, 15, 11, and 2. Her oldest is studying cosmetology. Isabel’s parents are getting older and now live with her family, so she has two additional people to care for. She is still selling cosmetics, but is focusing on her new business. The positive reaction she’s gotten about her food has empowered her, and she now has a dream to open her own restaurant. Ysabel says that with each loan she will get closer to this dream, and when she gets there, she is going to name the restaurant after her youngest son, her inspiration. With this loan of $150, Ysabel will purchase the necessary ingredients, such as corn, fruit, honey, milk, and rice to prepare the food she sells.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary ingredients, such as corn, fruit, honey, milk, and rice to prepare her food.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en: Abdulla (his brother is pictured) was born in 1982.  He has worked as a lathe operator (a lathe is a machine for shaping a piece of material, such as wood or metal) for 2 years along with his brother. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. Now Abdulla is  requesting a loan of $850 to buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.name: Lilana

texts.es:
Liliana is a single mother to a 10-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son. Both are in school, and are excellent students. Liliana is young and entrepreneurial, and she started her business when her husband abandoned her and left her alone to raise and educate their children.

Liliana worked for several years as a veterinary assistant, until she decided to open her own dog grooming business with the little savings that she had accumulated. It has been three years since she opened, and she tells us her endeavor is a success. Every week, more than a dozen dogs are brought to her for her services. In addition to providing bathing and cleaning services, she sells accessories such as dog collars, shampoos, clothing, beds, etc.

Liliana tells us that she finds her work to be relaxing, in addition to being profitable, because she is such an avid dog-lover. She is seeking a loan to buy more dog accessories to offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana G. es madre soltera de dos, una niña de 10 años y un niño de 7, ambos van a la escuela y son excelentes alumnos. Liliana es una mujer joven y emprendedora, ella empezó su negocio cuando fue abandonada por su marido y se vio sola para criar y educar a sus hijos.

Liliana trabajo unos años como ayudante en una veterinaria, hasta que con unos pocos ahorros que tenía decidió abrir su propia peluquería para perros. Ya van tres años desde que abrió y cuenta que ha sido todo un éxito. Semanalmente recibe mas de doce perros que requieren de sus servicios. Además de realizar servicios de baño y aseo, ella vende accesorios para perros, como collares, shampoo, ropas, camas, etc.

Liliana cuenta que su trabajo además de ser rentable, es bastante relajante pues a ella le encantan los perros. Solicita el crédito para la compra de accesorios para vender.

loans.use: Purchase dog shampoos, perfumes, collars, clothing, beds, etc.

loans.name: Duku's Group

texts.en: Duku, Amis, and Patrick have all been our clients for 3 years, and each one of them has a business. They are residents of Kayunga, and they would like a loan to boost their businesses. Patrick works at the maize factory and carries bags of maize on his bicycle for a fee, Duku has a clinic, and Amis has a stationery shop in Busaana.

loans.use: Patrick wants to buy a new bicycle, Duku wants to buy medicine, and Amis wants to buy more books and pens.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheak P. (pictured with his mother and brother) is single and lives with his widowed mother. He has three brothers and three sisters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house and other two sisters are working in a garment factory. His youngest brother is in primary school. Their house is along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. P. has been an electrician for two years, a skill he learned at a technical school in Phnom Penh. Currently he works in Phnom Penh.

Mr. P. is requesting a loan for the fourth time. He is asking for $500 for filling in the land around the family house.

loans.use: For filling in the land around the family house

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmela R. B., is a member of the Comunal Bank "Unidad Calzadina". She lives in the San Martin region, province of Moyomamba, district of Calzada. She sells assorted items, vegetables, bread, candy, and soft drinks in her store located in her own house of the street Jr. Indepndencia S/N, in the neighborhood called Barrio Miraflores, and where the neighbours and visitors shop on a daily basis.

She decide to start her business with the support of her husband and with the goal of managing her own profit and improve her economic level and help her children to go on studying.

With this S/. 1000.00 loan, which she will return in 6 months, she ill buy first need products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, preserves, pasta, detergent, and toilet paper, among others, in order to satisfy her customes' needs.

She is a 40-year-old mother of two children who are very supportive of her business and her goals for the future, which are to improve her sales and to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Carmela R. B. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Unidad Calzadina , vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Calzada , se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, panes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, en su bodega ubicada en su propia casa del Jr. Independencia S/N en el Barrio Miraflores donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores del barrio. Decidió iniciar su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo y con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico y ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará, productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 40 años y 2 hijos que siempre la apoyan en el negocio, sus metas para el futuro son, ampliar sus ventas y hacer arreglos en su casa.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more products she needs to sell

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo is 47 years old and his family is composed of his children and his wife who is a homemaker. Rosendo has two sources of income as he is a mason and he also receives rent from a motorcycle. He works in Portachuelo and in the surrounding areas of this community and, at the same time, receives a daily rent for renting his motorcycle in this same area. Little competition exists in this field as the majority of the masons left to work outside of the community, which is why he has never lacked work and has a high demand for his services. The price of his services varies depending on the job y if he is paid my project or a daily wage and simultaneously receives a daily rent of Bs. 25.-. He does not have any negative credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Rosendo de 47 años de edad cuenta con una familia conformada por sus hijos y esposa que se dedica a las labores de casa. Rosendo tiene dos fuentes de ingresos ya que es albañil y también recibe renta de una moto. Trabaja en Portachuelo y en los alrededores de esta localidad y paralelemente recibe una renta diaria por el alquiler de su moto en la misma población. Existe muy poca competencia en este rubro ya que la mayoría de los albañiles se fueron a trabajas al exterior y por esta razón nunca le falta trabajo tiene alta demanda por sus servicios. El precio de sus servicios varia dependiendo de la obra y si esta es vendida o por jornal diario y paralelamente recibe una renta diaria de Bs. 25.-. No tiene antecedentes crediticios negativos.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Phary Phai Group

texts.en:
Five people in Dem Popel Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province will join in this group to get a loan. Mrs Phary P. is the group leader and she is currently in watermelon selling. Mrs Phary P. is now requesting a loan to buy more watermelons as her business is doing really well. She is 43 and a widow with five children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other four are attending school.

Previously, Mrs Phary P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy more watermelons to sell.

loans.name: Massan Kossiwa Ayépo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Massan Kossiwa Ayépo A. was born on August 31, 1969 in Atakpamé, a town located 140 km from Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her primary business is selling costume jewelry and lengths of African print cloth (known as "pagnes") in the Agoè district in Lomé.

This first loan which she is requesting will allow her to add to her inventory by buying 15 pagnes and some jewelry.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Massan Kossiwa Ayépo est née le 31 août 1969 à Atakpamé, ville située à 140 Km de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de bijoux et de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat de 15 pièces de pagnes et des bijoux.

loans.use:
Purchase of costume jewelry and 15 lengths of African print cloth (pagnes)

Achat de bijoux et de 15 pièces de pagne

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Saven Group

texts.en: This group, which is located in Sdaov Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province consists of five people and Mrs. Meas S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She owns a small restaurant. from which she sells soup to people in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients in order to cook delicious soup for her customers.  Mrs. Meas S. is a 61-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, whilst the other is a driver in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients in order to cook delicious soup for her customers.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.es:
La señora Laurinda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Organizadas”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Huicungo. Se dedica a la venta de comida, juanes, bebidas y algunos abarrotes. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el puerto Callao de su distrito, lugar donde  acuden diariamente sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. Aprovecha la ubicación de su casa porque el puerto es muy concurrido y es punto de partida y llegada de  las embarcaciones que hacen transporte hacia las demás localidades de esa parte de la región. 

Con este crédito de S/ 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, y de esa manera poder surtir bien el negocio y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Laurinda tiene 53 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y muy trabajadora. Tiene como meta implementar, ampliar y arreglar su casa para dar comodidad y  seguridad a su negocio porque  su clientela está en aumento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laurinda belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Organizadas" (organized women). She lives in the Region of San Martin, Mariscal Caceres Province, Huicingo district. She works selling food, juanes (a typical dish of rice and meat wrapped in a bijao or banana leaf), drinks, and some basic need items. Her business is located in her own home, in the Callao harbor of her district, a place to which people, both neighbors and visitors from other places, go daily to eat. She takes advantage of the location of her house because the harbor is very popular and is the point of departure and arrival of ships that transport to other locations from that part of the region.

With this loan of S/ 3,000, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy basic need products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, different sizes of boxes of preserves, packages of toilet paper, detergent, different brands and sizes of soap, among other things. In this way she will be able to stock her business well and ensure her customers find what they are looking for.

Laurinda is 53 years old, she is a decisive, joyful, and hard-working woman. Her goal is to build, expand, and accommodate her home to offer comfort and security to her business because clientele is increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic need items (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Esther N. from Mwanza. She is married with one child, one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Esther has been running a pharmacy business since 2006, selling medicines. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Esther currently earns about 350USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more medicines, such as Chestcof, Strepsils, Mucolyn, Hedex and others. In the future, she plans to increase her stocks of medicines. Esther thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more medicines, such as Chestcof, Strepsils, Mucolyn, Hedex and others

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin U. is a villager in Treuy Troeng village in Kandal Province. She sells homemade Khmer noodles. 

Her husband, Mr. Nhouk Bunthoun, is an ice cream seller. He faces an obstacle because he cannot sell in other villages or far from his house, which means he earns little money. 

In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Sarin U. decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike to sell ice cream door-to-door in order to make a better living. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice cream door-to-door

loans.name: Sam-Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-oun M., 53, is a widow with four children: one son and three daughters. Her son is a fisherman. One of her daughters is a silk weaver, another one has full-time employment and one more daughter attends school. The family lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Mrs. Sam-oun has been a silk weaver since 1975. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for the weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Zohirboy

texts.en:
Zohirboy A. is 23 years old. He is married with 2 kids. Zohirboy provides taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for the last 3 years. Zohirboy is always trying to provide high quality services but at the same time make the prices attractive for his customers. He is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner in his large family.

Zohirboy is ready to work from the early morning till late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Today he is planning to replace the car's fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel, as this is cheaper than petrol. For this reason he is requesting US$ 800 for a term of 8 months. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of a kapron gas-cylinder for his car's fuel supply system

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Mr. Set L., 52, and his wife, Mrs. Nub Sai, 49, married in 1980 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the famiL. home, one daughter is a silk weaver, and another one is a fisherman. The famiL. lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Set has been a fisherman for 30 years, a skill he learned when he was young. He catches fish from the Mekong River and a lake near his village. Mrs. Nub Sai sells the fish that her husband catches at a local market. Set is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motor for his fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Mussarat Riaz Masih Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji, a 36-year-old resident of Yadgar area of Lahore, Pakistan, uneducated because of the school's distance from her home, is married to R. M., a factory worker. This mother of two sons, one in the 11th standard and one in the 9th standard, has operated a cosmetics business for the past four years. She has repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for another to buy cosmetics to sell.

Mussarat baji is a group leader of four other women in her locality. Guddu baji, Akbari baji and Safia baji each want a loan to buy vehicular spare parts to sell. Fahmida baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so if someone does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is fifty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: both females. She says her first daughter is married while the other is currently in junior high school. Her husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. Georgina lives with her husband and second daughter in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Georgina produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms and adds these to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and for retail. Georgina wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Georgina aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes venD. leña en su casa, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor, la leña lo adquiere D. los productores que le traen a su casa. Además Mercedes junto a su esposo compran y venden alfalfa.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Mercedes sueña con educar a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Gratitud Communal Bank.

Mercedes is married, 38 years old, and has 3 children. Mercedes sells firewood from her house; her sales are by wholesale or retail. She purchases the firewood from producers who bring it to her house. In addition, Mercedes together with her husband buy and sell alfalfa.

Mercedes needs a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) that will be invested in the purchase of firewood.

Mercedes dreams of raising her children well and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of firewood

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos, los cuales viven independientemente. Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa en chacra temporales, Epifanio nos comenta sobre los riesgos de sembrar en este tipo de terreno, pues si no llueve lo necesario, sus productos no desarrollan, pero su llueve demasiado, son afectados por las plagas, que malogran el producto, como nos muestra en la foto, unas hojas de papa enfermas. Epifanio se siente impotente al perder sus cultivos de esta manera, pero a pesar de eso, no pierde las esperanzas en esta actividad, aunque por el momento tenga que enfrentarse a estos problemas, ya que no cuenta con tierras de regadío. Aunque la siembra de papa es de mucha inversión, cuando la cosecha es fructífera, la recompensa económica es muy buena. Epifanio es un cliente muy inquieto, siempre hace intervenciones acertadas en su banco comunal, este es el 4to crédito que viene trabajando con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus cultivos y que sean resistentes a los fenómenos climatológicos.
texts.en:
Epifanio is 59 years old, he lives with his partner and mother of his four children, who all live independently. He is in agriculture for a living, planting potatos in temporary farmland. Epifanio says there are risks in planting seeds in this type of land, because if there isn't the necessary amount of rain, his products do not develop; if it rains too much, they are affected by pests that ruin the product, like the diseased potato leaves shown in the photo. Epifanio feels helpless to lose his crops in this way, but in spite of this, he does not lose hope in the activity. For now now he has to confront these problems, because he has no irrigated land. Although planting potatos is a big investment, when the harvest is succesful, the financial recompensation is very good.

Epifanio is a very eager customer, who always participates in his village bank. This is his fourth loan while working with MFP, and every time he has shown that he is a customer who is on time with each of his payments. The money he requests is to purchase fertilizer for his crops, so that they will be resistant to weather.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY G. EST UNE FEMME MARIEE NEE EN 1971 A THIES.DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE DE MARCHANDISES DIVERSES NOTAMMENT DES HABITS ET DES USTENSILES DE CUISINE .AVEC CE PRET ELLE ENVISAGE ACHETER DES MARCHANDISESPOUR RENFORCER SON COMMERCE.
texts.en:
Khady G. is a married woman born in 1971 in Thies. For several years, she has been selling various items, notably clothing and kitchen utensils. With this loan, she hopes to buy merchandise to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for re-sale

loans.name: Eghosa

texts.en:
Eghosa is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. 

She hopes for a loan of N120,000 (US$825) to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of shoes in bulk

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla R. is from the village of Biasong. She is 44 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Luzvilla owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Luzvilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay B. is from the city of Oroquieta. He is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Jay owns and operates a barber shop. The primary--but not only--source of this business's income comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Jay has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (or about $85 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jay joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jay is requesting a new loan of 14950 pesos (or about $325) which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his second loan from PMPC. Jay plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. is currently in the business of selling sandals at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase shoes and clothes to sell. Margret is 49 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Lawrencia

texts.en:
Lawrencia is a mother of two children, who are currently in school. She is twenty-nine years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in their community. She is a petty trader. She sells fresh and smoked fish in her community. She supplies fish to retailers and food vendors.

Lawrencia buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in the city. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business, increase her profits, and to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Las Mercedes Av. El Sol 745.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, galletas, gaseosas, etc. para venderlo en su tienda.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las charlas ya que son de mucha importancia y aprenden mucho.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, galletas, gaseosas, etc

loans.name: Nkwa Na Hia Group

texts.en: Stephen is twenty – nine years old. He is married and has given birth to two children. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Stephen is a trader. He runs a provision store in his community. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkwa na hia’, meaning life is the most important thing. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
B. Alisher is an ordinary man in the city of Khujand in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person that since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and three children. Alisher needs to purchase calves to reproduce them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meats. Once that he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Alisher is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla V. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years-old and married with nine adult children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling AVON products in the local community. She also owns a chainsaw that provides cutting services in neighboring villages. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perla joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Perla is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to maintain the chainsaw. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional Avon products to sell and maintain a chainsaw.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, 35 years old, has been married for eleven years now. Their marriage is blessed with two children, namely: Judy Ann, 11 years old, who is staying at her grandparents at Sillawit, Cauayan City; and Gino Paulo, 7 years old who lives with them. The family resides in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela.

Erlinda operates a typical village store that serves as her source of income. Her weekly net income is Php 300. Due to inadequate income, she decided to obtain a loan of Php 9,000 from Kiva lenders which she will use it to purchase some grocery items to sell in their village.

With the loan, Erlinda will be able to increase her income and support the schooling of her children because, according to her, she wants her children to have a good education in order to have a better future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic M.. She is 40 years old and a farmer’s wife.  She lives with her husband, Maximo, in Lumil, Silang, Cavite.

Marivic has been selling a variety of vegetables, coconuts, and other raw food items for five years now on a makeshift stall.  She sets up a table every day near the village road and displays her vegetables to sell.  She enjoys her work because she gets to meet all sorts of people.  She earns more than $340 a month.  She earns more when the weather is fine, but when it rains it’s hard for her to go out and sell.

She is now on her eleventh loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She joined this cooperative in 2006.   Marivic applied for a new loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her food market business.

Marivic wants her children to finish college.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.
