It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for her food market business

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope loves cooking so she commercialized her cooking skills by opening a restaurant at the market in Agbor, Delta State. Her stall is strategically located and lots of people patronize her stall. She cooks mouth-watering Nigerian foods like fufu (cassava dough), rice, beans, boiled yam, stew and drinks.

Hope is 50 years old and married with six children. The eldest child is 6 years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in her business for a long time. Hope is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 36 years of age, married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist community that is located on the central coast of Ghana. The main occupation of the people in this area is fishing. Sophia makes a living as a trader, running a roadside store. She procures her goods from the capital, Accra. She has been in business for eight years and has applied for a loan to buy goods in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leslie Aime

texts.es:
La Sra. Leslie, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 28 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que son independientes.

Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de Mercería. Se inicio con un capital de 
S/. 700.00 y poco a poco, fue implementando mas su negocio, gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Ya es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias, quincenales y mensuales, son muy buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mercería, como: relojes, lámparas, adornos con cerámica, floreros. Es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. 

Manifiesta su más gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Leslie belongs to the community banking group "El Breo," in the Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the Department (state) of San Martín. She's single, 28 years old and is the mother of 2 children, who are self-reliant. For 5 years she's worked selling small decorative merchandise. She began with 700 soles and little by little, she's built her business, thanks to the Manuela Ramos movement. She's already very well known by her clients in the neighborhood where she lives, and her daily, bi-monthly and monthly sales are very good. Nowadays she is still in the same business located in her same house in a location that is very well set up to attend to her clients. With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy small decorative merchandise like: clocks, lamps, ceramic decorations, and vases. She's a woman who wants very much to get ahead for the well being of her family and for herself. She would like to express her kind thanks to the Manuela Ramos movement for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a woman and for supporting other women who also want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small decorative merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Confraternidad De Damas se reúne en la ciudadela Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo, 
la señora Rosa  tiene 46 años es madre soltera de tres hijos, ella se dedica a realizar manualidades su negocio esta ubicado en su casa donde vende artesanías hechas a mano como collares, pulseras en fin todo lo que es bisutería, también vende  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños tiene aproximadamente diez años con su negocio.

Este es su primer ciclo en mi bankito ya que una amiga fue quien la incentivo para ingresar, está contenta por los beneficios que ofrece la Fundación.

Ella viaja  a Perú y  Guayaquil para realizar sus compras a los mayoristas, su inversión  es de 400 a 800 dólares y trabaja a crédito con sus clientes para incrementar su clientela. Con el préstamo que  esta solicitando comprará hilos, mullos, gafetes y más implementos para elaborar sus artesanias, así como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, interiores  para toda l familia.

Ella siempre ha trabajado sola y uno de sus sueños es tener su propio local y su casa.
texts.en:
The Confraternidad de Damas communal bank meets in the Pacheco housing project of Portoviejo. Rosa, 46, is a single mother of three children; she is a craftsperson. She maks such things as necklaces, bracelets and all kinds of costume jewelry; she also sells clothing for women, men and children. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and she sells from her home. This is her first cycle with the bank; she was encouraged to join by a friend. She is happy with the benefits the Foundation offers. She travels to Perú and Guayaquil to buy from wholesalers. She invests from 400 to 800 dolars and sells to her customers on credit in order to obtain more customers. This funding will be used to buy thread, beads, hooks and other supplies for her crafts as well as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts and underwear for the entire family. She has always worked by herself and one of her dreams is to have her own store and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, beads, hooks, etc. pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia R. D. Y. posee una clínica D. rehabilitación que lleva el nombre D. Clínica San Carlos posee antigüedad en el ramo.

Su clínica esta ubicada en el barrio San Miguel del distrito D. Cambyreta y posee casa propia en el barrio San Isidro D. la cuidad D. Encarnación vivienda en la cual aun no vive ya que esta reformando.  

El destino del crédito es para reformas en su D. la clinica para porner en condiciones la sala D. consultas y así birndar una mejor antencion a los pacientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Celia R. D. Y. owns a rehabilitation clinic called Clinica San Carlos, a long and well-established clinic in this field. Her clinic is located in the neighborhood of San Miguel in the district of Cambyreta. She owns her own house in the neighborhood of San Isidro in the city of Encarnacion, an area that is improving. The loan will be used to improve the consultation room and thus proviD. better care to the patients.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for construction such as bricks and paint.

loans.name: Yessenia Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Yessenia R. es madre de tres niños, ella trabaja en conjunto con su esposo en el cual el negocio consiste en el alquiler de tricitaxis para brindar servicio de transporte a los pobladores del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente tienen seis años de tener su propio negocio y gracias a los tres créditos que han obtenido con ceprodel han adquirido alrededor de seis tricitaxis, lo que les ha permitido obtener mayores ingresos y brindar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de dos tricitaxis.
texts.en:
Yessenia R. has three daughters. She and her husband work leasing rickshaws to provide transportation services to residents of El Sauce. They have been in this line of work for 6 years and, thanks to the three loans from Ceprodel that they have gotten, they have purchased 6 rickshaws. This has made it possible for them to earn higher income and provide a better standard of living for their children. They will use the funds to buy two rickshaws.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two rickshaws.

loans.name: Julia Lily

texts.es: La señora Julia Lyli P. Sandobal es comerciante de este mercado  ubicado en el sector madera tiene  mas de 15 años de operar para esta actividad, su negocio lo inicio con poca mercadería solo tenia un tamo con un capital de C$ 5,000.00 que fueron ahorrad,  ahora tengo tres tramos y tiene bien surtido su negocio  siempre le ha gustado tener su negocio y trabajar por si sola tiene un hijo y un sobrino que le ayuda a vender en el mercado  tiene seis años de trabajar con ceprodel y con este tipo de financiamientos  los cuales le han ayudado bastante ya que su negocio a evolucionado grandemente la señora P. siempre ha sido comerciante le ha gustado depender de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Lyli Perez Sandobal is a merchant in this market located in the Madera sector. She has been doing this activity for more than 15 years. She started her business with little merchandise. She only had one section with C$5,000.00 in capital she has saved up. Now she has three sections and her business has a wide selection. She has always likes having her business and working for herself. She has a son and a nephew who help her sell in the market. She has been working with Ceprodel for six years with this type of financing. It has helped her a lot since her business has evolved greatly. Mrs. Perez has always been a merchant. She has liked depending on her own hard work and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some cribs and bottles

loans.name: Isabel Eusebia

texts.es: A consecuencia de un robo, y la difícil situación que atravesó la familia de Isabel, ella tuvo que apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, empezó haciendo postres como tortas, mazamorras, gelatinas, flan, leche asada y otros postres conocidos que vendía en el kiosco de un colegio aledaño a su vivienda, pero eso no ayudaba mucho con los gastos, así que con el préstamo obtenido comprara menaje y otros utensilios que necesite para apertura un restaurante en su vivienda con el cual pueda lograr mayores ingresos. Ella está muy contenta y tiene muchas expectativas con este nuevo reto.
texts.en:
Because of a robbery and the difficult situation that has occured to the family of Isabel, she had to help her husband with the family expenses. She started making desserts like cake, mazamorras (a kind of corn pudding), gelatins, flan, leche asada ("roasted milk") and other well-known desserts that she sold in a kiosk of a school next to her home. But this hasn't help much with the expenses, which is why with this loan that she receives, she will buy supplies and other utensils that she needs to open a restaurant in her home, with which she'll be able to generate greater income. She is very content and is excited about this new challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom P. is 65 years old. She is a villager who lives in Chrey Young village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ban Dith, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farming crop. Thus, Mrs. Rom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her purpose. Mrs. Rom P. is the mother of two children who are seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Najebullah

texts.en:
Najebullah, the son of S. A., is 31 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He lives in Kabul with his family of 8 members, including his father, his mother and one brother. Najebullah has a catering shop in Kabul and he has been involved in this business for more than five years.

He is now experiencing some financial problems. Najebullah has requested a loan of 50,000 AFN to buy some tools such as pots, bowls, spoons and more. He wants to thank all the lenders of Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan for supporting poor people in this poor country.

loans.use: to buy some tools such as pots, bowls, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel A. G. tiene 44 años de edad, es viudo desde hace 9 años, tiene 1 hijo mayor el cual vive con el padre y ya tiene propia familia formada.
El señor Miguel tiene un ingreso fijo ya que trabaja como fletero  para una empresa privada.
El desea mucho terminar con la construcción de la muralla de su casa ya para el resultará mas segura su casa despues de la construccion, para este proyecto solicita un préstamo y agradece a la Fundacion Y Kiva por la ayuda.
texts.en:
Miguel A. G. is 44 years old and has been a widower for 9 years. He has 1 son, who lives with him and has already started his own family. Miguel has a fixed income from his work as a freight driver for a private company. He really wants to finish constructing the wall of his house, since finishing the construction will make his home more secure. He is asking for a loan for this project, and is grateful to the Foundation and Kiva for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bricks to finish building the wall of his house

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia M. is from the village of Pob. Manukan. She is 55 years old. Constancia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Constancia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Constancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constancia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Constancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Maria Purificacion

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser hermosa y poseer llanuras, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de una mejor estabilidad económica.

Nuestra socia forma parte del banco comunal hace 3 años, se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa en donde aprovecha para criar ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende a los carros lecheros que hay.

La Señora. María tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, casados y viven de manera independiente, su esposo se dedica al trabajo en la construcción.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para seguir creciendo en su negocio, Su sueño es tener siempre buena salud.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria M. is a member of the Nuevas Amigas community bank in the parrish of Cumbe. The parrish is considered beautiful and is known for its wide plains. The local people make a living from farming and raising livestock. Many young people have migrated from the area in search of better economic opportunities. Sra. Maria has been a member of the bank for 3 years. She is responsible for household duties but makes the most of her day by raising cattle and producing milk which she then sells to local buyers of milk. Sra. Maria is 62 years old. She is married and the mother of 8 children, all grown, married and independent. Her husband works in construction. She will use the loan to buy a cow so that she can continue to expand her business. Her greatest hope is to always have good health.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow for milk business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 and 14. Marie makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop. These goods include soap, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for about two years. The hours of her business are from 8 am to 7 pm every day.

Marie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to allow her to start investing in the sale of more foodstuffs (rice, beans, wheat, peas, cassava, sugar, etc.) With the sale of these foodstuffs, Marie will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to start saving for the future of her family as well as her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, for sale

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
WALTER ANTONIO R. D.,Trabaja como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua.El va a utilizar en la compra de materiales de construcción  de su casa va cambiar el Sistema Electrico de su casa, y el resto en gastos familiares.
es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
dice; Toda la plata que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación y algunos gastos familiares que tiene.
texts.en:
Walter Antonio R. D. works as a security guard in Managua's Ivan Montenegro market. He will use the loan to buy construction materials for his house. He will change the electrical system in his house, and will use the rest for personal expenses. He is the father of 2 children who are school-aged. He says that all of the money from CEPRODEL will be used to improve his house and pay for some household expenses that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house: he will change the electrical system in his house and also pay for some household expenses.

loans.name: Karen Johana

texts.es:
Karen de 18 años, por la falta de oportunidades ella comenzó a vender ropa desde que salio del colegio para solventar con sus gastos, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas),

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano para ayudar con los gastos familiares, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones a sus amigos y conocidos. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm.  

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y así asegurar los pagos de la universidad. En el futuro quiere tener su propia almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Karen is 18 years old. Because she lacked opportunities, she started to sell clothing once she left school to pay for her expenses. She lives in the Orquídeas neighborhood of Guayaquil (an urban area, named "orchids" because in this area one can find many orchid flowers.) She carries out her work alone from the early morning hours to help with the family expenses. She sells blouses, shirts and pants to her friends and acquaintances. She works from 8am until 8pm. She wants a loan to buy clothing and in this way secure her payments for the university. In the future she wants to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Carmen Marisol

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Carmen que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene una relación de unión libre hace 20 años, de esta relación tuvieron tres hijos, una mayor de edad que estudia en la Universidad y los dos menores en el colegio, el marido es chofer (realiza fletes).

Tiene una pequeña picantería en su casa en el cual vende encebolladlos, ceviches y otros platos deliciosos que se preparan con mariscos. Trabaja de Jueves a Domingo de 7am. a 1pm, con la ayuda de su marido y sus hijos, dice que este negocio lo puso con ayuda de un crédito que realizo en la Fundación Espoir y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sillas y mesas para dar más comodidad a sus  clientes.
 
Tiene siete ciclos en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir muchos ciclos más.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, we find the Ciudadela San Gregorio, a place where the members of the communal bank "San Gregorio" meet twice a month. Here we find Carmen, who tells us something about her life. She has been in a common-law marriage for 20 years, and from this marriage they have 3 children: one who is now grown and studies in the University, and 2 younger ones who are in school. Her husband is a driver who transports freight. They have a small family-style restaurant attached to their home where they sell traditional food such as: encebollados (a soup made of tuna, cassava and vegetables), ceviche, and other dishes made from seafood. She works from Thursday to Sunday from 7am until 1pm, with the help of her husband and their children. She says that this business was established with the help of a loan that was taken from the Fundación Espoir, and that it has done very well. This new loan will be used to buy tables and chairs to provide greater comfort to her customers. She has participated in 7 loan cycles with her communal bank, and she hopes to continue for many more cycles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Tereso

texts.en:
Tereso V. is 35 years old, married and has three children aged thirteen, nine and one. He is from the town of Talibon in Bohol province on the Visayas islands. Tereso is a fisherman who uses his fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. He is working hard because he wants to achieve his dream of having his children finish college someday.

Tereso joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Las Pascuas Group

texts.es: Doña Vicenta X. D. cuarenta años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene nueve hijos y tres hijas, dona Vicenta es una emprendedora en su hogar para prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales, como también atienD. una tiendecita que ella  ha podido  mantener, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Vicenta se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, y tratar la manera D. apoyar a su comunidad para que las persona puedan comprar lo necesario en el consumo diario y así evitar subir a comprar al pueblo ya que a ellos les que muy lejos, y así D. esa manera ella pueD. obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 12 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. camisolas y pantalonetas, pants blusas, venta D. mercería, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vicenta X., 40, is married.  She has nine sons and three daughters.  Vicenta is enterprising in order to prepare a better future for her children.  She raises small farm animals and tends to a small grocery store she’s managed to have for over ten years.

Vicenta noted that she had to better stock the store in order to improve sales and support her community offering what they need for daily consumption without having to go all the way up to town which is quite distant.  This way she is able to earn a few more profits.

She, therefore, gathered together a few friends and neighbors that she has known for over 12 years to form a group because she tries to help not just her own family but also other people in the village.

Each of them is engaged in a different type of activity, such as: fruit sales, small animal raising, clothes making, notions sales, etc.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Razia Mushtaq Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Razia M. A. lives in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She is married to M. A. who works at a private company for a monthly wage. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house.

Razia is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household duties. She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. All are illiterate except her daughter who is studying at the fifth class level. All three of her sons work. Her eldest son has a grocery store in the market. The middle son has a burger joint, and the youngest is a tailor by profession. They all contribute to the family financially from their earnings.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her eldest son’s grocery store business. His store is located in the busiest market, and his business demands that he keep in stock all the necessary items required by his customers. He will invest the loan to purchase groceries in bulk for his store which will enable him to make more sales and increase his income. Razia is hopeful that this loan investment will shape up his business and move it towards success.

Razia is a regular Asasah borrower, and this is her third loan application. She is a client who has responsibly made her payments during her previous loan periods. In the photo, the woman who holds a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) in her hands is Razia.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk quantities for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando S. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Orlando owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating his transportation service-based business. Orlando has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Orlando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Orlando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Orlando is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to expand his vehicle transportation service business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Orlando from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand vehicle transportation business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida B. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for almost one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Adelaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida is requesting a loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 8th taken out by Adelaida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Sansao Jamisse

texts.pt:
Sanção Samussone Jamisse M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 1 e 4 anos de idade. Fez a 9ª classe não continuou porque teve que começar atrabalhar cedo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa.

Nunca saiu do Distrito, após a morte do seu pai a vida fica dificil, e teve que começar a trabalhar muito cedo tendo assim que abandonar os estudos. Consegue então aranjar um emprego na Empresa G4S como segurança onde Trabalha em turnos onde opera ha mais de 3 anos auferindo mensalmente 3.800.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Sansão na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e outros). Os anteriores emprestimos de 7.000.00, 12.000.00 e 15.000.00mt forão usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta  confiante que vai reembolsar  antes do tempo e pedir mais ainda para finalizar a sua obra, pois ainda tem muito trabalho pela frente.
texts.en:
Sanção Samussone Jamisse M. was born in Namaacha, a province of Maputo, Mozambique, where he still lives. He is married and the father of two children ages 1 and 4. His studies were interrupted after 9th Grade, when his father died and he had to start working to support himself. He lives with his family, as well as his mother, whom he supports, in a house they own.

For the past three years he has been working as a security guard for the company GS4 , earning a monthly salary of 3.800.00mt, which allows him to pay for household and construction expenses as well as to save some money in the bank.

This is Sanção's fourth loan with Hluvuku e the first one with Kiva. He will use the 15.000.00mt to buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, etc). His previous loans, in the amount of 7.000.00, 12.000.00 and 15.000.00mt were used in the same manner.

He is confident he can pay back his loan ahead of schedule and, as there's still much work to be done to finish the house, he plans to apply for more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, stones, sand, etc)

loans.name: Abahujumugambi No 3 Group

texts.fr: Alexis Ntwarinyakagabo est agent de la pharmacie, et il est un membre du groupe Abahujumugambi.  Il  a 38 ans, il est marié, et il a 5 enfants entre 2 ans et 14 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de médicament, Maalox, et paracétamol pour son activité de pharmacie.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer ses activités Professional pharmaceutique.  Il voudrait devenir grossiste, et pour la famille, il voudrait payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants, et acheter d’une parcelle.
texts.en: Alexis Ntwarinyakagabo is a pharmaceuticals salesman and he is a member of the Abahujumugambi group. He is 38 years old, married and has five children between the ages of two and fourteen. Three of his children attend school. He is going to use his loan to buy medecines: Maalox and paracetamol for his pharmaceutical business. His strategy to expand his business is to improve his professional pharmaceutical activities. He would like to become a wholesaler, and with regard to his family, he would like to be able to pay his children's school fees and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Purchase of medecines: Maalox and paracetamol for his pharmaceutical business,

loans.name: Bumu Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 56-year-old Resty N. has been in the used clothing sales business for the last ten years in Kirinya-Mukono. The happily married mother of twelve says the need for self reliance motivated her to try her hand at this business. Since she began she has never looked back. With this business she has been able to provide for her family in many ways, principally the education of her kids. Resty says this business brings in about $43 a week. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell. Resty belongs to the Bumu Development Group.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of used clothing for resell

loans.name: Sadijatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Sadijatu. She is married and has three children, ages 14, 9, and 8. She has one additional dependent. In 2004, Sadijatu established her drinks and clothing business. Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more cotton fabrics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Sadijatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cotton fabrics

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 54 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Ermes de 59 años, y su hijo Elar de 17 años, de los 4 que tiene en total. Hace más de 8 años esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, en su bodega situado en el primer ambiente de su casa. En este negocio vende de todo, como verduras, frutas, lácteos, productos comestibles de toda la variedades y licores. Siendo así el negocio más concurrido de su barrio y, por eso durante la mañana termina muy agotada su labor,  por lo que algunas veces su hijo la apoya. Esta muy satisfecha por su negocio y las utilidades que le genera, ya que con esas ganancias de a poco fue construyendo su casa. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación sabe que podrá ampliar su negocio y brindar su educación superior a su hijo, así mismo terminar de construir su casa con sus respectivos acabados y de ese modo vivir una vida más placentera. Es el 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lucia, tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería que necesita para abastecer su negocio de comestibles, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Lucia is 54 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband Ermes, who is 59, and their son Elar, who is 17, of the 4 children they have in total. For more than 8 years, this hardworking woman has been selling food products in her store located on the first floor of her house.  She sells everything in her business, such as vegetables, fruits, dairy products of all types, and liquor. Her business is the most popular one in her neighborhood and that is why in the morning she is very tired when she finishes her work. Sometimes, her son helps her. She is very satisfied with her business and the profits it generates her, since she built her house with the profits. With a lot of hard work and dedication she knows she can grow her business and offer a college education to her son, as well as finish building her house and thus live more pleasantly. This is the 16th loan that she has had with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time.  She does not want to defraud all the people who made this contribution possible, which will allow her to continue working to seek progress. Lucia plans on investing the loan she has asked for in buying merchandise she needs to supply her business, since she wants to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to supply her store.

loans.name: Jinnilyn

texts.en:
Jinnilyn L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Jinnilyn owns a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Jinnilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes for an increased harvest through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila madre soltera, sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes anteriormente trabajaba lavando y planchando, ahora trabaja como domestica, sus hijos le ayudan y tiene cuartos de alquiler los cuales son ingreso extra para cubrir los gastos. Su vivienda es humilde y poco a poco ha ido realizando mejoras mediante el financiamiento. 
El préstamo que solicitad será para compra materiales: cemento, arena, hierro, perlines, bloques, laminas de zinc para construir el anexo que será la cocina de la vivienda.
texts.en: Petronila is a single mother.  Her chidren are already adults and live independently.  She used to work washing and ironing clothes.  She now works as a housekeeper and her children help her.  She has rooms to rent as well which provide extra income to cover expenses.  Her home is humble and little by little she has made improvements with loans.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials:  cement, sand, iron, roof beams, concrete blocks, and zinc plates to construct an addition to her home that will be a kitchen.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.name: Unity Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Unity II” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Emmah K. is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a mechanic and they have four children. 

Emmah has been a businesswoman for two years now. She sells slippers, rubber bowls, bags, watches, cultural chains, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, rubber bowls, bags, watches, cultural chains and more at wholesale prices

loans.name: Jalpeñitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama JALPEÑITAS porque el lugar donde radican lleva por nombre Jalpa que viene del nahuatl lugar sobre arena; ubicado en Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la priM. vez que piden un prestamo. La señora Teresa de Jesus L. es integrante del grupo tiene 56 años de edad no tiene ningun grado de escolaridad y tiene un hijo varon. Ella vende tamales y cosmeticos desde hace 30 años solicita el prestamo para comprar de mercancia, los clientes dicen que les gusta comprar  con ella  porque las señora es muy luchona y amable con todos y cuando tienen algun problema piden su punto de vista por la experiencia que tiene. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicito el prestamo para comprar más mercancia como productos de belleza y aíz para sus tamales ya que necesita los dos trabajos por que no le alcanza el con uno solo para los gastos de su familia y le hacen muchos pedidos y aveces no tiene para comprar todo. También espera con esto darle una mejor educación a su hijo ya que ella no la tuvo.
texts.en:
This group is called JALPEÑITAS because the village where the members live is called Jalpa, which comes from the Nahuatl word for 'place on sand'.  It is located in the State of Hidalgo, in Mexico.

This group has 10 members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan.  Teresa de Jesús López is a member of the group.  She is 56 years old and didn't attend school.  She has one son.  Teresa has been selling cosmetics and tamales for 30 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise.  Her customers say that they like to buy from her because she is very hard working and kind to everybody.  Whenever they have a problem they ask her point of view because of the experience that she has.  At the time of requesting this loan, Teresa feels very happy and has a great desire to work.  She requested this loan to buy more merchandise such as beauty products and also corn for making her tamales.  She needs both of her jobs because she can't cover her family's expenses with just the one.  Her customers make a lot of orders and sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy everything.  Teresa hopes that she will be able to provide a better education for her son since she never received an education herself.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and corn

loans.name: Diva Ester

texts.es:
Diva Esther P. tiene 67 años y vive en el barrio "Los Caracoles" de la ciudad de Cartagena, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías variada, como cosméticos, electrodomésticos de marcas reconocidas y ropa en general, actividad con la que ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante gracias a su trabajo, pues es una mujer viuda y madre de 4 hijos, hoy en las edades de 30 a 45 años. Inicialmente trabajó de empleada de una familia y luego lo hizo  independientemente vendiendo productos puerta a puerta, impulsada por una amiga, de esta manera construyó su propia clientela y hoy la buscan en su casa para comprarle productos, pues ofrece crédito y contado a buenos precios.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará mercancías variadas, como cosméticos, ropa para damas, aprovechando la temporada de incremento de sus ventas con motivo de la celebración del día de las madres, fecha en la cual sus clientes quieren homenajear a todas las mujeres de las familias que son madres, mediante el obsequio de detalles que solo Diva sabe escoger  y venderles. Su sueño es tener un capital suficiente para rotarlo rápidamente y ganar más dinero con el incremento de sus ventas, pero mientras esto ocurre, ella se esmera en sostener su negocio con una autonomia del 73,25%, una rentabilidad no menor de 35% y responderle a su clientela con responsabilidad y calidad en la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Diva Esther P. is 67 years old and she lives in the community of "Los Caracoles" in the city of Cartagena where she has a general store, selling cosmetics, household items of well-known brands and clothing in general. It is through this business that she has been able to support her family. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children, aged between 30 to 45 years of age. She started out working as an employee of a family and later she became independent, selling products from door to door. She was encouraged by a friend and this is how she earned her own client base and today they look to buy her products at her house. She completes her sales on credit and in cash, giving good prices.

This is her first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase various merchandise, including cosmetics and ladies' clothing taking advantage of the season when the sales are high for the Mother's Day celebrations. For this day her clients wish to honor all of the women of their families who are mothers with a kind of gift that ony Diva knows how to chose and offer for sale. Her dream is to have enough capital funds to reinvest rapidly and to generate more income with the increase her sales.  But in the meantime she endeavors to maintain her business independently at 73.25% and a profit margin of no less than 35%. She also works to respond to her clients with responsibility and with quality products.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise such as cosmetics and ladies' clothing.

loans.name: Dohami I Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "DOHAMI I" est formé de trois  personnes qui mènent toutes des activités similaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Pauline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Pauline est mariée à un certain Dominique. Le couple a quatre  enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à leur charge. Pauline habite au quartier Vossa à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis huit ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de cinq ans que Pauline mène comme activité, la vente de noix d’acajou à Cotonou. Pauline s’approvisionne à Agonli et à Dassa-Zoumé dans le Nord du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Pauline désire obtenir un autre crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The "DOHAMI I" group has three members who all work in a similar business. The representative of the group, Pauline has her hand raised in the photo. This is the third time they are asking for a loan from Alidé with the intention of increasing their level of business activity. Pauline is married to Dominique, together they have four children who are all in school with three who are their dependents. They have lived together as a family in the Vossa neighborhood in Cotonou (economic capital of Benin) for eight years now. The couple is responsible together for all the family expenses. Pauline has been in the business of selling cashew nuts for almost five years in Cotonou. She buys her supplies in Agonli and Dassa-Zoumé in north Benin. With the goal to increase her inventory of cashew nuts and to better respond to her clients demand, Pauline is asking for another loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq is a low-income person. He is 38 and lives with his wife and three children.  He has a grocery store where he sells foodstuffs.  His business is very successful but needs some capital investment to increase its daily turnover. That is why Sadiq has applied for a loan of 1300 AZN. This loan will allow him to buy larger amounts of goods for resale.  The additional profit will help him better provide for his family and save more money to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to resell

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat, age 36, owns and operates a café where he prepares and sells shish kebab. His café is located at the market and he has been in this business for six years. On average, he services 20 to 25 clients a day. Shavkat tries to use only the best inputs in his café. He believes that this is why the business is stable and brings in considerable income for the family. He and his wife have two children.

Shavkat is planning to expand his business, thereby to earn more money to support his household. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 8,500 Somoni. He is planning to purchase the meat and coal required for cooking shish kebab in his café. This amount will help him accomplish his goals on an accelerated schedule. 

Shavkat thanks everyone who is supporting him. 

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase the meat and coal required for cooking shish kebab in his café

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Betty faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing more business in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for sale.

loans.name: Wambui

texts.en:
Wambui is a 34-year-old businesswoman married to Patrick, who contributes to the family income. They are blessed with two children, 13 and 15 years old. Wambui has been running a hotel for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family members.

Wambui is applying for her third loan with KADET, having repaid her previous loans successfully. Wambui will use the loan to stock up on cooking oil and wheat flour and to purchase a television. She plans to use the anticipated profit from her business to construct her own house and relocate the family. Her hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and construct a big hotel in her home town.

loans.use: to stock up on cooking oil and wheat flour and to purchase a television

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor tiene 52 años, es soltero, con un hijo llamado Oscar que tiene 21 años, viven en casa propia y los 2 se encargan de hacer trabajar en su domicilio una casa de costura. 
Victor se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir con ayuda de 3 personas para una empresa en la capital del país. Victor nos cuenta que empezó a los 14 años en el ramo de costura y ya llevan 23 años en la actividad, cuenta con mucha experiencia y con clientela formada debido a la buena calidad de sus productos.
Se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, no tiene miedo al trabajo. Su esfuerzo es para poder día a día generar mayores ingresos. Solicita el credito para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos para el ejercicio de su profesión.
texts.en:
Victor is 52 years old, single, and has a 21-year old son named Oscar. They live in their own home and both work from the home as tailors. Victor works sewing clothing along with three other people for a business in the country's capital. Victor shares that he began working in the sewing field when he was 14 years old and has now been doing this work for 23 years. He has a lot of experience and regular customers due to the good quality of his products.

He describes himself as a hardworking man who is a fighter and not afraid to work. His works hard to earn more money each day. He is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies for his profession.

loans.use: buy fabric and thread for his profession

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana cuenta con negocio desde hace 5 años denominado  “Mini súper La Escondida•  donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos. La señora recurre a esta institución para pedir apoyo para surtir su negocio comprando variedad de producto de diversas marcas de buena calidad y así obtener más ganancias para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia. El esposo es un hombre muy responsable con los gastos por ello trabaja para una persona como electricista desde hace 6 años.
texts.en: Juana has had a business called “Minisúper La Escondida” for the last five years where she offers her customers groceries in general like snacks and soft drinks.  She is calling on this institution to ask for help to stock her store buying a variety of products of different, good quality brands to earn more profits to cover her family’s expenses.  Her husband is a very responsible man with respect to expenses and has been working as an electrician for someone for the last six years.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nile

texts.es: Nile  de 26 años es una joven emprendedora que vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del mar que posee  vocación turística, por estar ubicado provisto de playas, que albergan a su alrededor negocios como restaurantes y muchos vendedores individuales de alimentos,  refrescos, artesanías, pinturas, entre otras actividades que se practican de manera formal e informal en este municipio. Por esta razón Nile emprendió un negocio desde hace 1 años, donde vende refrescos y pasabocas, además de tener 2 vitrinas surtidas de artesanías que elabora con sus propias manos y  de mercancías variadas. Su principal mercado son las madres de los niños que atiende su hermana, quien es madre comunitaria, pues pertenece al programa del Instituto colombiano de Bienestar familiar, organismo estatal, dedicado a la protección  y el cuidado de niños, en  la primera infancia, mientras sus padres trabajan. Nile elabora con sus propias manos accesorios femeninos, collares, pulseras a clientes que le pagan en dos o tres partidas quincenales. Su mayor desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo, para responder a sus clientes de inmediato, porque la  mayor parte de las ventas las hace a crédito, debe esperar recuperar sus cuentas por cobrar para poder consentir a su clientela y esto no lo ha logrado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará pasabocas y materias primas para producir sus artesanías, porque tiene collares y pulsos encargados por vendedores al detalle, a quines desea convertir en sus principales clientes, porque este es un enorme mercado. Mientras Nile trabaja para lograr su sueño de aumentar cada día el bienestar de su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 9 años, maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 30% y una rotación de inventarios de 5 días
texts.en: Nile is 26 years old. She is an enterprising young woman who lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, located on the shore. It has a lot of tourism because it has a lot of beaches that foment businesses such as restaurants and many individual sellers of food, drinks, artisanal crafts, and paintings, among other formal and informal activities in this town. That is why Nile started a business a year ago where she sells beverages and snacks. She also has two display cases full of artisanal crafts made by her own hands, as well as various merchandise. Her main market is the mothers of the children her sister takes care of. She is a community mother who belongs to the Colombian Institute of Family Wellbeing, a government organization dedicated to the protection and care of young children while their parents work. Nile makes women's accessories, necklaces, and bracelets with her own hands for customers who pay her over two or three pay periods. Her biggest challenge is not having enough working capital to respond to her customers immediately. She does most of her sales on credit, and she has to wait to recover the money that's owed to be able to serve her customers and she hasn't been able to do this. That is why now she is getting a Kiva loan. With it, she will buy snacks and raw materials to make her artisanal crafts, because some retailers have ordered necklaces and bracelets from her, and she wants to make them her main customers, as this is a huge market.    Nlie works to achieve her dream of increasing her family's wellbeing everyday. Her family consists of her husband and two children aged 11 and 9. She has a profit margin of no less than 30% and an inventory turnover of 5 days.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make artisanal crafts and snacks.

loans.name: Elvira De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Elvira es socia de banco comunal Tocte, vive por la comunidad de Tocte lugar que se encuentra rodeado de una bella naturaleza, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos laboran en artesanías o salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Elvira tiene 47 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 16 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Elvira se dedica al cuidado de ganado en una finca, lleva 7 años en este trabajo y labora de domingo a domingo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes, borregos y gallinas a  los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hierba para sus animales y de abono para mejorar sus potreros.

Su meta terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the communal bank "Tocte."  She lives in the community of Tocte, a place surrounded by natural beauty, with people who maintain their culture and traditions.  The people there work in agriculture and animal husbandry, and many also work in handicrafts or leave the city to work in different activities.

Elvira is 47 years old.  She is a single mother with three children aged 22, 16, and 10 years.  Her oldest child is married and independent, and her middle child works and helps her financially.  Her youngest child studies in a local school.  She owns the house that they live in.

Elvira cares for livestock on a farm.  She has been doing this work for 7 years, and she works every day.  At her house she raises pigs, guinea pigs, lambs and hens that she sells when she needs the money.

She has been in her communal bank for 3 years, and she will invest the proceeds of this loan in grass to feed her animals and fertilizer to improve her paddock.  

Her goal is to finish her house, as it still lacks some finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy grass to feed her animals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es: Hilda Ceferina se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues las experiencias que ha obtenido han sido gratificantes. Desde hace más de 22 años que tiene esta actividad, las ganas de sacar adelante a su familia son lo que motiva a Hilda a seguir trabajando fuertemente como lo realiza todos los días. Este crédito es con el objetivo de comprar melones, mangos, sandias, repollo, cebolla, papa, entre otros.
texts.en: Hilda Cerefina sells fruits and vegetables. This is not first time she has a requested loan. Therefore, the experiences she had have been rewarding. For more than 22 years, Hilda has been a vendor. She wishes to help her family get ahead. This is her motive for continuing to work hard every day. This loan will be used to purchase melons, watermelons, cabbage, onions, potatoes and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: buy melons, mangoes, watermelons, cabbages, onions, potaoes and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Thi lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. To support her family, Thi earns an income by buying and selling scraps of fabric. Thi started this business four years ago. 

Thi would like to take a loan to expand her current business to include the recycling of other types of waste materials. With the loan, she will buy and process different kinds of waste materials, such as plastics, and then resell them to a wholesaler. 

Thi hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy and process waste materials for recycling.

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación, es de clima frió, su población en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura o cría de animales, su gente es muy amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Silvia tiene 53 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, 2 de ellos son casados e independientes, y sus hijos solteros trabajan solo para sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora como aserrador (leñador), la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Silvia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a la agricultura que es solo para su consumo y también cría y vende animales, tiene ovejas, cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y ganado.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the 14 de Agosto Communal Bank.  She lives in the community of Zhidmad, a place that has abundant vegetation and a cold climate.  The majority of the people work in agriculture or raising animals.  The people there are very agreeable and kind, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Silvia is 53 years old and married, and from this relationship has conceived five children, who are of legal age.  Two of her children are married and living on their own, and her single children work only to pay their personal expenses.  Her husband works as a sawyer (woodcutter).  

Silvia works in the home, in agriculture for her own consumption, and also raises and sells animals.  She has sheep, pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock.
 
This is her second loan from the communal bank and she's going to invest it in buying livestock.
 
Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Tania came to the United States in search of better opportunities. She dreamed of becoming a self-sufficient entrepreneur and leaving a legacy for her children and family. In 2006, Tania and her husband started a janitorial services company. Since then, they have purchased a franchise and contracts with different organizations. The contracts have allowed Tania to grow the business through referrals and the opportunity to provide cleaning services to a wide variety of companies. Tania’s business, Tanilan Services, has been able to hire two employees while continuing to expand. In the beginning, Tania faced the biggest challenge of not being able to find financing to grow her business.

This is Tania’s second loan with Accion USA. She will use this loan to expand the franchise and purchase more contracts which will bring in more income.

“This will allow us to reach out to a wider community, increase our presence, and spread the word about Tanilan Services.”

loans.use: To purchase more contracts for cleaning services.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El Señor Andrés es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive en su casa propia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casado con la señora Teresita de 39 años de edad.
El señor Andrés tiene una despensa en su casa, en la cual recibe la ayuda de su esposa. Ellos por medio de su esfuerzo está logrando abrirse camino y hacer que sus ingresos crezcan para que de esa forma puedan sustentar su hogar y cubrir los demás gastos.
El se considera un hombre muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor, quiere que su esposa tenga siempre lo mejor y no tenga que pasar por ningun tipo de privaciones, es por ello que se esfuerza diariamente.
El solicita la ayuda de Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrés is from the city of Santaní.  He lives in his own house, is 42 years old and is married to Teresita, 39.  

Andrés has a grocery store at home that his wife helps him with.  Through their efforts they are making headway and managing to increase their income to support their home and cover other expenses.

He considers himself to be a very hardworking, tenacious, enterprising man who wants his wife to always have the best and not have to go through any privations.  Because of this he strives daily.

He asks for help from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva to buy foodstuffs, beverages, dairy products, baked goods and others to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Janice has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock from AVON.
Janice is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON such as clothing & beauty products

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is divorced and has two children. He runs a hotel and sells tea, meat, snacks and food to frequent and new customers. He has two employees. In addition to that he also owns rental houses. The hotel business is faced with the problem of the increasing prices of goods. He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy wheat flour, beans and milk. Albert describes himself as honest, faithful, trustworthy and of high hospitality.

loans.use: to increase stock of flour, milk and beans.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a hardworking business man, aged 62. He is married and blessed with six children. He has been running a retail shop business for the last twelve years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and bread for resale. In the next 5 years, he plans to manage a supermarket business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and bread.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha is a 57-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their five children who are still attending school. She coordinates with her husband to satisfy the family needs. Aysha had ten years of experience in selling electronics supplies and satellites, before deciding to open her own shop in 2006. As for her husband’s job, it consists of installing satellites upon customers’ requests. Today, Aysha is asking for a loan of $2,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added equipment for her business, such as satellites, mixers, refrigerators and many other items, in order to increase her revenue. In the future, she plans to expand her shop by adding diverse electrical items.

loans.use: to purchase added equipment, such as satellites, mixers, refrigerators and many other items, for her business.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 34 year old mother with a high school education. For some time Iman has been unemployed and decided, with training and assistance, to open her own business. She learned to sew and has begun to assist family and friends with seamstress service. Now as she wants to provide better for herself and her child she has turned her skill into a business activity to increase her household's monthly income. 

Iman needed this loan to purchase cloth and a sewing machine. The loan is assisting her in developing her business and increasing her earnings. 

Iman wants in the future to improve her design skills. She wants one day to sell her own dress designs and products.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zambarau Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her late 40s is married with one child. She has been a food vendor for about ten years now. She works from 6 am to 11 pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of food and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to stock more food. Halima’s dream is to one day be an international business woman.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group, "Zambarau", which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add to her stock of food.

loans.name: Khurlee

texts.en:
Mr. Khurlee lives with his wife and his son in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has been running a taxi since 2007 around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has gained experience in his business and already has many permanent customers who he often serves.
Khurlee is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a car for his taxi business. He needs to renew his car for a better one because his current car is getting old and becoming inadequate for taxi service – possibly giving a negative impression to his passengers. Therefore, he has decided to replace his car in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 24 años de edad, es una joven estudiante universitaria y emprendedora, además de ser amable y solidaria. Es soltera y vive en compañía de sus 02 hermanos, su madre y su abuela, habitando cómodamente la casa de su abuela. La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de productos de belleza, productos que son adquiridos por catálogos y que son vendidos a amistades, vecinos. Tiene más de 02 años en éste negocio y paralelo a ello elabora collares y pulseras de manera artesanal, actividad que lo aprendió hace un año en un centro laboral. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para poder apoyarse con el pago de sus estudios universitarios ya que necesita de material educativo, asimismo con éste trabajo adminstra su tiempo libre para su trabajo y estudio. Ahroa lo que desea es ampliar su negocio con la venta de zapatos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y materiales de bisutería.
texts.en:
Liz, 24, is a young, entrepreneurial college student. She is single and lives with her two siblings, her mother and her grandmother. They all live comfortably in her grandmother's house. 
Liz sells catalogue beauty products and cosmetics to her friends and neighbors. She has been in this business for two years and she also makes necklaces and bracelets, an activity she learned at a vocational center. She likes what she does because she generates some income to help pay for her studies and studying materials, and also because it allows her to manage her time. She now wants to expand her business selling shoes. This would be her second loan with MFP and she counts on our cooperation to achieve her goals. She is asking for 800 nuevos soles which will be invested in the purchase of beauty products, beads and other jewelry supplies.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and supplies for making bracelets and necklaces

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos, y hace aproximadamente 1 año montó una venta de verduras con la cual pueda generar mayores ingresos para su hogar, ya que en el empleo que se encontraba anteriormente no podía devengar un salario que sea suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar. En su venta de verduras ofrece a sus clientes productos de muy buena calidad, y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. Es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar verduras y así surtir su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá salir adelante y así poder brindar a sus clientes mejor servicio. Además, Luis espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y así pueda brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar verduras y así surtir su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Fortaleza” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, venta de estructuras metálicas, mariscos en conserva, corte y confección de ropa, comida rápida, servicio de corte de pasto, peluquería, manicure, hospedaje, venta de perfumes, venta de lanas de oveja, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Karina, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo del grupo, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, lleva puesto un pañuelo en su cuello de color café, usa aros grandes, su cabello es de color oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de chocolate, tejidos y venta de ropa en general, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo en su casa, y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en distribuidoras, supermercados y tiendas donde encuentra lanas de todos los colores a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará cobertura de chocolates, moldes, coco, leche condensada, palillos de bambú, lanas y botones.
Una de las metas de Karina son tener un telar grande para poder realizar más tejidos y otros modelos, además que su clientela aprecia su trabajo y le piden otras cosas a parte de lo tradicional de los tejidos.
Karina vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 11 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños son poder independizarse y especializarse en el rubro de la artesanía y adquirir un local propio donde pueda exponer todo lo que hace y tener más clientela, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “La Fortaleza”, it is made up of 15 business men and women who work in different fields amongst which: confectionary, sale of metallic structures, tinned seafood, cutting and making clothes, fast food, lawn mowing, hairdressing, manicures, bed and breakfast, sale of perfumes, sale of sheep's wool, and services. They are all from the city of Osorno.

Karina, a member of the Communal Bank group, who is standing up at the back of the group in the photo, the fourth person along from right to left, she is wearing a coffee-colored scarf around her neck and large earrings, her hair is dark and is tied up.

For the last year, she has been making her living selling chocolate, fabrics and clothes in general. She comments that she works from Monday to Sunday from her home, and her working hours are allocated according to her availability. She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs from dealers, supermarkets and stores when she finds wools of all types of colors at a low price, as such it is financially interesting. With the loan, she will buy chocolate coating, molds, spatulas, coconut, condensed milk, bamboo sticks, wool and buttons. One of Karina's aims is to have a large loom to be able to make more fabrics and other models, particularly as her customers praise her work and asks her for other items apart from the typical fabrics.

Karina lives with her husband and their 11-year-old son, who is studying at school. She dreams of becoming independent and specializing crafts and buying her own premises who she could display her goods and have a larger customer base, to create more profits and thereby achieve a better quality of life.

She is very pleased and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. With respect to the Communal Bank group she belongs to, Karina says that there is an excellent level of communication there. Moreover, the training has helped her to learn new sales and accounting strategies. 

Osorno is a city located in southern Chile, the Los Lagos region. It is an important agricultural and fishing site which identifies itself as Chile's "Home of Milk and Land of Meat". Standing out in its agricultural and fishing activities, is the growing of wheat and oats, cattle rearing for meat and milk products as well as the manufacture of agricultural equipment. Osorno is famous for having Chile's only covered football stadium, the "Rubén Marcos” municipal stadium.

loans.use: Comprará cobertura de chocolates, moldes, coco, leche condensada, palillos de bambú, lanas y botones.

loans.name: Daba

texts.en:
