This is a group loan to be shared by the members of the women’s tontine Bili, located in the village of Ndiaye Ndiaye and represented by Daba D..  The women of Bili are artisans specializing in the production of traditional clay ovens, which hold heat better than metal stoves and continue to be popular with households all over Senegal for cooking and heating in the cold months of January and February.  Daba and her associates have requested a loan for the expansion of their clay oven business, including the bulk purchase of input materials (clay, root fibers and crushed shells) and transportation of the finished ovens to nearby village markets.

  

Background

  Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Production/sale of clay ovens

loans.name: Firdovsi

texts.en: Firdovsi is an IDP from the Armenian occupied district of Azerbaijan, Agdam since 1993. He started his business in 2004 with a Normicro loan of $600. He used this loan to establish this business. Now he borrows $350 to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand the volume of business

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en: Joanne’s business is selling plates of food in front of Yasaki Compound. She chose this location because of its strong sales potential. She is located at the front gate of the Compound. When the employees of the company have their lunch break, she is one of the sellers from which they buy their lunch. On one plate, Joanne sells one chicken leg with sausage, two bananas, curry and some salads of cucumbers and sauce. This is usually sold at lunchtime and she generally sells out. Joanne is one the newest members of the programme. This is her first time running her own business.

loans.use: chicken leg quartes, sausages, bananas, tomato sauce, plates

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria is a single mother and has two kids, ages 16 and 8 respectively. She has to work to take care of her children because without extra income from a partner all expenses are very high and now that her kids are going to school the expenses will be even higher. Initially, she started with a small investment of $180 to begin her business, selling shoes by catalogue. Little by little her sales increased because she is a very hard working woman and the well being of her family motivates her.

Maria is requesting for a loan of $925 to purchase merchandise and increase her stock, satisfy client orders on time, and, above all, always have floor models to show her clients. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. Maria and her family appreciate your support in helping her continue with her business and give her kids a better education.

Translated from the original Spanish text

María es una madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, ella tuvo que trabajar para mantener a sus dos hijos por que sin el apoyo económico de una pareja los gastos son muy fuertes y ahora ambos niños están estudiando por lo que los gastos se incrementan aún más. Inicialmente ella tuvo un capital muy pequeño de US $ 180 con el cual invirtió para comenzar su negocio de venta de calzado por catálogo, poco a poco sus ventas fueron mejorando por que María es una mujer muy trabajadora y por su familia es que ella se esfuerza mucho.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para poder comprar mercadería y así tener más surtido su negocio, pedidos a tiempo y sobre todo calzado siempre actual y mantener a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en seis meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo brindado para continuar con su negocio y poder brindarles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
For 38 years, Avelino has offered his service as a taxi driver. He is from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, is married and has three children 15, 17 and 20 years of age. He started out renting the vehicle to work, but thanks to the savings that he was able to accumulate he came to acquire his own taxi. Recently he finished up the modernizing of his one and is paying for a second vehicle.

Right now Avelino is requesting a loan for $925 that he will employ in the repair and maintenance of his taxi in order to offer better service to his customers and to continue growing as a small business owner. He pledges to repay this amount in 6 months. Help this family by supporting Avelino; he is very grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 38 años Avelino ofrece sus servicios de taxista, es originario de la Monterrey, Nuevo León, está casado y tiene tres hijos de 15, 17 y 20 años de edad. Comenzó rentando el vehículo para trabajar, pero gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular logró adquirir su propio taxi, recientemente acaba de modernizar su unidad y esta pagando un segundo vehículo.

En estos momentos Avelino está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como microempresario, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a esta familia apoyando a Avelino, él agradece mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of his taxi - Reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be able to purchase better quality products for his business.

loans.name: Yohanny Laurencia

texts.en:
Yohanny is a 28 year old, single woman.  She has two boys and a girl, aged 12, 11 and 8 respectively.  All the children attend school.

Yohanny dedicates herself to the sale of women's and children's clothing.  She has been running this business for more than three years.  This activity is her principal source of income, and through it, she provides food and education for her children and pays for her rented house.

Six months ago, the entrepreneur took a loan from FSMA because supplies had been running low in her business.  With the funds, she purchased clothing in bulk which she sold succesfully.  The loan helped her to give a new ´giro´ to the business and she was able to make a lot of profits and repaid the loan in due time.  She also opened a bank account and learned to save money for any unforeseen event.  Currently, she is operating her business in a small location that she could rent.

Yohanny is requesting a second loan to buy more clothing in bulk to sell during the Christmas period.  She will offer the goods at very low prices, so that more people can get to know her business and possibly become part of her numerous loyal customers.  Her income will also be increased, and her profit margin improved.

loans.use: Purchase of brand new women's and children's clothing to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children. She and her family live in Pavlograd. Yelena works in the central market selling women’s sweaters, pants and skirts. She owns her own vending facility. Yelena has been in this trade for 11 years. Currently, she has about $7000 in turnover capital. Her weekly income is about $80-100.

Yelena’s daughter got married and would like to live separately from her parents with her husband. Yelena wants to help her daughter and son-in-law buy their own apartment. She works hard to make her dream come true and have enough savings to make an investment in her daughter’s family life. Yelena is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase 30 sweaters and 40 pairs of pants for retail sale. She is hoping to expand her business and start selling men’s outer wear too.

loans.use: To purchase 30 sweaters and 40 pairs of pants

loans.name: Kigombya B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Winnie is 28 years old and married with four children. She sells raw food in the market. She wants to use the increased business profits to construct rental houses so that she can supplement her income. Nulu and Jannet have grocery stores while Mary has a brick laying business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more foods for sale.

loans.name: Elida Angelica

texts.es:
Señora Corith Sangama Sinti, belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank of Pillory. She lives in the San Martin region of the province of Pillory, district of Pillory. Her business is located in the Pillory Supplies Market and is dedicated to the sale of dry salted fish.

She undertook this business to obtain a greater income and to cover the daily needs of her family.

With the loan of 1300 soles, that she will pay back in 6 months, she will be able to supply her business with great variety of dry salted fish such as: paiche, tilapia, maparate, bocachico, arahuana, lisa and others.

Señora Corith is 31 years old, lives with her husband and has 1 son, that she supports to do well and to improve his standard of living.

Her dream is to have a deposit of dry salted fish and to supply the needs of the local area.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Corith Sangama Sinti, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción” de Picota, vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado de Abastos de Picota y se dedica a la venta de pescado seco salado.

Ella emprendió este negocio para obtener mayores ingresos, y cubrir las necesidades diarias de su familia.

Con el crédito de S/.1300.00, que pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, podrá surtir su negocio con gran variedad de pescado seco salado como: paiche, tilapia, maparate, bocachico, arahuana, lisa y otros.

La señora Corith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 1 hijo, que son su fuerza para salir adelante, y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Su sueño es tener un depósito de pescado seco salado y cubrir las necesidades de la localidad.

loans.use: To buy more cabinets and fish for her store.

loans.name: Samara

texts.en: Samara is a 49-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband's family and her two children. She and her husband breed cattle in their yard. They have been engaged in this business since 2003 and now are quite experienced in this business. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where it is only source of income when there are no other jobs, and it can bring good income. Samara wants to develop this business and to increase the number of calves she raises. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Moragwa Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Grace is a Kenyan single mother aged 37 with 4 orphan children of her late brother. Being the sole breadwinner for her family, Grace is left with the challenge of taking care of the children and has to ensure that they are properly fed, clothed, and sheltered. She got divorced from her husband three years ago and lost two of her own children immediately after.

Grace first started by working as a waitress in a hotel for a friend, who also introduced her to a local women's savings group that she later joined. She started saving the little money she got at the hotel and from the women's group. The accumulated savings enabled Grace to start a small charcoal business from her home.

She eventually started growing her business gradually and then started the cereals (maize, rice and green grams, or mung beans) business about four years ago. With the little profits that she gets from the cereals business, Grace is grateful that she can still put food on the table and give her children the basic necessities.

With the help of her loan, Grace intends to increase her stock of cereals and eventually hopes to expand her business to a wholesale unit. Her long-term business vision is to open up a tailoring business as she is also a trained tailor!

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cereals in bulk

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Mrs. Massan T. was born in 1969 and is married and the mother of three children. She is a retailer of general medicines, basic goods, and gas which she sells alongside the road under the sun. Conscious of the danger that sun exposure poses to drugs, she would like to have financing in order to open a kiosk to shelter her products from the sun and to fix up her gas business.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Massan T. née en 1969, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de médicament et produits génériques et de pétrole qu’elle expose au bord de la route sous le soleil. Consciente du danger des rayons solaires sur les médicaments, elle désire avoir un financement pour ouvrir un kiosque pour mettre ses produits à l’abri du soleil et mieux installer son commerce de pétrole.

loans.use: Open a kiosk to sell medicine and basic goods

loans.name: Chuk

texts.en: Chuk S., 42, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband (pictured above) and three children. She and her husband are farmers, earning a combined total of $2 every day. They are also supported by two of their children who earn a combined daily total of $5 working in construction. Chuk S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of $800 to purchase a small tractor to plow their farm. Farming has been difficult this past year due to inconsistent weather patterns, rising food prices, and general inflation. With this loan, Chuk S. sees the opportunity to raise their standard of living and to better care for their family. She believes that this loan will change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro is a hard-working man. Over the years he has been known to be involved in various activities along with his work as a school administrator. Now, he has divided his time between administration and transporting passengers, to which he dedicates his afternoons and evenings. He bought his motorcar a year ago, and it helps him with his household expenses. In difficult times, like when his wife was suffering from kidney stones, he was able to cover the expenses of her treatment and medicine. Thankfully he could count on his grown, independent children, for support in helping with his wife’s health. In order to increase his income, he is asking for a loan for parts for his motorcar, which would improve its functionality in order to continue his daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Alejandro es una hombre emprendedor, a través de los años a sabido desempeñarse en diversas actividades a la par con su trabajo de administrador en una escuela.Ahora, ha dividido su tiempo entre la administración y en el trasporte de pasajeros, al que se dedica por las tardes y noches, debido a que hace un año pudo comprar su motocarro, lo que le ayuda en la economía de su hogar.En momentos difíciles, como durante la enfermedad de su esposa que sufre de cálculos renales, pudo cubrir los gastos de medicinas y tratamientos.Gracias a que sus hijos son ya independientes, puede tener en ellos un apoyo para respecto a la salud de su pareja. Para incrementar sus ingresos, solicita un préstamo para los repuestos de su motocarro, mejorar su funcionamiento para continuar con su labor diaria.

loans.use: Purchase parts and maintain his motorcar.

loans.name: Aom

texts.en: Mrs. Aom K. is a farmer in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a 33-year-old widow with three children who are all employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Aom K. now faces a small problem because she does not have oxen to plow her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings and to buy two oxen in order plow the field for cultivating.

loans.use: To buy two oxen in order plow the field for cultivating.

loans.name: Juana Teodora

texts.es: La señora G. H., tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, es madre de un hijo el cual tiene 13 años de edad el cual cursa el sexto grado de primaria, su conyugue esta sin empleo atendiendo una pequeña pulperia, que tiene en conjunto con su esposa en su casa de habitacion, mientras la señora se desempeña como comerciante de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, teniendo como proposito con los creditos poder fortalecer su negocio de pulperia a fin de poder mejorar sus condiciones economicas y dejar de vender de forma ambulante frutas y verduras, la cual tiene ocho años de desempeñar, actividad con la cual ha dado continuidad a los estudios de su hijo y de igual manera a llevado el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. G. H. is a 40-year-old married mother of a 13-year-old son, who is in 6th grade. Her spouse is currently unemployed, so he is running a small general store in their home that he and his wife own. Meanwhile, she works as a fruit and vegetable street vendor. She is requesting this loan with the aim of strengthening their general store business so that they can improve their financial status and she can stop working as a street vendor, which she has been doing for eight years. With this job, she has been able to both provide an education for her son and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Grace N. from Mwanza. She is divorced with one child, aged eight. Grace has been running a beauty salon since 2006. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Grace currently earns about 450USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy one drier and cosmetics. In the future, she plans to open another beauty salon. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy one drier and cosmetics

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Mrs. Hok P. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

She faces some problems because her field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests, which hurt her crop, and she does not have much money to cover the expense. 

In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field and make her crop more productive, and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. Mrs. Hok P. is a 57-year-old widow and the mother of a child who is a grocer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Y. Idrissou est né en 1972 à Tittigbé dans la préfecture de Sotouboua au nord du Togo. Elle réside dans le quartier d’Agoè Logopé. Il a trois (03) enfants et est divorcé de son épouse  TCHA-AKAYA roukiya. Il est revendeur de pièces détachées  dans le quartier de Kégué et s’approvisionne dans ce quartier auprès de ses fournisseurs. Il a démarré ce commerce depuis 2001 et soutient sa famille avec le revenu issu de ce commerce.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter  4 segments, 10 pompes à  eau et une (1) pompe à essence.
texts.en:
Mr. Idrissou Y. was born in 1972 in Tittigbé, Sotouboua Prefecture, in northern Togo. He resides in the Agoè Logopé district. He has three children and is divorced from his spouse Roukiya TCHA-AKAYA. As a retailer or spare parts in the Kégué district, he acquires his goods in that district from his suppliers. He started this business in 2001 and supports his family with the income derived from it. He is requesting this initial WAGES loan to buy 4 brake shoes, 10 water pumps, and 1 fuel pump.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rehana Kosar M. Saleem Group

texts.en:
Rehana Kosar baji is a 26-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is M. S. and he is a driver, driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Both of her children are in kindergarten.

Rehana Kosar baji stays at home and sews clothes for her neighbors. She does this work to earn income. She invests her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house when it's her turn to get the amount. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband. That way, he will be able to keep all of his hard-earned income.

Rehana baji is the group leader for some more woman from her locality. Naseema Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy paint for her paint shop. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 48-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Mhammad repairs cars. He requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. Mhammad is very good at repairing cars and he has a good relationship with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He started his business because he wants to be independent and he likes cars.

Mhammad has been a microcredit client for 5 years and has always paid on time. His previous loans have influenced his life in a good way; thanks to the loans, he was able to improve his work and his family situation. In the future, he plans to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: Purchase tools for car repair garage

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides sells glutinous rice cakes in their village while her husband Danilo operates their old motorcycle.  Through her business, she was able to assist her husband with their needs. She wants to develop her business because her products are very in demand in their community.  For this, she wants to request a loan amount of PHP5,000 to further develop her business and for the maintenance of their motorcycle .  Leonida said that hard work and humility are very important virtues in order to succeed in life. 

Leonides is already 55 years old and a mother to their three children: Israel -31 years old, Ariel - 30 years old, and Daniel - 28 years old.  Leonides is proud that they have a happy family despite the hardships in life.

loans.use: To repair motorcycle and additional working capital for her rice cake business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce D. is 38 years old. She is married and has six children, three males and three females. According to her, some of her children are currently in senior high and junior high schools. The rest, however, are still in basic school. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. Joyce lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Joyce, like most of the women in her community, is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Joyce wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Roberto Daniel

texts.es: El Señor Roberto Daniel C. A. tiene 39 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Roberto tiene 2 hijos y ellos dependen de el. La actividad económica de Don Roberto es ofrecer el servicio de video juegos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con muy pocos recursos ya que solo tenía  1 televisor y un video juego, pero debido a la demanda de sus pequeños clientes decidió realizar un financiamiento para la compra de más equipos y así fue como dio inicio a este negocio. Los propósitos de Roberto son de invertir cada día en nuevos videos juegos. Este es motivo que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya si comprar controles, nuevos videos juegos y otro televisor. El deseo de Roberto es de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que no le gustaría que sus hijo pasen necesidades y así no tendrían problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Daniel C. A. is 39 years old and married. Don Roberto has two children that depend on him. The way that Don Roberto makes a living is through a video game service. He has been in this business for more than 7 years, he started it with few resources since he only had one television set and one video game console. Due to the demand from his small customers, he decided to finance the purchase of more equipment and thus his business started. Don Roberto's goal is to invest in new video games every day. This is the reason for his loan request, to increase his working capital, purchase controllers, new video games and another television set. Don Roberto's wish is to improve the quality of life for his family, not seeing his children in need and not having any finacial difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cecilia Maribel

texts.es:
Cecilia  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Cecilia es casada tiene 43 años, dos hijos de 16 y 9 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Ella es maestra de educación primaria, enseña manualidades, y siempre que hacia le decían que sus diseños eran muy bonitos, hace dos años atrás tuvo la idea de hacer  joyas para vender, las mismas mamas de los niños son su clientas, también por las tardes  cose para la calle.  
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de materiales para joyas y telas para mandiles.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió la unidad, las ganas de superarse como persona y ha planificar  bien su inversión. 
El sueño de cecilia es tener un taller de manualidades.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Sarita Colonia community bank. Cecilia is married and aged 43, with two children aged 16 and 9 who are currently studying in school. She is a primary school teacher, who teaches handicrafts and who always used to be told that her designs were very good, so two years ago she had the idea to make jewellery in order to sell it. The mothers of her children are her customers, and she also sews on the street in the afternoon. Cecilia needs a loan of 800 soles in order to buy materials for her jewellery making and cloth for making school aprons. Since she has been in Finca she has learnt the value of unity. She has a lot of ambition to improve herself and has planned her investment well. Cecilia's dream is to have a handicraft workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cecilia needs a loan of 800 soles in order to purchase materials for jewellery making and school aprons

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 36 years old and has three children, who are all in school. Elizabeth manages a small parcel of land on which she grows rice. Her harvest is intended for family consumption but some is sold to rice traders for income to feed and clothe her family.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizers and seeds. The loan will really help her achieve a bigger harvest and a bigger income for her family.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. It aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI offers not just loans to all their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 37 years old and married with five children. She is a hair stylist and also sells hair extensions. Esther is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
N. Mariam is the leader of Bunawona group in Kayunga. She is a farmer and a business lady dealing in buying farm produce from fellow farmers and taking it for sale in Lugazi Kinyoro. Her produce includes cabbage, egg plants, onions, tomatoes etc. and she always tops this up with her own products from her farm to be able to make some sound profits.

She has had this business for 4 months but before, she had a retail shop and when she transferred, she failed to find another room for rent, hence she resorted to the produce selling business which she can conduct from her home.

She is a single mother of 9 children, all in school, and she cares for 3 dependents with 1 of them in school. The loans have helped her in paying school fees and taking good care of her children. She hopes that one day she will stop borrowing after she has had enough savings and more capital for her business to stand on its own. (Seated at the front is Dianah, the Credit officer for the group)

loans.use: Buying more produce to sell and paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur  a ouvert une boutique de prêt-à-porter qu’il a appelé « FIRST LADY », dans sa boutique il vend des habits et chaussures pour homme et dames. Il s’approvisionne dans les grands magasins du grand marché de Lomé. Une  partie de son stock est épuisée, il sollicite alors de WAGES son second crédit pour acheter des habits ,22 chaussures hommes, 22 chaussures dames et divers.
Il n’est pas marié et c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
This man opened a ready-made clothing shop called ‘’FIRST LADY’. He sells both male and female clothing and shoes in his shop. He gets his supplies from the bigger shops in the big market in Lome. He ran out of stock of some of his goods. He’s therefore requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to buy clothes; twenty-two men’s shoes, twenty-two women’s shoes and other items. He is not married and uses the income from his business to provide for himself.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар Чабборов проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 20 лет. Холост. Акбар более 3 лет занимается торговлей и предосталением услуги по ремонту телефонов. Он в основном торгует телефонами и сим-картами. По специальности "юрист". Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. За счет накопления прибыли, хочет сыграть свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Akbar C. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 20 years old, a bachelor. Akbar has been in the business of retail for three years and provides services for mobile phone repairs. He mainly sells phone cards and SIM cards. His profession is a lawyer. He is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation. He wants to use the accumulated profit to have a wedding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Mrs. Sovann Phai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are all in Kandal village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan group, and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sovann P. is the village bank president, and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this planting, she is a silk weaver in the local village. 

Her husband, Mr. P. Pheurn, is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from house, Mrs. Sovann P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work in order to reduce their expenses. Mrs. Sovann P. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school. The other two are too young to work or study so they stay home. 

Mrs. Phen P. did not come to take the loan but her father did, so he is in the picture instead her. He is sitting behind the other villagers. 

Eleven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Rose Akinyi

texts.en:
Rose A. is 29 years old, married to Carreh A. Owour who is also a businessman and both are blessed with two children aged between one and half years to nine years old. Her animal feed shop is located in the surburb of Langas Estate along Kisumu Eldoret highway. She has been in this animals feeds sale business for the past eight years now.

Rose was introduced to KADET by a group member and with the loan she is taking she intends to add more animal feeds as stock for her business. 

In future she intends to grow her business to a wholesale and also improve her living standards for her family by educating her children.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding more animal feed for her animal feeds shop.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 45 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 02 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en la comunidad D. Yapura.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar su negocio D. venta D. comida. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. pescado. Papas, aceite, gas, etc., para la preparación D. comida los domingos en las ferias.

Su mayor deseo es que su negocio crezca más.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de pescado. Papas, aceite, gas, etc.,

loans.name: Reina Maritza

texts.es:
la sra. REINA MARITZA V. se dedica a la venta de ropa para cama, cosmeticos y ropa americana actividad que realiza  desde hace 1 año, junto a su esposo han procreado 4 hijos, 2 cursan la educacion secundaria y una de sus hijas esta en la universidad , con los ingresos que le genera el negocio contribuye a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar , su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ( siembra de maiz y frijoles ) dejando una parte para consumo y la otra la vende para sacar los costos de produccion y las utilidades que son invertidas en la educacion de sus hijos, la Sra. Maritza nos a solicitado el credito para la compra de productos para surtir su negocio y asi mejorar sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias. 
Reina habita en comunidad de Santa Cruz , municipio de El Paraiso , EL Paraiso esta Localizada a 27  
kilometros de Danli.
texts.en:
Reina Maritza V. has been engaged in the sale of bedding, cosmetics and American clothing for a year. She and her husband have 4 children, 2 are in the secondary school and one of their daughters is in the university. With the income that she generates from the business she contributes with her husband to the household expenses. Her husband works in agriculture (cultivating corn and beans); part of his output is consumed by the household, the rest is sold in order to cover the production costs and the profits are invested in the education of their children. Maritza is requesting a loan to purchase products to supply her business and in this way improve her sales in order to obtain better earnings. Reina lives in the community of Santa Cruz, in the municipality of El Paraiso. El Paraiso is located 27 kilometers from Danli.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bedding, cosmetics such as creams, lotions, deodorants, shampoos, conditioners, hair dye, lipsticks, and lip gloss.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells foodstuffs such as rice and cooking oil. She is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Margret's ultimate goal for her business is to make more profits. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Qal-E-Barqi Group

texts.en:
The name of this four member group is Qal-e-Barqi. They live in District 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Belqis, 40, is the group leader. She is a quilt sewer who primarily sews quilts for brides. She is famous for this talent and earns a lot of money by sewing these kinds of quilts. She would like a loan to purchase new materials to expand her business.

Zarghona would like a loan for her husband who has a car repair shop. He would like to purchase essential equipment. 

Nadia would like a loan for her brother’s car part shop, and M. Salim wants a loan to expand his metal shop. 

Together they have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani (AFN).

loans.use: expanding their businesses

loans.name: Karren

texts.en:
At the age of 31, Karren is engaged in managing a retail store in their village. She also manages a poultry business. Her weekly net income is PHP 500.00. Due to some creditors, unfortunately, her retail store was not successful and she decided to close it and look for another business to start. After two years, she decided to re-open her store and that's why she would like a loan of Php 4,000. She will use it to purchase some grocery items to sell. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan in order to continue her business and to earn an income to support her family.
Karren and her husband are blessed with three children: Justin, five years old; Bejie, four years old; and John Rence, three years old. Their family resides in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near the Elementary School.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en: Ammie, 28, is a farmer from Surallah, South Cotabato. She is married to Randolf and they have four children. The eldest child is eight years old. She works in the rice field, and this is the main source of income on which her family depends. She wants to continue to support her family through rice farming and she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. with the aim to acquire a loan for her business. She has requested 15,000 PHP to provide the needs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy rice farming supplies.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their four children. Saada has owned a grocery store since 2001. She sells all types of canned food, pasta, home cleaning products, beverages and more. Saada requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. 

Saada is speciA. in her business because she knows how to treat her clients, and she has a good reputation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of merchandise. Saada decided on doing her business to supplement her husband’s income, and she always wanted to open a shop for herself. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón R. tiene 29 años de edad, está casado con Norma Aguilera, viven en casa propia desde hace 2 años en la cuidad de Ñemby, no tienen hijos vivos, pero hace 2 años aproximadamente, tuvieron un hijo que nació con algunos problemas de salud y que no pudo sobrellevar y falleció a los pocos días, cuenta que esta experiencia los dejo bastante golpeados porque era su primer hijo y estaban muy ilusionados.
En ese entonces ambos tenían sus respectivas microempresas, ella se  tenía un comedor en el Mercado 4 , y él tenía un puesto de venta de calzados también dentro del mercado.
Hoy su esposa está trabajando en una empresa , donde es encargada de la cocina, tiene un ingreso fijo, mientras que Ramón ahora tiene su puesto de ventas de bolsones y carteras para damas, sus ventas son al mayor y menor, según él con este nuevo rubro obtiene más ganancias,ya que él mismo junto con sus hermanos se dedican a la fabricación de sus propios productos.
texts.en:
Ramón R., 29, is married to Norma Aguilera. They have lived in their own house in the city of Ñemby for two years. They do not have any living children. Approximately two years ago they had a child who was born with some health problems. He could not survive, and he died a few days after being born. Dealing with this experience left them quite battered because it was their first child, and they had high hopes. At that time they both had their own respective small businesses. She had a restaurant in the Mercado 4. He had a stall selling footwear in the same market. Now his wife is working in a business where she is in charge of the kitchen. She has a regular income. Ramón now has a stall where he sells purses and wallets for women. He sells wholesale and retail. According to him, he gets greater income from this new field. Together with his siblings he makes his own products himself.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material like faux leather, leather, glue, tacks, and zippers

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto, de 41 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su negocio está ubicado en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca. Él se dedica a la venta de joyas, y su tienda es una de las más concurridas, ya que los artículos que ofrece son muy bonitos y de muy buen calidad, motivo por el cual poco a poco su negocio está creciendo.
Lo que más le gusta a Sixto de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus joyas, ya que siempre hay personas que quieren robarle. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio, para poder vender más joyas.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y participativo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más joyas para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sixto, 41, is a cheerful, hard-working man; he lives with his wife in his own house and what he most wants is to improve his standard of living. His business is in a shopping mall in Juliaca. He sells jewelry and his store is one of the most popular because he offers beautiful, high-quality items; this has led to the growth in his business. What Sixto likes best about his work is chatting with his customers; he has been in this line of work for 3 years. What he considers to be the most difficult part of the job is guarding his jewels because there are always those around who would like to rob him. For later in the future, he expects to enlarge his site so that he can sell more items. This is his first loan with MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments on time if he wants to have access to future loans. He is a very responsible and participative member of his communal bank. He will use the 1000 new sol loan to buy more jewelry items to better stock his store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 39-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abbass has owned a bakery since 1998. He sells mankoucheh and pizzas. A Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Ali is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. Abbass also does Lebanese pastries like “Fatayers” which are spiced triangular spinach pies stuffed with meat and onions; “Manakich” which are pastries baked with thyme, olive oil, spices and sesame seed; “Sfiha” which are pies made from our own fresh dough topped with spicy ground lamb meat, onions and tomatoes. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues and took loans at Al Majmoua. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.  He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and gas for his oven. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He plans to keep on improving his work and offering the best to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and gas for his oven.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 59-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Khaled has been working as a furniture repairer for over thirty years and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loans allowed him to improve his work, as well as his financial situation.

Khaled decided on doing his business because he had experience. When he first started his work he had some difficulties building networking. For the future, he hopes that he will keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Guadalupe Sj Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se denomina GUADALUPE SJ y se ubica en la comunidad de San Jerónimo Tianguismanalco; en el estado de Puebla. Esta comunidad se distingue porque en su mayoría la población se dedica al comercio informal ya que no tienen la posibilidad de trabajar en industrias o empresas y sobresalen con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.
El grupo esta conformado por 13 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito con CREDICOMUN.
La Sra. Avelina Muñoz Limón fue elegida por su grupo como tesorera debido a  su carácter perseverante y que como buena cabeza de familia ha sabido sobresalir ante las adversidades que se han presentado en su vida. La antigüedad de su negocio es apenas de 2 años, es una pequeña lonchería de aspecto humilde. Sus clientes la llaman Doña Velita. Sus principales clientes son los niños de la primaria cercana dándoles tortas y licuados a muy bajo precio ya que en su mayoría provienen de familias campesinas. El destino del crédito es comprar una mesita y sillas para que le pueda dar mejor servicio a su clientela. 
Gracias a  el   pudo sacar adelante los compromisos económicos y familiares, ya que no cuenta con estudios y significa el doble de esfuerzo. 
Hace 1 año quedo viuda y en el mismo año por azares de la vida también perdió a uno de sus hijos de 18 años el cual vivía con ella. Gracias al apoyo familiar ha podido enfrentar las adversidades morales y económicas. Sus fuertes pilares: 2 hijas y un hijo. Gracias a su participación en los créditos comunales ha desarrollado y mantenido su actividad económica de la cual no pide más de lo que puede pagar. Se siente satisfecha de sus logros porque ha recuperado la confianza en ella misma. Al momento de solicitar el crédito se sentía animosa y verdaderamente interesada en este nuevo proyecto. Le interesa poder llevar una vida tranquila y continuar por muchos años más con su negocio. 
Ella  comenta que desea hacer crecer su negocio ingresando mayor variedad de productos pero siempre cuidando el comprometerse únicamente con las ganancias que este genere.
texts.en:
This group is called GUADALUPE SJ. It is found in the community of San Jerónimo Tianguismanalco in the state of Puebla. This communty is distinctive because because most of its population works in informal businesses since they don't have the possibility of working in industries or businesses. They get ahead with their work effort. The group is made up of 13 members and this is the first time that they have asked for a loan from CREDICOMUN. Mrs. Avelina Muñoz Limón was chosen to be the treasurer of the group because of her perservering character. Like a good head of household, she has been able to overcome adversities that have come up in her life. Her business is just two years old. It's a humble little lunch diner. Her clients call her Doña Velita. Her main clients are the children from the nearby elementary school. She gives them cake and milkshakes at a very low price since most of them come from farm families. The loan will be used to buy a little table and some chairs to give her customers better service. Thanks to this she has been able to get her financial committments and her family ahead. She has no education and that has meant that she has had to make twice the effort. A year ago she became a widow and that same year, due to the vicissitudes of life, she lost one her children, an 18 year old who lived with her. Thanks to family support, she has been able to face this emotional and financial adversity. Her pillars of strength: 2 daughters and a son. Thanks to her participation in the communal loans, she has developed and maintained her financial activity. She does not ask for more than she can pay back. She feels satisfied with her accomplishments because she has recovered confidence in herself. At the the time she asked for this loan, she felt enthusiastic and truly interested in this new project. She is interested in having a calm life and being able to continue for many more years with her business. She remarks that she wants to grow her business, adding a wider variety of products but always committing only the profits that she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a little table and some chairs

loans.name: María Group

texts.es:
El grupo María está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora María de Jesús R. T. quien desde hace dos años retomo su negocio de venta de ropa el cual había dejado por la situación económica. Pero con los préstamos a tenido la posibilidad de volver a trabajar en ello y mejorar notablemente según comento.

Sonia del Carmen H. L. también comercializa ropa de todo tipo y estilo e invertirá al igual que R. en ropa veraniega que es lo de la temporada. Mientras María Auxiliadora Aravela Moreno quien  es fotógrafa y tiene un pequeño estudio fotográfico y trabaja por contrato en eventos con el préstamo desea mejorar y comprar materiales para su estudio.
texts.en:
The group "Maria" is made up of 3 hardworking women. One of them is María de Jesús R. T., who after 2 years resumed her business selling clothing, which she had left because of the economic situation. But with the loans she has had the possibility of returning to work in this business, and she tells us that it has improved notably. Carmen H. L. also sells clothing of all types and styles. She will invest, as R., in summer clothing that is appropriate for the season. Meanwhile, María Auxiliadora Aravela Moreno is a photographer and has a small photography studio. She works by contract for events. With the loan she will improve her business and buy materials for her studio.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and supplies for photographic studio

loans.name: Marie Augustine

texts.en:
Marie Augustine M. is 46 years old, married and the mother of 14 children. She sells palm oil and citrus juice and raises pigs as a side activity.

Marie Augustine has been a member of the Banc Villageois Thiéckéne for nine years and has always paid back her loans on time. With this loan, she plans to buy pigs and palm oil.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and palm oil.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) a year ago to gain access to its program. Like other entrepreneurs, she needed financial support for her business.

Geraldine manages a rice farm and also grows pigs. In addition she has a small store where she sells basic necessities like sugar, vinegar and other items. She said that CEVI’s program helped a lot in maintaining her business.

Geraldine would like to request a loan of Php 15,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs, feed for her pigs, and also supplies for her store.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, pig feed and store supplies

loans.name: Munkhbaatar

texts.en: Munkhbaatar is 53 years old and lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, Tserendolgor, is 29 years old and works as an accountant. His 24-year-old daughter, Dulamjav, attends a university. Munkhbaatar operates a water well in his town. He also operates an auto repair service. His wife has a very enterprising spirit, and she has grown potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and carrots on her own land. Munkhbaatar is an honest person and has good communication skills. He is requesting a loan to build a new house.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Nidia Encarnación

texts.es:
Nidia Encarnación P. V. tiene 42 años.  Es casada, tiene una hija Aina Maldonado de 7 años y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
Nidia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 
Nidia tiene su negocio proprio de cabinas telefónicas. Las compras las realiza en el cantón de Bucay. Solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio. Su sueño seria de tener una empresa. Por el momento no enfrenta desafío mayor.
texts.en:
Nidia, 42 years old, is married and has a daughter Aina, who is 7 years old. They live in the county of Chillanes, in Bolivar province. Nidia is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops. Nidia has her own business of phone booths. She buys them in the county of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to expand her business. Her dream would be to have a company. For the time being, she is not to facing any major challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Saim

texts.en: Mrs. Saim B., 55 years old, lives in Prey Ta Mau village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mrs. Saim B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Sann Seng, is a bicycle and motorcycle repairer, who earns a small income to support his family. This couple has five children: one is a beautician, two are laborers in Phnom Penh, and the youngest one is a student in the local school. Mrs. Saim B.' husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a divorced mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sisters children. 

Annet owns a bar in Mengo Mackay where she sells all types of drinks such as beer and local gin. She has been in this business for over five years. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerycans of the local gin  Annet sells on retail basis only. She sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include thieves and defaulters. 

Annet is aspiring to build a house for her family. She rents a two-roomed house where her family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are food, rent, and school fees. She joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her capital base.

loans.use: To buy beer and gin

loans.name: Manuel Andres

texts.es:
Manuel Andres  S. M. tiene 48 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 3 hijos, Beatriz (20), Inés (19), Víctor (18).
 
Manuel es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en ciclo cortó maíz.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en Babahoyo en Comercial Chávez.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para superarse en la vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Andres S. M. is 48 years old, single, and lives in Recinto Delicia in the canton of Chillanes, Bolivar Province. He has three children: Beatriz (age 20), Inés (age 19) and Víctor (age 18).

Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “El Progreso La Delicia Recinto”, which is in San José del Tambo Parish. The group has 19 members and their community engages in growing cacao and corn.

Manuel is a farmer who is currently planting corn. Every month he purchases products and farming supplies from the agricultural services division of AGRIPAD. He sells his goods in Babahoyo at Comercial Chávez.

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and views it as an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have more financial income so that he can excel in life. The greatest challenge that he faces is the lack of financial resources and time.

He enjoys spending time with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies for growing corn

loans.name: Handerson Marcelo

texts.es:
Handerson Marcelo A. E., tiene 22 años.  Es soltero,  vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tienen  hijos. 

Handerson es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Handerson  se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de café y maíz. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de café y maíz para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños dinero para incrementar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la variedad del clima las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Handerson Marcelo A. E. is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. He does not have children. Handerson is a member of the “Y” Communal Bank, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in all, and most of them are farmers. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San José. Handerson is a farmer, and he grows coffee and corn. He makes his purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo. He sells in the same town from a place in his house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. He dreams of having the money to increase his production. He faces challenges; which are the lack of money, the change of climate, pests, and illnesses. He likes to play sports and work in the field.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Santa Julia Ibedia del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio pone al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos y de las personas de caseríos aledaños diversos productos de consumo diario que les son de dificil acceso. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad sostiene los gastos económicos de la familia, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales y eventualmente trabaja como peón agrícola.

Nestor desea adquirir mas mercadería para aumentar el stock de productos en su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas, por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan ampliar su negocio y poder responder de mejor modo a la demanda de sus clientes.

Nestor es un padre entragado a su familia y bastante trabajador, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Nestor is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Santa Julia neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande; an agricultural district primarily characterized for producing fruits for export. The district belongs to the Piura province located within the region of the same name which is more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He sells groceries and products of basic necessity at a small store out of his residence. The business puts diverse products of daily consumption at the hands of neighbors and people from surrounding villages who otherwise would have difficulty accessing them. With his gains from the business he is able to provide for the household expenses. In addition, he is a farmhand and also raises and sells livestock. Nestor wishes to acquire more merchandise to stock the business with product and increase his level of sales. That is why he has decided to request his first loan to Edpyme Alternativa for 800 PEN ($300USD) which will enable him to expand his business and be able to better respond to his client's demands. Nestor is a father devoted to his family and very hard working, he longs to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. Neighbors and acquaintances in the area where he lives consider him to be a tranquil and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products of basic necessity and groceries to stock the business

loans.name: Julian Pedro

texts.es: Julián es de 24 años de edad, soltero, es carpintero y confeccionista, en la actividad de carpintería se dedica desde hace seis años y en la actividad de confeccionista se dedica desde hace tres años, solicita su segundo crédito, para la compra de madera y compra de telas para sudaderos, y se determina que es una inversión rentable, lo cual beneficiara al solicitante para poder pagar el préstamo sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Julian is 24 years old and is single. He is a carpenter and he also makes clothing. He has been a carpenter for 6 years, and has been making clothing for 3 years. He is requesting his second loan to buy wood and fabric to make sweatshirts. He has determined that this is a profitable investment which will benefit him and allow him to pay off the loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood and also fabric to make sweatshirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn, vegetables, and chicken to make tamales

loans.name: Tujikwamue Kiburugwa Group

texts.en:
Habiba S. is in her early forties and is married with two children. Habiba has been running a general store and a cosmetics shop since 2004. The grocery store is open daily between 6 am and 9 pm and earns Habiba a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's 10th loan with Tujijenge Tanzanania. The earlier loans were used for expanding the business as well as increasing her stock. All of these loans have since been repaid. With her 10th loan, Habiba once again aims to increase her stock of goods, both for the grocery store as well as the cosmetics shop. Habiba's dream is to one day own several grocery stores around the city.

Habiba will share this loan with her loan group Tujikwamue Kiburugwa, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Habiba can be seen in the back row, to the far left.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil B. is 48 years old. He is married with three children.  Kamil has been running the business for five years. He sells office supplies in his store. The business generates significant income for the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.  Today Kamil is requesting 1000 AZN.  He plans to spend the loan for purchasing more office supplies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more office supplies to increase income

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P. (in the photo) is 48 years old, and her husband, Mr. Noun Pum is 46 yeas old; they live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They married in 1987 and have three children--one son and two daughters. 

Mrs. Rom P. has been operating a business producing rice wine and raising pigs for 15 years. Her husband sells grocery items at home. She is asking for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is requesting for KES 50,000 loan to buy textbooks, dictionaries, Kamusi (kiswahili dictionary), revision books and other stationery to add to her stock. She has been operating PK Booksellers where she sells books at a stall for the last 8 years. Her business environment is busy and her customers are parents and students.  Veronica is 31 years old, married and a mother of two.

She describes herself as a visionary and honest and hopes to open other outlets and expand her business to other areas. She says that Faulu loans have helped her grow her business.

loans.use: Buying textbooks, dictionaries, Kamusi (kiswahili dictionary), revision books and other stationery

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en: Restituto S. is from the village of Holy Friday, Mallig, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Restituto is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Restituto plants and harvests rice for sale. Restituto has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Restituto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Restituto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 24,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Restituto is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Restituto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marcilinda

texts.en:
Marcilinda C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tapi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a carenderia/eatery business. Her husband Jose C., who is 49 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have 6 children who are 13 to 26 years old.

Marcilinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marcilinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and support her children's education. Marcilinda C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. For the past four years, Ama has been selling cassava, plantain, and banku (fermented corn or cassava dough) with fried fish at Abura. Ama’s work income assists her husband to provide for the basic needs of the family.

Ama is requesting a loan to increase the capital for her business. She will buy more corn to prepare banku and purchase fresh fish to be fried for sale. Ama will use the profits from her business to educate her children. 

In this photo, Ama has a ladle in the corn dough mixture to be cooked into banku. She is also showing the fish she will be frying to serve with the banku.

loans.use: to buy corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Natalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 100% Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Natalia, tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 5 y un año. Vive en casa de sus padres. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos, además porque  a través de los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, lo que más vende es ropa de mujer  y en Esika lo que es cosméticos y bisutería.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones,  blusas, cremas, cosméticos, bisutería, entre otras. Sus sueños son tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '100% Charapoto' community bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 21 year-old Natalia.  She is a single mother who has two children aged 5 and 1.  She lives in her parents' home.  Natalia is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it for the additional benefits that they receive from the institution and for the repayment terms.  She also likes it because, through the loans she has received, she has been able to finance her business.

Natalia makes catalog sales of clothes and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where her customers come to buy from her.  She works three days a week.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  The products she sells most of are women's clothes and Esika products (cosmetics and costume jewelry).

Natalia will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, creams, cosmetics, costume jewelry etc.  Her dream is to own a large store.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, creams, cosmetics, costume jewelry and perfume.

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shella N. is from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She is 23 years old. She grows rice for a living. It is her hope to increase her harvest so that she could provide for her family’s needs and improve their living conditions.

Receiving a loan from CEVI will help her buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She also would like to venture into other businesses to augment her income. The profit that she earns from her farm will also go to her savings.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el  distrito de San José, característico por ser un lugar donde resalta la actividad de la pesca, el cual se encuentra ubicado a más de 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de pescado fresco en un puesto en el mercado de San José, algunas veces vende su pescado en un lugar ubicado a orillas del mar esto ocurre cuando la demanda aumenta. Con los ingresos que percibe se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

José desea adquirir equipos para que su faena sea más rápida y de esta manera tener mayor cantidad de pescado para la venta percibiendo mayores ganancias, lo que le permita cumplir con unas de sus aspiraciones que es llegar a exportar su producto. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Él es una persona que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de sus padres. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old, single, and lives with his family in San José district which is noted for the fact that many people there work in the fishing business.  It is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

José has been selling fresh fish from a stall in San José market for a long time.  Sometimes he sells his fish down by the seashore.  He does this when his demand increases.  He uses the income he makes in his business to get his family ahead and cover his daily expenses.

José would like to buy fishing tackle so that he can do his job more quickly and, in this way, have more fish to sell.  This will make him more profits and enable him to fulfil one of his dreams which is to export his fish.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

José is a person who is always looking out for his parents' well-being and progress.  His greatest wish is to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fishing tackle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 30 ans, Madame Mariam Traoré est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont 1 garçon et 1 fille. Il vit dans une famille nucléaire à Médine-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité de vente des condiments aliments tels les oignons, au nouveau de marché dont elle dispose table  et où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elle est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 13 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (9 sacs de petites graines et 6 sacs de grosses graines) auprès d’une femme qui lui vend en gros au comptant  et à crédit.
