Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage.
Avec ce deuxième crédit elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
With 30 years of age, Mariam Traoré is married and have two children, a boy and a girl. She lives in a nuclear family in Medina, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 
After running a few business activities without much success, over two years ago she started selling food condiments such as onions, a new market section where she has competence and her products are highly demanded for their quality. 
To face the increasing demand of her customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. She is on her second loan that will enable her to improve her business in order and to buy 13 bags of onions of different seeds (a few bags of small seeds and a few of large seeds) from a wholesaler, who offers cash and credit payments. Her products are sold cash to a clientele composed mostly by housekeepers. 
With this second loan, she expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to contribute to family expenses and pay interests on the loan while the rest will be invested in the business.

loans.use: Purchase of onions

loans.name: La Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité La Milagrosa es de la zona de Calle'i de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Es el tercer crédito de las integrantes de este comité, se propusieron pagar los días lunes de modo que no las afecte económicamente, ya que de lunes a viernes trabajan mucho y constantemente.
La sra. Dominga M. se dedica a la venta ambulante y por catálogo de ropas o prendas interiores, especialmente de la marca "Kalua", muy demandada por las mujeres jóvenes, ella desea poder aumentar su cantidad de productos y prendas ofrecidas, por ello solicita el crédito, así podrá aumentar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The committee “La Milagrosa” (The Miraculous) is located in the District of Calle'I in the city of San Lorenzo. As a committee, the members are participating in their third loan cycle. They propose to submit their payments on Mondays so that they won’t be affected financially. The members work very hard Monday through Friday on a consistent basis.

Sra. Dominga M. works as a traveling merchant, selling clothes and undergarments from catalogs, particularly the “Kalua” brand. This line of clothing is in great demand among young women. Dominga wants to increase the quantity of products and outfits that she offers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Cellule Mekhe Group

texts.fr: Apec Al Ouma cellule Mekhe est un groupe mixte composé de 25 personnes qui habitent dans la même localité a Mekhé Village.Il est présidé par Macoura T. qui s'active dans l'agriculture et l'élevage de bovins et d'ovins.Son lieu d'habitation a beaucoup contribué sur le choix du secteur d'activité dans lequel il évolue. Ce que l'intéresse le plus c'est l' aspect lucratif de cette activité ainsi que la réalisation de profits.Le groupement est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis Novembre 2010 par le biais de la signature d'une convention de partenariat entre U-IMCEC et Al OUMA qui est une grande association au niveau national.Ils sollicitent  un crédit de 2 250 000 frs prévu pour l'achat de semences et de bétail dans l'objectif de développer leurs activités. Ils cherchent a travers l'accroissement de leurs revenus a  améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
The Mekhé cell of Apec Al Ouma is a mixed group consisting of 25 people who live in the same neighborhood, in the Mekhé village. The head of the group is Macoura T., whose activities are farming and breeding of cattle and sheep. 

The area where he lives played a substantial part in his choosing this activity. He is mainly interested in the lucrative aspect of his work and the potential for profits. 

The group became a member of the Yoff branch in November 2010 through the signing of a partnership agreement between U-IMCEC and Al Ouma, a large national organization. 

They are seeking a loan of 2,250,000 francs for the purchase of seeds and livestock to expand their activities. They are hoping that an increase in revenue will help them to improve the living conditions of their respective families. 

About this loan:
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 

Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas),  Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children.   They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week.  Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: to buy seeds and livestock for business expansion

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 29 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, es madre soltera, trabaja haciendo tortillas para vender, de esta manera se gana el dinero para alimentar a sus hijos, su labor inicia de 7:00am hasta terminar lo pedido.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz, ya que está encareciendo, por lo que ella quiere aprovechar para comprar por cantidad mayor y tenerlo guardado.  
Ella trabaja por cuidar a sus hijos, darles lo necesario y algún día compra su propia casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is 29 years old and lives in San Miguel.  She has two children aged 6 and 3.  She is a single mother.

Margarita works making tortillas to sell.  In this way she earns the money she needs to feed her children.  She starts working at 7.00am and works until she has finished making what has been ordered.

Margarita is currently requesting a loan to buy corn since it is becoming expensive and she would like to take advantage and buy a large quantity to keep in stock.

Margarita works to take care of her children, to provide them with what they need and, some day, to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es:
Don Hugo Eduardo Z. B., es soltero, tiene 23 años edad, estudió sus estudios primarios, se dedica al comercio a la venta de pizza, gaseosas, café y entre otro tipo de comida, tiene 3 años de experiencia con este negocio, inicio por iniciativa propia, y espera seguir incrementando su capital. 

Por tal razon acude a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar materiales para la elaboración de pizza, tales como harina, levadura, huevos, jamon, verduras, etc; quiere ver su negocio mas grande y prospero.
texts.en:
23-year old Sr. Hugo Eduardo Z. B. is unmarried. He completed primary school. For the last three years he’s been selling pizza, soft drinks, coffee, and other foods, a business he started on his own initiative. He hopes to continue increasing his income.

For that reason, he approached Kiva partner ASDIR to ask for a loan which he will use to buy ingredients for making pizza such as flour, yeast, eggs, ham, vegetables etc. Hugo wishes to see his business grow and proper.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pizza

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es: Horacio, tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando. Don Horacio es transportista realiza viajes de pasajeros y de materiales de construcción como arena, madera, etc.  a la capital del país. Él posee un pick up que es su herramienta fundamental para la realización de su trabajo. Es muy conocido en la zona y muchas personas solicitan su servicio ya que saben que es un hombre responsable, amable y serio en su trabajo,  esto ha hecho que muchas personas soliciten sus servicios, lo que ha llevado a un deterioro normal de su vehículo, es por esta razón que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  darle mantenimiento y reparar su herramienta de trabajo, y de esta manera  poder dar el servicio seguro que el cliente se merece. Con el crédito piensa invertir en llantas, frenos, pintura, batería, y otros que son indispensables para que  su pick up pueda seguir funcionando de manera segura. De esta forma el podría prestar un mejor servicio y los clientes estarían más satisfechos con él y lo solicitarían más. Esto daría como resultado mayores ingresos que le servirían para seguir dando a su familia el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Horacio Ramo is 57 years old and lives with his life partner and their two children who are in school.  Don Horacio is a carrier who transports passengers and construction materials such as sand, wood, and other products.  He travels to the capital of San Salvador.  Horacio owns a pickup truck, which is the main piece of equipment that he uses for his work.  He is well-known in the area and many people request his service because they know he is a responsible man who is friendly and serious about his business.  

Horacio decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to maintain and repair his vehicle so that he can provide the safe service that his customers deserve.  With this loan he will invest in tires, brakes, paint, batteries, and other supplies that are essential in making sure that his pickup continues to function properly.  This will enable him to provide the best service so that his customers stay satisfied and continue to do business with him.  Horacio hopes this will result in more income so that he can continue providing for his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintaining and repairing his pickup truck.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 21, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. He and his wife, Joyce Wanjiru, have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to open up a retail shop and stock it with different products to offer for sale, such as maize flour, rice, wheat flour and a variety of home products.

In future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the area and also eventually to grow his new retail shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to open and stock a retail shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. 
Sonia tiene una panadería, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de harina, levadura, azúcar para la elaboración de panes.
Sonia y sus esposo trabajan juntos en una panadería alquilada, donde elaboran todo tipo de panes y los distribuyen a sus caseros. Con sus ahorros y semillas pudieron construir su propia panadería en su casa que pronto lo inaugurarán. Su sueño es poder abrir una pastelería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank "Paloma". She is 37 years old, married, and she has 4 children. Sonia has a bakery. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of flour, yeast, and sugar to bake breads.

Sonia and her husband work together in a bakery which they rent. They bake all types of breads which they distribute to their neighbors. With their savings and their seeds of hope they managed to build their own bakery in their house and it will soon be inaugurated. Her dream is to open a pastry shop and that her children grow up to have a career.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, and sugar.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is married to a businessman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal in her business. Salima dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, aged 29 years, is married and has two children. He has been farming for the past four years.
 
He is a humble client. He knew KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his second loan with KADET, and he intends to spend it by preparing the land for farming and to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer.

Simon anticipates that the profit generated will be used for the farm, and he dreams of being a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: El señor Salvador , es habitante de Masaya , junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , el labora en  una empresa privada , su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar  ; ya que tiene un pequeño negocio , juntos luchan día a día para brindarle estudios a sus pequeños y lograr que ejerzan  una carrera profesional para que no pasen dificultades como las han sufridos ambos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un salario suficiente para poder comprar de una solo vez materiales de construcción y mejorar la vivienda , agradece la Confianza que le  brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo para poder realizar sus sueños de ver su casa en mejor estado .
texts.en: Señor Salvador lives in Masaya with his wife and children.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions.  He works for a private company, and his wife helps with the household expenses, as she has a small business.  They struggle together on a daily basis to provide their young ones with education and to ensure that they have a professional career that will allow them to bypass difficulties like those that both Salvador and his wife have suffered.   The greatest challenge he faces is that he does not earn a sufficient salary to be able to make a one-off purchase of building materials and improve his home.  He appreciates the trust that is being given to him through Afodenic, which fundamentally will achieve his dream of seeing his home in better shape.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Bo is 65 years old and lives with her husband in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. Her husband is also 65 years old. Both of them are farmers and they have four adult children. All of their kids are working for suitable salaries and are able to provide for their parents and also for their individual families. 

Bo is requesting a 250 USD loan to repair her house and improve her living standard and increase her comfort. She appears in this photo with her husband.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Maribel nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 31 años de edad y un tiene un hijo. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes en el terminal terrestre del distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, ella está encargada de la venta de boletos de viajes desde las seis de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde. En esta oportunidad Maribel requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la educación de su hijo. El sueño de Maribel es abrir una empresa de transportes terrestre.
texts.en:
The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is found there.

Maribel was born in Cusco.  She’s 31 years old and has a son.  At present, she lives in the same city where she was born and that’s where she carries out her economic activities.  She’s employed at a travel agency in Cusco’s Santiago district’s ground transportation terminal.  She sells tickets from 6am until 1pm.  

On this occasion, Maribel needs the loan for personal use, that is, for her son’s education.  Maribel’s dream is to open a ground transportation firm.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge de 24 años de edad, trabaja como docente de formacion Tecnica en el Ceta INATEC.   Solicita  su 1er  crèdito para comprar un solar para en el futuro construir su propia vivienda y tener que ofrecerle a su familia. En su centro de trabajo es reconocido como una persona responsable con sus obligaciones,  honesto, trabajador y muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, su sueño en la vida es tener su propia casa y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: 24-year-old Jorge works as a teacher providing technical training at CETA INATEC (an agricultural technical education center).  He is requesting his first loan to buy a plot of land on which to build his own home in the future so that he has something to offer his family.  At work, Jorge is known as a person who is responsible with his obligations, honest, hard-working and very well liked by his colleagues.  His dream in life is to own his own home and help his family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Nounagnon D'akassato Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO  est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier au Bénin.  C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Delphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Delphine est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Christophe. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. Delphine et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Delphine exerce depuis vingt ans environs, comme activité la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Delphine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Delphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres du groupe NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
The NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO  group is made up of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin.  It's the third time that this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé, so as to expand their businesses. The representative of the group, Delphine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. 

Delphine,  47, is married to a retailer named Christophe. The couple has two children, both enrolled in school and  living with their parents. Delphine and her husband share in supporting their family. 

In order to provide for herself and improve her standard of living, Delphine has been selling various goods (tinned foods, soap, maize, etc.) for about 20 years, out of her home.  She buys her supplies in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her income, Delphine is requesting a third loan, together with the others in the group called NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (maize, canned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Adelia has a shop that buys and sells generic drugs and medicinal and herbal ointments. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy generic drugs and medicinal ointments to sell.

Adelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy generic drugs and medicinal ointments to sell.

loans.name: Junnie

texts.en:
Junnie is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Junnie has operated her rolling store business for 10 years. She also earns an income from vegetable and fish selling. She earns about P500 daily by patiently operating her business.

Junnie wanted to expand her venture, and that’s why she is taking out this loan amounting to P13,000 to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, squash, bananas and native foods to resell. She hopes to further grow her business to secure her family's future. She is also aiming to give her children a better education so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, she strives hard to earn and save for family progress.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, squash, bananas and native foods to resell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio Cesar; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de carros y motos y también tiene un mototaxi que hace servicio de taxi en el distrito de Calca, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos de carros y motos y también mejorar en el negocio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de carros y motos y para el mantenimiento de la mototaxi para comprar repuestos.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA” communal bank, located in the Calca district; part of the Calca province and the Cusco department.
Julio Cesar is 52 years old, is married and has two children.  His business is buying and selling cars and motorcycles and also has a mototaxi to provide taxi services in Calca.  He works from 5:00 am to 6:00 pm and he gets his children ahead though this business.  He would like to expand his car and motorcycle business, as well as improve his transportation business.  He is asking for a loan to buy car and motorcycle spare parts and to perform maintenance on his mototaxi.

He is happy about this loan and is committed to meeting his payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 13 years. He is 37 years old and married to Jane. They have four school-going children.  

Isaac was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Isaac hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking business man aged 49. He is married and blessed with three children and one of them is in school. He has been running a butcher shop for the last four years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to open another butcher shop.

loans.use: To open another butcher shop.

loans.name: Colleta  Shirwatso

texts.en:
Colleta Shirwatso is 35 years old and has four children. She is married to a businessman. For the past four years, she has run a hair salon and she has one employee. Colleta is also a farmer and her major business challenge is the poor road network. She describes herself as a hardworking and visionary woman.

Colleta is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy hair dryers. In the future, she sees herself running a cosmetic shop and employing more workers.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking business man, aged 37. He is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is in school. For the last two years, he has been operating a business cleaning buildings and offices. He also runs an insurance agency to increase his income. He has employed three people to assist him to manage the business. 

John has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a scrubbing machine. He thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: To buy a scrubbing machine

loans.name: Namushiya Joint Group

texts.en:
Annah is the facilitator of the Namushiya Joint group. Annah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Annah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Annah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Annah had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Annah was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Annah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Namushiya Joint group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Annah is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building an annex at the back of his house.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children who all are in school. She's had a business of selling perfumes in Buluk South Sudan for two years. Aya is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase perfumes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in the Philippines. Lolita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Lolita is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which will be use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Rosas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ROSAS DE JUAN PABLO está compuesto por ocho integrantes, todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Sonia tiene 56 años y tiene un hijo ya independiente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en una populosa feria de ciudad de El ALto este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Sonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes.
texts.en:
The Bank of Entrepreneurship ROSAS DE JUAN PABLO is formed by eight members, all women. Sonia is the president of the bank. She is 56 years old and has one son who is independent. She sells second-hand clothing in her stall, which is located in a busy market in the city of el Alto. This loan is her first sequence within the institution. 

Sonia will use the loan to buy second-hand clothing in bulk for her business. The reason she is requesting this loan is because she lacks capital. Sonia is faced with challenges in her business which is competition, as there are many people working in the same activity. 

She is going to use the profits to continue to improve her stall. Her wish for her business is to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock in salon business

loans.name: Agamammad

texts.en:
Agamammad was born in the Guba region of Azerbaijan. He settled in Sumgait city. He has been busy with copper-plate engraving. Every morning he collects yellow copper from a brass plant. Having borrowed  $400 from Normicro he has bought a dresser and different instruments. The second loan  of $800 he spent to increase his business.
Agamammad applies for loan $1200 to expand his business area.

loans.use: To expand his business area

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann S. is 31 years old and works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She earns $2/day and her husband, Ros Vannak, earns $5/day working in construction.  They have two young children that are both able to go to school full-time.  Vann S. and her husband will use this loan to buy some construction tools for his business.  Ros Vannak is trying to move up from a wage worker, to a construction manager.  With the new tools, they will be able to start a small construction business that employs some workers.  If this business is successful, Vann S. would like to pay for her children to go to high school.

loans.use: To buy construction tools

loans.name: Puy

texts.en:
Mrs. Puy C. is 44 years old, is a mother of 5 children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works on her farm growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables, but she barely makes enough money to take care of  the family’s expenses. Meanwhile, her husband is talented in fishing and he can typically make up to $7/day, which is a big help to the family’s savings. Three of her children are construction workers and two attend school. 
Currently, Puy C. is humbly asking for a loan amount of $1000 to purchase a boat, fishing nets, and other fishery tools which will enable her husband to run his business more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a boat, fishing net and other fishery tools to run a business.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en: Mr. K. is a low income vulnerable person. He is 42, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Imran has 14 years of  experience in this business. He serves clients in his barber shop with higher quality than other barbers in the area. But this business demands investments from time to time to modernize equipment to deal with hard competition. That’s why Imran applied for a $500 loan to buy an arm chair which prices vary from $300-500 USD.

loans.use: Imran would like to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 35, married with 6 children and 6 dependents. He raises pigs in Kayunga and butchers them. He is hardworking and creative. His business has a market throughout the region, especially in Kampala. He has been in business for seven years and has been receiving loans for 5 years, which he has had no trouble repaying. He plans to use his loan to purchase more pigs. Eventually, he wants to buy a car so he can transport his pork to market without using paid transportation. 
His selling of pork has helped him to educate his children and the orphans he cares for. He has also been able to build his own home.

loans.use: Matia plans to use his loan to buy more pigs and expand his business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.es:
Lydia A. is a woman who has struggled for her three children. After working for a long time, her husband left her with her three children and she was forced to ask her mother to take care of them while she worked to provide for them. However, after some time, her mother passed away and Lydia had to quit her job to take care of her children. She, then, started to clean houses and after some savings, she bought some shoes to sell. With great faith, she started selling shoes little by little. Currently, she has more customers than before. Her children are married and Lydia is now alone.

However, life goes on. She desires to have some tranquility and peace at this stage in her life after going through many life troubles and pains, which she has overcome for her children. Her business is the only incentive that she has to make most of life, and she is fully aware that it is worth all her efforts. Thus, she is requesting a loan of $375, which will be paid off in installments over 3 months. Lydia will buy more shoes for the coming winter season and to offer more product variety to her customers. With your help, Lydia will be able to have hope and happiness in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Lydia A. una mujer que ha luchado por sus tres hijos. Después de haber trabajado por un largo tiempo, su esposo que aun vivía la abandonó, (actualmente finado) con sus tres hijos y ella tuvo que decirle a su mamá que le cuidara a sus hijos mientras ella se iba a trabajar para sacar dinero para mantenerlos. Sin embargo, al cabo del tiempo, la mamá murió, y fue así como Lydia tuvo que dejar de trabajar para ir a su casa y cuidar a sus hijos, comenzó por limpiar casas para poder sacar dinero, y después con unos ahorros, fue comprando zapatos para vender, y con mucha fe comenzó a vender poco a poco zapatos. Actualmente ya tiene más clientas. Y sus hijos ya se encuentran casados y Lydia quedó sola.

Sin embargo la lucha por la vida, sigue y ella desea tener tranquilidad en esta etapa de su vida, puesto que tuvo muchos problemas que enfrentar y sin embargo sacó adelante a sus hijos. Su negocio es el único incentivo que tiene para disfrutar de la vida y saber que todo lo que hizo valió la pena. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses, con este dinero Lydia comprará más zapatos de temporada de invierno y así tendrá algo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Lydia podrá tener una esperanza de vida que le permita ser feliz.

loans.use: to buy winter shoes

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva K. is a trader who sells cooking oil, beans, corn and other provisions. She is married to an engineer. They have 3 children ages 10, 7 and 3. Eva is working very hard to support her family’s finances. Her business is doing well.   

Eva is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more cooking oil, beans, corn, and other provisions in order   to increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy more provisions for shop

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel N. produces and sells springs; he has had this business for more than 20 years. Miguel lives in the city of Limpio (which means clean in Spanish), located 30 minutes away from Asuncion, where he has his shop and factory.

In the mornings, Miguel works at a retirement home, repairing chairs and beds amongst others. He then works at his workshop, where he makes and sells the springs. He buys wires in different sizes and widths then gives them the required form with a special machine in order to produce the springs.

Most of his clients are cars or motorcycle repair shops. This year, his goal is to become the sole provider of the biggest motorcycle’s factory in Paraguay.

He therefore requests a loan to buy the working material (more wires) he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel N. se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de resortes. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace ya más de 20 años. El vive en la ciudad de Limpio que queda a treinta minutos de Asunción en donde posee su fabrica y local de ventas.

Por las mañanas, Miguel trabaja en un hogar de Ancianos realizando reparaciones varias en las sillas, camas entre otras cosas. También fabrica sus resortes en el mismo lugar de venta, compra alambres de distintos tamaños y grosores y le da forma con una máquina especial.

La mayoría de sus clientes son talleres de reparación de vehículos y motocicletas. Este año tiene como meta ingresar como único proveedor en la fábrica más grande de motocicletas de Paraguay. Solicita el crédito para poder adquirir más elementos de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy wires in different sizes and widths in order to produce springs

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Mrs. Noemí R. is a member of the Loreto communal bank, located at Jr. Loreto N° 251, Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is a 29-year-old mother of one dependent child, and her husband is a merchant. She decided to invest the first loan of S/300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos in opening a mini market in her house.

She currently operates this mini market. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and child, and then she runs the mini market until 8:00 p.m.

With the this loan of S/ 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 2 packages of noodles, chicken, fish, milk, preserves, etc.

Noemí is happy because she receives a lot of support from the Manuela Ramos loans, which help her keep moving forward, staying active in her business and supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noemí pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Loreto N° 251, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años, es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega en su domicilio.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y el de su esposo, luego atiende la bodega hasta las 8.00 p.m.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 paquetes de fideos, pollos, pescados, leche, conservas, etc.

Noemí está contenta, recibe bastante apoyo de los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, porque la ayudan a salir adelante, a mantenerse activa en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and divorced. She is a cloth seller, and has been running her business since 2004. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale

loans.name: Ho

texts.en: Mrs. Ho S. makes about $3.56 per day farming and growing vegetables. S. is a widow and lives with her four children in Prey Lean Village, Siem Reap Province. One of her daughters makes about $2.66 per day selling vegetables from home. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for family use and to make it easier to transport things to the market. The remainder of the loan will be used to breed small pigs. This loan will help expand her business and improve family income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport things to market

loans.name: Efrén Ulises

texts.es:
Since Efrén Ulises V. was very young he has been an agriculturalist. He has obtained a lot of experience in this business as he has always helped out a lot with the cultivation of crops in his home community of Condega, in Esteli. Now he is father to one child who is of school age, and this is his main motivation for working in agriculture. Nowadays e has managed to improve his family’s economic situation thanks to the help brought to him by Ceprodel through the credits that he has used directly for his agricultural business.

On this occasion Efren is looking for Ceprodel’s help so that he can benefit from technical assistance in his farming so that when harvest time comes around he can improve his economic situation. He has had two credits with Ceprodel and he has paid them in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Efrén Ulises V. desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario habiendo alcanzado mucha experiencia en el negocio por el hecho de que siempre se ha destacado por tener destrezas en el trato de los cultivos en su comunidad en Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Actualmente es padre de un niño en edad escolar el cual es el motivo de sus esfuerzos en el negocio agropecuario. Hoy en día ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia gracias al apoyo único brindado por Ceprodel por medio de créditos que los ha utilizado directamente en el negocio agropecuario.

En esta ocasión el señor Efrén busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos para cuando llegue el momento de la cosecha mejorar aun mas su condición económica. Actualmente su record con Ceprodel es de 2 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido.

loans.use: Techinical assistance for farming/Asistencia técnica para cultivo

loans.name: Sun Kheom Group

texts.en:
Five people in SobE. (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province formed a borrowing group. Mrs Sun K. is the group leader and she is a grocer. Previously, Mrs Sun K. obtained a loan to start her business. Her business has grown fast so Mrs Sun K. would like to expand her inventory. In order to be able to purchase more grocery goods for her customers she asked for a loan.

Mrs Sun K. is 68 and a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is an enterprising woman, who started her business nine years ago out of economic necessity per a neighbor's recommendation. She started selling shoes thought a catalog, initially offering them to friends and family. As time passed, she had a portfolio and recommendations that helped her grow her business.

She needs a $1000 loan, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise for the various orders she has to fill. With your help, she will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es un mujer emprendedora, quien por necesidades económicas inicio su negocio hace 9 años por recomendación de una vecina, ya que a ella le iba muy bien por lo que inicio con venta de zapato por catalogo ofreciéndolos inicialmente a familiares y amigos. Con el paso del tiempo se fue haciendo de una cartera y de recomendaos lo que le ayudo a hacer crecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.en:
Orzigul K. is 47 years old. She is a single mother of one daughter. She has been through a very tough time, but she has been able to move forward and to take good care of her family. Orzigul currently sells clothing for children and women’s handbags which she buys from the neighboring city Dushanbe, the capital of our country (Tajikistan), which is located about 4 hours from where she lives.

She started with a small side business from her home. Thanks to her good-nature, she has been able to grow her clientele. She currently has two stores. Her main motivation is to provide a good education to her only daughter and to improve their family living condition. Today she is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni (450USD) for the term of 12 months to purchase new, more expensive clothing before the autumn season. IMON (Kiva’s Field Partner) believes Orzigul’s willingness to offer her customers greater value and a wider choice of merchandise, combined with her excellent service, will secure the successful growth of her trade and guarantee good profits from sales. You can help support the well-being of this brave woman and her daughter.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing for kids in order to broaden her inventory

loans.name: Kalunde

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Kalunde Fundikira, 49. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 14 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Kalunde owns a store where she sells traditional African cloth such as vitenge and kanga. She established her business in 2007. She works at the business for four hours a day, two days a week and is assisted by one employee. Kalunde currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 USD to purchase additional African cloth. In the future, she plans to expand as well as to open another shop. Kalunde thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of Traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Socorro se dedica a la venta de limones, al contar con familia en el norte del Perú, donde prolifera el cultivo de dicho fruto, viaja cada 2 semanas a traer mercadería y los expende a los ambulantes de la zona, lo cual le resta ganancias y, si tomamos en cuenta la coyuntura mundial y del país mismo, es que los costos se encarecen (alza de los pasajes y precio de limones) y su ganancia se limita incluso más, por lo que le urge tomar cartas en el asunto.


La señora Socorro necesita de 500 soles en pro de poder adquirir más mercadería y poder viajar más seguido para poder no sólo vender dicha mercadería a los ambulantes sino a comerciantes de los mercados de la zona, logrando incrementar sus ingresos y poder optar por una calidad de vida mucho mejor para su familia y, en sí, para sus 2 nietos a quienes adora y vela tanto por su salud y educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Socorro is dedicated to selling lemons. She lives with her family in the Northern part of Peru, where there is widespread cultivation of this fruit. She travels every two weeks to bring the merchandise to the bargainers in the area, though it reduces her earnings. Taking into account the environment and the country itself, the costs is great (for shipping and the prices for lemons), thus it limits things all the more.

Mrs. Socorro needs $500 soles to buy more merchandise and to be able to travel more frequently to sell not only to the bargainers, but to other traders in the market. She wants to realize more income and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family. She also wants the best for her two grandchildren that they may have good health and the best education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to increase trade.

loans.name: Pos

texts.en: Mrs. Pos O. is a villager in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder to make a living. Now she faces some problems because she does not have much money with which to earn a living. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food and ducklings for her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Anh, is a construction worker. Mrs. Pos O. is 27 years old and the mother of three children, who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food and ducklings for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Claudine A. is married to Djakpo Dossou and has four children, Céleste, 8, Claudiette, 11, Alexandrine, 17, and Armane, 19. Her three youngest children are in school.

Claudine has three businesses: she sells juice, fabric, and she caters for special occasions. Juices are Claudine's speciality, especially bissap (hibiscus flower tea) and lemon juice. Her sales of juice rise exponentially during the dry season. Claudine also sells bags of sugar and blocks of ice.

Claudine has spent the past 10 years selling these products and has been receiving loans since 2005. Her eventual goal is to buy a generator to keep her drinks cold when the electricity cuts off, which it does frequently in Cotonou, and also to find a full-time desk job.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of sugar, food coloring, and bissap (hibiscus flower tea)

loans.name: Amabo

texts.en:
Born January 25, 1942, Pa Amabo J. is married to Ma Helen Ngum.  They have been blessed with eight children, two of whom are still below the age of fifteen. Amabo and his family live in a seven-room apartment in the Ntaghem neighborhood of Nkwen.

Due to circumstances beyond his control, Amabo didn’t have the privilege of basic education or an apprenticeship to learn a trade, because his parents where poor. Even worse, both his parents died when he was still very young because they did not have money to pay for medication. Amabo joined GHAPE on October 8, 2003. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid four loans and the profits from these loans have helped him to sustain his life and that of his family, as well as to provide for the school needs of his younger children.
	
With this loan of 500000frs, he plans to buy piglets, pig feed, wood, and fish to resell from his home so as to reduce the distance that his neighbors must trek to obtain these items. He will use part of the profit generated by this loan to continue to educate his children and part will be reinvested in his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he has been doing this business for a long period of time.

Amabo will start repaying the loan in the fourth month after he receives the loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed , wood, and fish

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth O. is 51 years old and married with 7 children. She has a patent medicine shop where she sells medicine to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000  to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine for re-sale

loans.name: Bayarhuu

texts.en: Bayarhuu T. is a 62-year-old woman who lives with her husband. All three of her children are married and have moved out. In 2003, her family moved from Hovd, a western province, to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since she moved in, she bought a children's clothing stall at the "Narantuul" market and began to run a clothing sales business. Narantuul is the biggest market in Mongolia. She took her first loan from XacBank (Kiva's Partner Microfinance institution of Mongolia) in 2006 to buy her second stall at the same market. Bayarhuu is one of best borrower's at XacBank, whose business has expanded quickly in the past few years. With the lunar New Year celebration approaching, small items have sold quickly, therefore she wants a loan to buy more kids clothes to increase her business inventory.  She is hard-working person who is fastidious with her money.

loans.use: To buy more kids clothes to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Antonia L. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, del Barrio Pacifico, en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, ella se dedica a la artesanía en metal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de materiales (lata) para producir sus productos (carros en miniatura) para las ferias tradicionales en miniatura de la región.  
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá e la compra de materiales (pintura, lata, vidrio, cortinas, estaño, pasta, etc.) para elaborar sus productos artesanales (casitas y autos en miniatura) y comercializarlos en las ferias tradicionales de todo el Perú. Su anhelo es construir su casa y educar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia L. A. is a member of the “Unión 28 de Julio” Communal Bank in the Pacific neighborhood of the Yunguyo district, in the province of Yunguyo, in the Puno area. She is 22-years-old, lives with her partner, has 2 children and has completed her secondary education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years, selling metal handicrafts. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, a sum that she invested in the purchase of materials (tin) in order to make her products (miniature cars) for the traditional fairs of the region. She is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles and has agreed to repay it in 3 monthly payments. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials (paint, tin, glass, curtains, pewter, polish, etc.) in order to make her crafts (little houses and miniature cars) and sell them at the traditional fairs throughout Peru. Her dream is to buy a house and see her children get an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials such as paint, tin, glass, curtains, pewter, polish, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B. is a fish vendor. She buys fish from the fishermen and sells them all in the wet market for family income. She is married to a fisherman, Vitaliano B.. Every night, her husband goes out in the sea, throws his old nets and baits to catch more fish. Her husband also helps her sell fish in their village to feed and clothe their family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy new fishing materials. She will also use some of the loan to repair his old boat and also buy more fish from other fishermen to sell.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI helps people start and have their own business. They give their clients not only credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy new fishing materials

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
SARA T. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje”,  su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Dos de Mayo Nº 834, a 5 cuadras y media de la Municipalidad Distrital de Yarinacocha, en el distrito del mismo nombre, tiene 65 años de edad, Se dedica a la costura desde los 17 años, es madre soltera, oficio con el que educó a sus 3 hijos.

Ella tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, ya generó el primer puesto de trabajo directo, debido a que tiene una joven ayudante laborando en su pequeño negocio, ubicado en su domicilio.

Con este préstamo  de S/ 1,400. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el arreglo de una máquina de coser y comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar todo tipo de ropa. Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sara T. D. belongs to the Community Bank "Madres Coraje". Her home is located in Jr. Dos de Mayo N. 834, approximately 5 blocks from the District Municipality of Yarinacocha, of the district with the same name. She is 65 years old. She has been a seamstress since she was 17 years old. She is a single mother and she managed to educate her 3 children through her business.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 2 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/300 nuevos soles, funds that she used towards the maintenace of her sewing machine to keep developing her small business. Currently she has created a store where she receives orders directly from customers, given that she has a young woman helping her with the small business, located in her home.

With this loan of S/1400 nuevos soles, she will invest in the maintenance and repair of her sewing maching and she will also purchase materials to make and design all types of clothing. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she has never received a loan from any financial institution before. Manuela Ramos, without too much paper work, believed in her and motivates her to be responsible with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing. For maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Born in 1937, N. C. Emmanuel is married and has five children, two of whom are less than 15 years old. Due to health reasons, he was unable to meet the academic needs of all his children, and two of them had to drop out of school. Determined to see all his children become responsible citizens in the future, he joined GHAPE in 2005 and received his first loan of $40, which he invested in pig rearing. As of now, he has proven his credibility by receiving and repaying loans totaling $370. 

Given a loan of $225, he intends to buy three piglets, one goat and construct bee hives for the production and sale of honey. Pigs and goats have highly valued in his community as a source of food. The manure he gets from the pig farm shall be used to open a vegetable garden. Honey is equally highly demanded for medicinal purposes and so he stands a great chance to benefit a lot from this investment. The profit he gets from the loan shall be used to pay school fees for his children and provide food for the family.

He intends to repay the loan in eighteen months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Three piglets, a goat, and materials for the construction of bee hives

loans.name: Eliezer Francisco

texts.es:
El Joven Eliezer Francisco C. M., tiene la edad de 26 años, habita en le barrio Esquipulas, junto a sus padres
y hermanos, su mama trabaja como cocinera en el mismo hotel donde el labora la misma actividad , ellos son cuatro hermanos una de ella es discapacitada , una de 18 años que estudia y otro 20  trabaja y estudia , ellos son una familia muy unida , Eliezer es el mayor el cual tiene el sueños de poder terminar de construir su casa , ya que este es el segundo financiamiento , y se siente muy contento ya que le brindamos la mano de AFODENIC , para cumplir sus sueños , con el primer crédito logro hacer las divisiones de los cuartos y ahora quiere hacer parte de la cocina , la cual le falta paredes y techo . Con el financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción para poder terminar la cocina.
texts.en:
Young Eliezer Francisco C. M. is 26 years old and lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood with his parents and siblings. His mother works as a cook in the same hotel he cooks in. There are four children in the family. One has a disability, another is an 18-year-old student, and the other is a 20 year old, who both works and studies. This is a very close family. Eliezer is the oldest and dreams of being able to finish building their house. This is his second loan and he is happy for AFODENIC’s help in making his dreams come true. With the first loan, he was able to divide the rooms and now he would like to do the kitchen, which still needs walls and a roof. With this loan, he will buy construction materials so he can finish the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compara materiales de construcion para terminar de hacer la cosina

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence retails planks to her customers. She is married with six children and she is 37 years old. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children. Four are currently in school.

Abiba sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly for breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled, and taken with sugar, milk and bread.

With her large customer base, Abiba wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like milk and bags of maize, millet and sugar to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her children in school. It is her dream to build her own house and also to see her children reach the university level.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like milk and bags of maize, millet and sugar

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 50 years old and married with 8 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Илхом

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Илхом, женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка присматривает за детьми.Илхом торгует на Афган базаре хоз-товарами. Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Он хотел бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого он предпочел взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента и обратился в нашу организацию. Он благодарит инвесторов за поддержку.

loans.use: На закупку стирального порошка и моющих средст.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of two and fourteen years, five of whom go to school. Mariam also takes care of additional family members.

Mariam’s family eats three meals a day. She rents a four-room house where she is staying with seven people. There is electricity but no plumbing at her home.

For the last five years Mariam has worked seven days a week running a shop carrying home goods in a semi-urban area. She has approximately thirty customers a day. She goes to Kamapala to buy her merchandise. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her store and house, plus medication. She also incurs travel expenses.

Mariam has been with MCDT for two years. She is servicing her fourth loan, working with the same group. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her shop. Mariam hopes to see her business grow bigger so she can own her own shop and home. .

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Lago Azul  Yapura.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 5 meses,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de lana de diferentes colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de lanas de colores, agujas de tejer, hilos, etc. Lidia elabora todo tipo de manualidades y los vende  a los turistas que visitan Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de lanas de colores, agujas de tejer, hilos, etc

loans.name: Erlan Josue

texts.es:
Erlan Josue C. es una persona joven con un gran espiritu de trabajo,  el tiene una glorieta ubicada en uno de los institutos de la ciudad de choluteca,es un negocio productivo.
Erlan se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para poder estar temprano en la glorieta y poder atender a sus 
clientes. su esposa le ayuda a vender, en su menu vende tacos, enchiladas,tajaditas,tortillas con quesillo, refrescos etc. 
el solicita el credito para que su negocio sea mas grande y mas productivo.
texts.en:
Erlan Josue C. is a young person with a great work ethic. He has a kiosk located at one of the institutes of the city of Choluteca, and the business is profitable. Erlan wakes up at 4 in the morning so that he can be at the kiosk early and serve his customers. His wife helps him there, and the menu includes tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, tortillas with cheese, soft drinks, etc. He seeks a loan so that his business can become larger and more lucrative.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase churros, soft drinks, confits, cookies, meat, tortillas, vegetables, juice, popsicles, chocolates, and confectionary supplies

loans.name: Erabor

texts.en: A. is 46 years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions and has been in this business for years. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Mrs. Ambica P. is a tailor in the town of Bhakapati in Kathmandu. Her husband, Madhu Sudan P., works in the Nepal Army. She has two daughters studying in primary school.

She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers sewing popular items like kurta sulwars, blouses, ladies long dresses, Makhshi and other dresses. Before starting her own business, Mrs. P. took a 6 month training course in tailoring. She plans to use the loan of Rs 10,000 to buy supplies for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her daughters' education.

loans.use: to buys supplies for her work

loans.name: Sineu

texts.en: Mrs. Sineu P. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sambo, is a motorbike taxidriver. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his motorbike is old and he spends a lot of money on fuel, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to change his motorbike for his business. Mrs. Sineu P. has three children who are attending the local school. Her husband appears on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To change his motorbike for his business

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam B., 45, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning a gross income of US $20 per day. Her husband always helps her with the business. Also, he offers taxi services in town using his motorbike, earning an income of about $2.50 a day to help cover the family expenses. B. and her husband wish to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, B. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to stock in the store.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia M. es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son menores. Katia se dedica a la venta de verduras para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte público. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace tres años y nos cuenta que con el primer crédito que recibió que fue de 300.00 nuevos soles pudo invertir en su negocio.
En la actualidad Katia necesita en crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra  de verduras al por mayor para posteriormente ser vendidas en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa. La meta de Katia es educar a sus hijos y seguir apoyando a su esposo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Katia M., 42, is a dynamic and hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has four children, two of which are minors. She is a vegetable merchant. Her husband, who works in public transportation, supports her work. She has been a member of the "Madres Corajes" communal bank for the last 3 years and she tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her business. Currently, Katia needs 1000 new soles to buy vegetables at wholesale to be resold later at Pucallpa's Bellavista market. Katia's goal is to see her children educated and to continue to support her husband so that all of them can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Naranjaisy Group

texts.es:
El comité “Naranjaisy Poty” se formó con la unión varias vecinas de la Compañia Naranjaisy ciudad de  Villeta.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. 
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.

Hablaremos especialmente de la Señora Fredesvinda Noelaia S. de Fragueda quien tiene 66 años de edad, esta casada hace más de 40 años, vive en la casa de la calle 12 de Octubre de la Compañia Naranjaisy de la Ciudad de Villeta, es Artesana especializada en la confección de Prendas  de Ao Poi. 
Ella tiene 4 hijas ya mayores, casadas con hijos, tiene 6 nietos, es una lider en su comunidad, aprendió el oficio en cursos que traía el Gobierno a la ciudad en años anteriores. Hoy en dia la señora Noelia como la conocen enseña dos veces por semana tan hermoso arte tradicional paraguayo a otras mujeres de todas las edades en el local del Departamento de Cultura de la Municipalidad de Villeta.
La Prof. Noelia es una mujer multifacética quien apoya a su comunidad.  
1
Jorgelina Centurión 
Artesanía en Ao Poí 
2
Rosa B. de D.
Venta de Cosmeticos

texts.en:
The Naranjaisy Poty group is made up of a number of neighbours from the Naranjaisy neighbourhood in the city of Villeta. All the members have their own independent small business, such as sales. All the members of this group are mothers who have a variety of economic activities with the goal of increasing their household income and of developing their enterprises in a sustainable manner and in view of steady growth, with the help of ongoing financial assistance. We will focus on Mrs. Fredesvinda Noelia S. de Fragueda who is 66 years old and has been married for over 40 years. She lives in a house on 12 de Octubre road in Naranjaisy neighbourhood in the city of Villeta. She is an artisan specializing in making clothing from Ao Poi, a type of a fine cotton cloth. She has four adult daughters who are married and have children of their own. She has six grandchildren and is a community leader. She learned her trade thanks to municipal government courses which she took in previous years. Today, Noelia, as she is known, teaches twice weekly courses in her beautiful traditional Paraguayan art to other women of all ages in the offices of the Department of Culture of the Municipality of Villeta. Noelia is a multi-faceted woman who supports her community. 1 Jorgelina Centurión - Ao Poí artisan 2 Rosa B. de D. - Cosmetics sales 3 Elisea G. de González - Food sales 4 Noelia Fredesvinda S. - Ao Poí artisan 5 Juana R. - Confectionery 6 Juliana A. - Artisan 7 Blasida F. - Seamstress 8 Alba Isabel Fragueda - Cosmetics Sales 9 Blanca Lydia F. - Clothing Sales 10 Pabla O. - Fruit Sales 11 María Esther F. - Convenience Store 12 Yenny G. - Artisan 13 Lilian Ester A. - Hen Breeding 14 Norma Lilian Nuñez - Cosmetics Sales 15 Claudelina Duate - Cosmetics Sales 16 Wilma Emilce D. - Cosmetics Sales 17 Lidia G. R. - Ao Poi Artisan 18 Rita Aidee R. - Poultry Breeding

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Each of the group members sells a variety of goods such as clothing, rice, sugar, dairy products, poultry breeding, cosmetics, Ao Poi crafts and so on and their loans were used to purchase those products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. A. is 45 years old, widowed and has seven children between the age of 21 and 10 years. All of her children are still schooling and she hopes to give them quality education. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy local market in Kakamega, where she has sold cereals to the local people for the last twenty years. She will use her Kes 20,000 loan to restock her business by purchasing more beans, wheat, groundnuts and peas. She is very hardworking and takes pride in being the supplier of cereals in Kakamega, even when she knows that there are challenges of low demand seasonally.

loans.use: Beans,  wheat, groundnuts, and peas.

loans.name: Emaka

texts.en:
Emaka is a businessman and he loves doing business. He is 24 years old and single without children although he hopes to get married very soon.

Emaka sells women’s shoes at retail prices and sells for long hours to support his aged parents. He hopes to own a shoe factory in the future.

Emaka has a good relationship with LAPO. He is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more women’s shoes to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Esperanza es casada, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Esperanza tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, sus prendas los vende en las diferentes ferias con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas y botones.
Los sueños de Esperanza son mejorar su taller e implementar con maquinas modernas y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Solidaridad Communal Bank.

Esperanza is a 54-year-old married mother with 7 children. She has her own sewing workshop at home. She sells the clothing that she makes throughout the different markets in the area with the help of her children.

Esperanza needs a 1,000 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing fabric and buttons. She dreams of improving her workshop and of putting in the latest sewing machines. She also dreams of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and buttons

loans.name: Clara Maria

texts.es:
Clara María R. P. tiene 49 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, en el barrio La Campiña, barrio que todo gira en torno de actividades deportivas como el fútbol. En esta zona tiene un negocio de internet y una dulcería llamada Clara Luna, ambos manejados desde su casa. Inició la dulcería Clara Luna hace alrededor de 10 años cuando vendía dulces y ropa interior. A partir de entonces, se han ampliado sus horizontes y hoy en día su hogar es un lugar en que también ofrece servicios de llamadas e internet. Ha recibido 2 créditos anteriores de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingos, los cuales le han permitido ampliar sus servicios, mejorar su vida económicamente y  la posibilidad de apoyar la formación profesional de sus hijos una de ellas en la fotografia a su lado derecho, pues la apoya en su negocio .
El crédito de $2.250.000 que actualmente solicita se invertirá en el acondicionamiento de una habitación de su casa para adecuarlo como su negocio, ya que la falta de espacio en su negocio lo que señala como su mayor desafío. Es más, en la medida que sea posible, piensa comprar otro computador para enfrentar la demanda de servicio de internet que existe en el barrio.
