El uso del internet en la zona ha incrementado en cuanto los habitantes jóvenes se forman hasta un nivel académico más alto, con  lo cual crece la demanda de internet como medio de comunicación. Con el fin de seguir satisfaciendo la demanda, manifiesta que su misión es prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con una meta de consolidarlo en su infraestructura dentro de dos años. Es decir, que el local esté en óptimas condiciones para así llevar a cabo éste propósito.
texts.en:
Clara María R. P. is 49 years old and lives in the town of Cartagena, in the neighborhood La Campiña where everybody is involved in sports such as football soccer. She has an internet business and a candy shop called Clara Luna, both businesses managed from her home. She started the candy shop 10 years ago selling candy and underwear. From then on her horizon has broadened and today her home also offers the service of phonecalls and internet. She has received 2 prior loans form Fundación Mario Santo Domingos which have allowed her to increase business, improve her life economically, and have the possibility to support the professional schooling of her children. One daughter is a photographer and helps her with her business.

The requested loan of $2.250.000 will be spent on rehabilitation of a room at her house for business as she needs more space. This is her main goal. She also wishes to buy a computer to face the growing demand of internet in her neighborhood. The use of internet has grown because the young people reach a higer academic level and internet is used as a means of communication. Her goal is to continue meeting the demand, to offer better service to her customers and to grow within the next two years so the premises will be in optimate conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve business

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie Diamé is 40 years old. She is married and is the mother of four children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" Thieckene for six years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Sophie Diamé runs a shop in which she sells cosmetics. She will use the full amount of this loan to buy more cosmetics which she can then sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Heborns

texts.en: Hesborns W. O., 64 years old, married and blessed with nine children, lives in Manyole Village, Busia District.  He operates a shoe-selling business in Nambale, Busia District, an enterprise he started in 1985. Buying his stock from the capital city of Nairobi, Kenya three times a month, Hesborns enjoys dealing with people who are straight forward.  He is now requesting a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which he will invest in his business for expansion by increasing stock. His future plan is to expand and grow his business further.

loans.use: Expand business by increasing stock

loans.name: Lolita Mutia Group

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 55 years old. Lolita is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lolita is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years, and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio P. V., es un hombre de 38 años que habita con su pareja de vida en el Barrio Buenos Aires, su señora labora en las tareas del hogar y apoya en los trabajos de la finca, debido a que el señor se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 18, ellos tienen 4 hijos que estudian y apoyan también a los trabajos de la siembra.

Uno de los problemas que más ha afectado las cosechas ha sido la infección de plagas, que en la cosecha pasada redujo significativamente la producción, ocasionándoles problemas económicos, es por esta misma razón que él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizants y pesticidas  que aporten un mantenimiento optimo a los sembrados, y a futuro le generen los recursos monetarios para  la planificación de proyectos que aporten al mejoramiento  de los niveles de vida da la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio P. V. is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires. His wife, who is his partner in life, does the household chores and helps with the work around their farm. Manuel has been farming for 18 years. They have four children who are in school and also help with the farm work.

One problem that has impacted his crops is the infestation of pests. His previous harvest was reduced significantly and resulted in financial problems. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides so that he can optimally maintain his crops. In the future, he hopes to have the financial resources to plan improvement projects that will raise his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is a 24-year-old man married to a businesswoman and together they have one child. Like his wife, Anthony is also a businessman who deals in selling shoes, mostly second hand shoes, in Hoima, Uganda, a business he has done for the last five years. Like many youth in Hoima, Anthony got the initial capital for his shoe business after selling a season's harvest of tobacco, the major cash crop in the area. He says though, he would like to sell all kinds of shoes in terms of class and standard. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and Anthony is going to purchase shoes for reselling.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane D.   est un jeune homme de 28 ans qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam. Il est membre de la caisse depuis 2 ans. Il est célibataire et il évolue  dans le secteur du commerce avec une expérience  de 10 ans dans la vente de vaisselles. C’est la rapidité  de la vente qui l’a surtout attire dans cette activité. Et c’est juste après les études  qu’il s’est oriente dans ce secteur d’activité. Il sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de  vaisselles en vue de renforcer son stock pour ainsi satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ousmane D. is a 28 years old young man, who lives in the city of Ouakam. He has been a member of the credit institution for two years. He is single and has been involved in his business of selling pottery for ten years. The rapidity of sale in this business attracted him the most and he decided to get into it just after graduating. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to purchase pottery in order to increase his stock and to be able to meet the always growing demand of his customers.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase stock

loans.name: Hilda Magali

texts.es:
Magali es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Magali vive en casa alquilada de su tío y su mayor deseo es tener una casa propia, Magali es casada y tiene 3 hijos, al inicio vendía jugos de manera ambulatoria , negocio que dejo de realizar por la atención de sus hijos, actualmente Magali implementara una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y aceite. 
El sueño de Magali es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Magali is a member of the Morenita Huamanga cooperative bank. Magali lives in a house rented from her uncle, and her biggest wish is to have her own home. Magali is married and has 3 children. In the beginning, she worked as a street vendor selling juices. She discontinued this business, however, to care for her children. Currently, Magali runs a grocery store out of her house. Her loan will be invested into the purchase of rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Magali’s dream is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción” actualmente se encuentra en el XVI ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa de la socia Benedicta que está ubicado en la comunidad de Compone, Anta. La comunidad de Componte se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedica  a la agricultura y la ganadería.

Benedicta, tiene 35 años y tiene dos hijos, ella nació y vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Izcuchaca provincia de Anta. Hace dos años atrás, Benedicta abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en su domicilio, donde vendía comestibles a sus vecinos. También vendía maíz, papa, chicha de jora, yogurt y queso y lL. sus productos a vender a la ciudad del Cusco.
 
Ahora, Benedicta cambio de negocio y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Utilizo el pequeño capital que tenía para capacitarse en la crianza de animales, para construir un pequeño galpón y empezó a criar 7 cuyes. En la actualidad tiene 15 cuyes y le estan capacitando los especialistas de la municipalidad de Anta. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Benedicta espera recibir S/. 1000 soles. Por el momento, su galpón esta modestamente de implementado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero para sembrar pasto en su chacra que esta a lado de su domicilio: El pasto es un buen alimento para los cuyes. El sueño de la socia es convertirse en una empresaria en el comercio de venta y crianza de animales de menores. 
 
Benedicta es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal y la escogieron como la presidenta porque es una persona puntual y responsable. Ya son tres veces que está en el cargo y le va muy bien gracias al carisma y buena voluntad que tiene.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) Communal Bank is currently in its 16th cycle. It is comprised of hard-working and enterprising people who always look for opportunities to get ahead. With their daily effort they are looking to give their children a better future. The communal bank’s meetings are every 30 days. They meet in Benedicta’s house. She is a member, and her house is located in the Compone community in Anta. The Componte community is 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and with livestock. Benedicta is 35 years old, and she has two children. She was born in and lives in the Compone community in the Izcuchca district, Anta province. Two years ago Benedicta opened a grocery store in her home, and she sold food to her neighbors. She also sold corn, potatoes, “chicha de jora” (a traditional beverage of the area that is made of corn), yogurt, and cheese. She took her products to the city of Cusco to sell. Now Benedicta has changed businesses. She raises small animals like guinea pigs. She used the small amount of capital that she had to prepare to raise animals and to build a small shed. She started raising seven guinea pigs. She currently has 15 guinea pigs. The specialists in the Anta municipality are training her. The next loan that Benedicta hopes to receive is for 1,000 soles. At the present time the shed is modestly set up with the basic necessities. She would like to use the money to plant grass on her farm, which is at the side of her house. Grass is good food for the guinea pigs. Benedicta’s dream is to become an entrepreneur in the business of raising and selling small animals. Benedicta is a founding member of the communal bank. They chose her to be the president because she is a punctual and responsible person. She has had this position three times. It is going very well thanks to the charisma and good will that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant grass on her farm

loans.name: Khanim

texts.ru:
Khanim A. 56 let. Ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli, I seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione , . Ona ne zamujem i jivet odna. 

Khanim A. uje 5 let zanimayesya etim biznesom prodaji sira , moloka, zeleni i razniz ovoshey i fruktov. Khanim seychas nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji. Ranshe Khanim sama imela korov i iz ix moloka delala sir i prodovala no uje ona ne uspevayet i poeotmu ona reshila otkrit maqazin i zanimatsya uje etim delom.
texts.en:
Khanim A. is 56 years old. She is a refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region. She is unmarried and lives alone. For five years, Khanim A. has been selling cheese, milk, greens, vegetables, and fruit. Khanim now needs 2000 AZN to buy produce for resale. Earlier, Khanim had her own cow, and from its milk she made cheese and sold it. However, she no longer has time for that, and therefore she decided to open a store and work there.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying produce

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es:
El señor Oscar William L. G.n, tiene la edad de 34 años vive en el Barrio Eduardo Contreras, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela primaria, el señor se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace mas de 8 años, fue gracias al apoyo de sus padres que logró iniciar sus negocios de cultivos de plátanos, dentro de sus planes esta la ampliación del área de siembra de plátano.

Para su negocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes con la intención de mejorar las siembras bajo un mejor mantenimiento a sus cosechas, esto le brindara un aumento en  las ventas que le permitirán mejores condiciones económicas para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar William L. G.n, 34, lives in the Eduardo Contreras neighborhood. He’s married and his wife’s a housewife. They have two minor children who are in elementary school. He has been a farmer for over 8 years. Thanks to help from his parents he started his banana growing business. Among his plans is to expand the area under banana cultivation. He is asking for funds for his business to buy supplies and fertilizers in order to improve his crops with better maintenance. This will increase sales which in turn will improve his and his family’s economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en: Lila J. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lila owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lila has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Lila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lila is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Хушвахтов Бахром проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Бахром занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Bahrom K. lives in Hamadoni. He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Bahrom works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle at home. He basically fattens and sells cattle. He has been doing this for four years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin Y. is 28 years old. He is married and has two children.  Shahin is a market vendor.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years.  During these years Shahin has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruit so that it keeps its marketable condition and does not lose taste and useful properties.  Shahin buys vegetables and fruit from the local farmers.  In the market, he is known among people because of the attractive prices and his friendly nature.  This allows Shahin’s business to generate stable and considerable income for his family.  Due to the season, Shahin’s now wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.  He will sell them later when the price will increase.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mr. Mean M., forty years old, and his wife, Mrs. Pheap Vet, 34 years old, have been married since 2000 (Mean was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured). They have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of their children attend school while one stays home. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mean is a truck driver while his wife is a rice farmer. His truck breaks down, and it does not work well. He wants to repair it, but he does not have the money. Therefore, Mean is asking for his first loan of 700 USD.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin O. is from the village of Macate Diffun Quirino. He is 20 years old and is single. To make a living, Marvin owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale.  Marvin has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Marvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marvin is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marvin from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn P., 41, is a farmer from Agusan del Sur.  She manages a farm.  She also has a sari-sari store business.  She sells soy sauce, vinegar and other frequently used products. Genalyn supports her family of four children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old.  She works hard in order to earn more.

Her capital is limited, which is why she joined in Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to access a loan.  She’s requesting 4,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to support her business, buying farm and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: farm requirements and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mardonkul

texts.ru: Зарифов Мардонкул 36-летний женатый мужчина. Живет в районе Вахдат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. У себя дома занимается производством деревянных сундуков (национальные сундуки "Сандук"). Он в основном производит и продает сундуки на центральном рынке района. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Целью кредита является закуп древесины.
texts.en: Mardonkul Z.  is a 36-year-old married man.  He lives in Vahdat and has two children.  He has a high school education.   He makes traditional wooden chests, called “sanduk,” at home.  Basically, he makes chests and sells them in the central market. He has been doing this work for more than six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy wood.

loans.use: Buying wood

loans.name: Cruz Azul Group

texts.es:
El comité “Cruz Azul” inicia ciclo  con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a  señoras que emprenderán actividades. 
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.   
Asi una de las integrantes es  la señora Cynthia quien se  dedica a la venta de  ropas.
Ella decidio en  esta oportunidad optar por este negocio para ya que es la temporada  de mucha venta de ropas por la fiestas que se acercan.
Quiere contar con buena variedad y cantidad para ofrecer  y poder competir con los demas  negocios.
Para ella solicita el pretamo para la compra de remeras, camisillas, vestidos, y otras prendas de vestir de la temporada.
texts.en:
The group named "Cruz Azul" has started a loan cycle with Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner). The majority of the members already have viable businesses but there are a few members who will be just starting up their businesses.

They strive towards a better future for their kids, and they have been working twice as hard to provide them with the support they need for their develpment and education. 

One of the members is Cynthia and she has a retail clothing business. 

She decided to opt in to this business opportunity to take advantage of the season when clothing sales are high, for the holidays that are approaching.

She wants to have a good variety and quantity of clothing to resell, to be in good shape to compete with the other businesses.  To this end she requests a loan and she will purchase t-shirts, tank tops, dresses, and other items of clothing suitable for the season.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts, shorts dresses, tank tops and other items of clothing for the season.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan from Marka, Amman is 55 years old and the father of two children. He has his own car repair shop after developing good experience in that field.
Adnan is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new equipment for his shop. He is looking to develop his shop and increase his revenue.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his shop

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah O. is fifty eight years old, married and has four children who are between the ages  twenty four  and thirty five years old.  Her business is located at Shikoti market in Kakamega and is well known by its name Shama medical clinic.  

Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and is commonly referred as the sugar belt region.  She owns a clinic in which she has been providing treatment as well as selling drugs to the local people, school children and teachers.  She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is low purchasing power by the people in the area.  However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 30,000 KES to buy a weighing scale and drugs to treat as many diseases as possible.  She hopes to grow her business into a nursing home in the future.  She describes herself as visionary, competent and kind.

loans.use: To purchase weighing scale and drugs to treat as many diseases as possible.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Esi sells provisions and charcoal at Abura, Cape Coast. Esi uses the income she makes from her sales to help her husband to feed and educate her children. Esi will use the loan to acquire other provisions requested by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to build another shop.

loans.use: acquire other provisions requested by her customers

loans.name: Berdikul

texts.en: Y. Berdikul was born on August 2, 1948. Coming from an area where raising cattle is popular, Berdikul has been selling cattle since 1996. He buys them in his village from farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Berdikul would like to expand his business and increase his capital so that he can maximize his profits. For this reason, Berdikul is requesting this loan to purchase calves. This will be his first loan with IMON International and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 49 años, nacido en el distrito de San Francisco; esta casado con Domitila de 48 años y tienen 06 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa, ubicada en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Alta; anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. Feliciano, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino y cuenta con 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y piña, frutos de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 25 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y frutos de piña. Su dificultad es; no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo durante la cosecha; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de piña ya que cuenta con 01 hectarea de terreno no cultivado. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en la cosecha de café.
texts.en: Feliciano is 49 years old and was born in the San Francisco district.  He is married to Domitilia, who is 48, and he has 6 children.  The family has their own home which is located in the community of Vista Alegre Alta, an annex of the Kimbiri district. Feliciano is the one who supports his family.  From the time that he was very young his parents taught him to work on the farm.  He is a farmer who has 5 hectares of land where he cultivates coffee plants and pineapple, fruits that grow in this forest area near the Rio Apurimac Valley.  He has been farming his own lands for 25 years, and during harvest times he has the support of his children and he also hires workers so that he can extract his fruit more rapidly.  What he likes most about his work is harvesting the fruit of the plants, because in this way he feels that his months of hard work are being rewarded with quality fruit.  What he considers most difficult is transporting his products from the farm to the collection centers that are located in the city of San Francisco, a place where the best prices are offered for his coffee beans and pineapples.  The difficulty he faces is that he does not have enough money to cover all of the advance payments that he must make to the workers who help him with the harvest.  For this reason, he has come to the MFP institution to request a loan.  But now his priority is to cultivate more pineapple plants since he has 1 hectare of land that is not cultivated.  This is his 7th loan with MFP, and he feels that this support will help him a lot to make progress with his work.  In his communal bank he is a member who is very well-liked by his fellow group members, since he is very supportive of them.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested he will pay for workers so that they can assist him in harvesting his coffee.

loans.use: to hire workers to help him with his coffee harvest.

loans.name: Campanita De Oro Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Campanita D. oro", el grupo esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. el Rincon D. los Pirules, San felipe del progreso, L. comunidad es D. escasos recursos, es algo alejada del municipio y por lo tanto hay pocos servicios publicos, son caminos empedarados y caminos con mucha tierra suelta, L. comunidad en general se dedica a L. agricultura y ganaderia, en esta comunidad no hay señal y el transporte es un poco limitado, ya se cuenta con una preparatoria para que los jovenes puedan preparase y no les cueste estar viajando hasta el centro del municipio, el grupo lo integran 8 personas, son 8 mujeres que tienen su actividad pero que nesecitan una ayuda para mejorar un poco, desidieron llamarse así "campanita D. oro" porque lo consideran D. buena suerte para sus negocios y le vaya bien al grupo en general. Los nombres D. las integrantes son los siguientes:
1.-Florenacia D. L. C. G., tiene 48 años
2.-Claudia E. G., tiene 23 años
3.-Ma Benita Catarina B., 45 años
4.-Delfina M. F., 32 años D. edad
5.-Gregoria S. C., 56 años D. edad
6.-Heriberta M. E., 32 años
7.-Lucia S. A., 25 años D. edad
8.-Juana A. T., 58 años D. edad
L. representante del grupo se llama Heriberta, elL. es vecina D. todos los integrantes y los conoce desD. hace ya varios años y se llevan muy bien, elL. tiene 4 hijos y los cuatro estudian, es casada y cumplio 10 años, vive en casa propia con su esposo, su esposo trabaja como albañil y en una carpinteria, doña Heriberta tiene un local pequeño en su casa y venD. refrescos, aguas y tambien sabritas, pero nesecita aun mas cosas para que le vaya un poco mejor, nesecita una inversion y comprar otras cosas que le hacen falta a su tienda como por ejemplo; el huevo y jamon que son productos que se venden bien por estar alejados D. L. comunidad mucha gente lo busca, tambien L. salchicha y L. longaniza como tambien algo D. cremeria, en fin son muchas cosas que quiere vender pero hace falta el dinero para poder vender todo eso. Unas D. las metas son que el negocio cresca y poder realizar L. idea D. poder poner una tienda granD. en L. comunidad para mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. mi familia.
texts.en:
This group is named "Campanita D. Oro" [Little Gold Bell]. The group is located in the community of El Rincon D. los Pirules, San Felipe del Progreso. The community is low income, and a little far from town. Because of this, there are few public services, the roads have gravel on them or have a lot of loose earth. In general, the commuity works in farming and cattle. There is no traffic light in the community and transportation is very limited. It does have a high school so that the youth can be educated and not have to spend money travelling to the downtown. The group is maD. up of 8 people. They are 8 women who have their activities, but who need some help to improve a little. They decided to call themselves "Campanita D. Oro" because they think that it brings good luck to their businesses and is good for the group in general. The names of the group members are the following: 

1.-Florenacia D. L. C. G.,  48 years old.  
2.-Claudia E. G., 23 years old.
3.-Ma Benita Catarina B., 45 years old.
4.-Delfina M. F., 32 years old. 
5.-Gregoria S. C., 56 years old. 
6.-Heriberta M. E., 32 years old.
7.-Lucia S. A., 25 years old. 
8.-Juana A. T., 58 years old. 

The group representative is named Heriberta. She is a neighbor of all of the members and she has known them for several years, and she gets along well with them. She has 4 children and they all go to school. She has been married for 10 years. She lives in her own house with her husband, who works as a bricklayer and carpenter. Heriberta has a small locale in her house where she sells beverages, water and chips. She needs more things so that things can improve for her a little. She needs an investment to buy other things as well that her store needs, such as: eggs and ham, which sell well, because they are far from town and a lot of people need them. Also, sausages and chorizo as well as dairy products. In short, she needs a lot of things that she wants to sell but she lacks the money to sell all of it. One of her goals is for the business to grow and little by little to have a large store in the community, in order to improve the quality of life in her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: La Piramide De San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Leonardo, es socio del grupo “L. PirámiD. D. San Judas Tadeo” que tiene casi un año D. formado, integrado por 8 socios muy trabajadores y emprendedores.
El  Sr. Leonardo tiene 60 años D. edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo uno está a su cargo por ser menor D. edad, vive en L. tercera zona D. Collique en el distrito D. Comas. Hace cinco años inició una bodega con tan solo una pequeña vitrina D. golosinas, poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha ido creciendo, incrementando su stock y mejorando su infraestructura.
Una D. sus metas es implementar una librería en otro local ubicado en su casa, y así apoyar a una D. sus hijas brindándole un negocio en el que pueda trabajar.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en L. compra D. golosinas y bebidas.
texts.en:
Sr. Leonardo is a member of the group “L. PirámiD. D. San Judas Tadeo” (The Pyramid of San Judas Tadeo), which has been in existence for almost a year. The group consists of eight hardworking and enterprising members.

Sr. Leonardo is 60 years old, married, and has five children, but only one is still in his care since he is a minor. He lives in the third ward of Collique in the District of Comas. Leonardo opened a store five years ago with only a small display case full of candy. Gradually over time and with great effort, he worked to grow his business, increase his inventory, and improve his infrastructure.

One of his goals is to open a bookstore in another part of his house. This venture will help one of his daughters and proviD. her with a business in which she can work.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of candy and beverages.

loans.use: To purchase candy and beverages.

loans.name: Las Creativas Group

texts.es:
Ana Maria es tesorera del grupo comunal "Las Creativas".
Ana Maria madre soltera con un hijo en edad escolar.
Ana Maria se dedica a las manualidades, ha diversificado su negocio y confecciona: manteles bordados, cuadros, flores artificiales, entre otras cosas. Adicionalmente a esto, ella enseña a otras señoras el arte D. bordar y hacer manualidades; D. este modo tambien sus alumnas puedan progresar creando sus propios negocios y tener sus propios ingresos.
El prestamo que solicito es para poder adquirir nuevos hilos para bordar los pedidos que tiene pendientes por entregar.
(En la fotografìa Ana Maria viste casaca D. jeans azul y esta en la parte D. adelante)
(*)El socio Telesforo A. M. no se encontraba presente en la fotografìa por motivo D. viaje; en su representaciòn estuvo su esposa, quièn esta sentada y es la primera D. la izquierda, viste casaca color negro.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is the treasurer of the "Las Creativas" communal bank. She is a single mother with one school-aged son. She works making handicrafts and has begun making a wider variety of products. These incluD.: embroidered cloths, pictures and artificial flowers, among other things. Additionally, she teaches other women the art of embroidery and handicrafts. Her students are then able to start their own businesses and earn a living for themselves.

Ana Maria has requested this loan in order to purchase new embroidery thread. This will allow her to fill some outstanding orders. 

(Ana Maria appears in the foreground of the photo, wearing blue jeans).
(*) Communal bank member, Telesforo A. M., was not present for the photo because he was away on a trip. His wife stood in for him. She is the first person to the left in the photo. She is seated and is dressed in black.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery thread.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Virginie est née en 1986 à Dogbo (au Mono) et est marié à un revendeur du nom de Chadas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Il y a environs sept ans que la famille s’est installée à Cocotomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Virginie vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis cinq ans, Virginie mène comme activité la vente de seaux, de glacières et divers autres ustensiles de cuisine en plastique à Cocotomey. Par contre Virginie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Virginie sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Virginie was born in 1986 in Dogbo (in Mono). She is married to a wholesaler by the name of Chadas. They have two dependent children in school. About seven years ago, the family settled in Cocotomey, in the community of Abomey Calavi. Virginie helps her husband provide for different family expenses. Since about five years ago, Virginie sells buckets, ice chests and other plastic household goods in Cocotomey. She stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. This is the third time that Virginie is seeking a loan from ALIDé, which will allow her to expand the scope of her business and better respond to her customers’ needs. The prior loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy two dozens of various plastic goods and half a dozen ice chests

loans.name: Qakhraman

texts.en:
Qakhraman has always been hardworking man who has made sure from a young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with four children. 

He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $200, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Qakhraman began this enterprise many years ago. Over time, he expanded his business and today, his whole family is engaged in the business. 

Today, Qakhraman needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods he sells. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1,300 Azerbaijani new manat. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: La Union Es Progreso Group

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia Margarita D. 56 años D. edad, es socia D. la Alcancía comunal La Unión Es Progreso, Ella es una madre soltera que tiene dos hijos el hijo mayor tiene un  trabajo independiente, el hijo menor cursa en el colegio del estado. La socia se levanta a tempranas horas D. la mañana para que pueda preparar el desayuno para sus hijos y enviarle al colegio, la socia tiene una bodega comercial quien  se dedica todo el día en la venta D. verduras, condimentos, carnes y otros. Solicito el préstamo para que pueda incrementar y surtir sus productos. 
Préstamo es D. s/. 1000.00 Nuevo Soles.
texts.en: Ofelia Margarita is 56 years old. She is a member of the La Unión es Progreso communal bank. She is a single mother and she has two children. The older son works independently and the younger son is studying at a state school. Ofelia wakes up early in order to prepare breakfast for her children and send them off for the day. She has a store where she sells vegetables, condiments, meats and other products all day. She is requesting a loan in order to increase and stock up on her products. The loan is for 1000.000 Nuevos Soles.

loans.use: to sell grocery and other products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married to a farmer with four school age children.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to local neighbors.  She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for sale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for sale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has operated a tailoring business for over 10 years, and she works 1 day every week. Harriet sells her products wholesale, in a shop. She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of material for uniforms. Harriet generates additional income through farming. Harriet's main business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. Her business goal is to own at least 4 electric sewing machines. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of material for uniforms

loans.name: San Miguel Arcángel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel Arcangel es de ciudad de San Ignacio. Todas las integrantes del grupo son conocidas, vecina del lugar. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
El deseo de ellas es que todas las integrantes cuenten con una actividad y tengan ingresos para el buen cumplimiento de sus obligaciones y logros de los objetivos del grupo.
La Sra. Librada se dedica a la venta de ropas. Ella se dedica a esto hace ya unos años, gracias a esto ha podido formar una clientela bien definida. Todos los vecinos siempre compran los productos de ella ya que trae mercaderías muy lindas. Su sueño es poder, algún día, tener un local donde ofrecer sus ropas.
Ella solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su puesto de ropas, ya que trayendo mas variedad de ropas atraerá a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Arcángel Committee is from the city of San Ignacio.  All of the group's members are local women who are known in the community.  The goal of each one of them is to work as a team, to promote the spirit of solidarity, and to reach the program's highest level.  They want all of the members to have a business and the income necessary to fulfill their obligations and to achieve the group's goals.  

Librada sells clothing.  She has done this for a few years now, which has enabled her to build a solid clientele.  All of her neighbors always buy her products because she has very nice merchandise.  Her dream is to one day have a store to sell her clothing.  She is asking for a loan to stock her clothing stand, since offering a wider variety of clothing will attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells detergents, snacks & noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Rosalina has a business selling snacks in the community such as hotcakes, banana cue (fried caramelized banana) and other items. She earns about 2,500 PHP each month. Rosalina has been a PMPC member for a month.

Rosalina is requesting a loan to purchase additional raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar, and oil, to use to cook snacks. In the future, she would like to have better living conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare and sell snacks

loans.name: Ibrahim Kebbay

texts.en:
This is 47 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married to a nursing aid worker, and has 5 children aged 2, 7, 10, 15 and 18.   In 2001, Ibrahim established his business selling provisions such as mayonnaise, milk, sardines, margarine, black mint etc.  He serves people around the city and in the surrounding villages. He began his business because needed a reliable source of income to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 each month. 

Ibrahim would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more mayonnaise, milk, sardines, margarine and black mint to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to open a bigger shop.  By accessing more loans, he will be able to buy more stock and help his young children with their education. The rainy season and rise in transport costs are his biggest challenges.  Competition is high but he treats his customers well, and so his business is popular.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, milk, sardines, margarine and black mint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chocolate and corn to continue making candies and tamales

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Rosalie has a shop that provides motor tire repairs & air for tires. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools for motor repairs & to pay electricity & water bills for maintenance tasks.
Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for motor repairs & to pay utility bills

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and blessed with four children. She lives with her family in a village. She generates income through vegetable production and sales. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save for the future of her children.

She planted different vegetables to have various kinds to sell and to increase her production. But due to inadequate capital, maintenance of the business is not possible, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to apply so that her plants will grow healthy and will bear more fruit to harvest. She believes that the loan will help her increase her yields and bring a more prosperous living for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, 51, is married and has five children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living, Carmen has owned and managed a sari-sari or "general store" for about two years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,400 doing this work.

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to to purchase additional products to sell.

Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Carmen hope to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: The Bridge Group

texts.en:
Pretty is a 37-year-old lady who is married and has four children, age 19, 14, 9 and 4. Three of the children go to school. Her husband is formally employed as a general manager. She has other three dependents who stay with her.

She sells chicken at her homestead. Currently she does not have any employee to assist her in running the business. Pretty has been in business for five years. 

The challenge she faces in the business is that some chickens die prematurely because of the outbreak of chicken diseases. She, however, has a vision of supplying chickens to supermarkets around town. In the next five years she would like to open a shop in town. 

The loan will improve the life of her family as she will be able to support his brother and her two sisters, whom she stays with.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en: Odonchimeg is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur and her two kids are in school. She started her grocery retail business earlier this year, and it is going so well that she decided to rent another counter in another market. She has already made arrangements for the new counter; however, she is lacking supplies to run the place. Therefore, she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My children are growing so fast, and I have to work hard in order to support them and get them to college. I don't want to live like I did."

loans.use: To buy more grocery products.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. 

She has been selling clothes for the last five years to support her family. Her potential customers are the local residents.  Sarah is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. 

In the next five years, she plans to become more financially stable. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya, for she has been able to access a loan, which she used for paying the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Huruma C Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of the Huruma C group. Joseph and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Joseph was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Huruma C group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married and has 11 children. She resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Vilma operates a fishing business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and earns 3,000 per month.

She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Vilma is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Vilma wants to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Aflodice

texts.en:
Aflodice is 29 years old and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 4 years old. Aflodice sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, water, juice, etc. His business is well organized. He works from 6 am until 8 pm every day and has four years of experience in this business.

Aflodice has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase soap, water, juice, rice, sugar and so on to sell. With the profits from the loan, Aflodice will be able to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, water, juice, rice, sugar,etc to sell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 45 years old and married with four children.  She is from Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  Benedicta owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members.  She has been in the business for one year and earns 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2011, Benedicta joined Kiva partner GDMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She requests a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories for her transportation business.  Benedicta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her transportation business.

loans.name: Asitu

texts.en: Asitu sells cooking oil at Abura. She is married. Asitu has been selling footwear for three years now.  She uses her income to help her husband pay   their accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase gallons of cooking oil to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase motor bike and sewing supplies

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jafar is the resident of Beylagan town and one of the best clients of Normicro Beylagan branch. Before he was earning his living selling audio cassettes in the street. His first loan was in amount of 300$. In 2005 he built a small shop and started the trade of audio and video materials. Now he expanded his business and started selling audio and video appliances. Now he needs $1200 to expand the business in this direction.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S. is seeking a loan to buy wood and cement for the construction of his new home.  He lives in Phnom Penh and works as a mototaxi driver and earns $5/day.  His wife (pictured here), Hak Sopha is 43 and sells shoes at the local market, earning $4 profit/day.  They have 3 children and 1 nephew who also lives with them, and they are now seeking better housing for their family.  The new home will also be used as a small grocery shop, and should generate enough income to continue sending their children to school.

loans.use: To buy wood and cement to build a home.

loans.name: Cacilda Jaime

texts.pt:
Cacilda Jaime F., 59 years old, single, mother of 10 children, native of Moamba, Maputo Province, grew up with her mother, and lost her father when she was 9. The family's financial situation created few opportunities for her to study. Since she was 20, she has taken on the management of the family business and has a small store. Starting in 2006, through her neighbors, she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema, and requested a loan to increase the volume of merchandise.

Since then, her business has grown, and currently she does a good business and provides jobs to two people, including herself. With the earnings from her business, she supports her family responsibilities. She would like to expand her store to improve storage of her products.

With a loan of 15,500 meticais, she plans to increase the volume of business in order to respond to her customers' needs, since demand has been increasing.

Her business has a larger impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for herself and another perosn, she brings the products closer to her customers.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Km 16-Boane CLIENTE: Cacilda Jaime F. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 15.500,00 MT (620.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos para revenda INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/07/2008 Cacilda Jaime F. de 59 anos de idade, solteira, mae de 10 filhos, natural de Moamba, Provincia de Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade sa sua Mae, perdeu o seu Pai quando tinta 9 anos de idade, a situacao financeira da familia lhe criou poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde os seus 20 anos de idade vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia e possui um pequeno estabelecimento Comercial. A partir do ano 2006, por indicacao de vizinhos teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku Adsema, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para aumentar o volume da mercadoria. Desde entao, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica, actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para duas pessoas, incluindo a propria, com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares ampliacao do estabelecimento comercial para melhor armazenamento dos seus produtos. Com o emprestimo de 15.500,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume do negocio de forma a responder as necessidades dos clientes, pois a procura tem sido cada vez maior. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ela propria e outra pessoa, coloca o produto mais perto dos clientes.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mr. Chuon S. is 23 years old and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support his household, he works near a market driving a trailer (a motorcycle with a trailer attached) to transport passengers and goods. He earns around $3 each day. His wife breeds pigs to supplement their income.

This couple hopes to use this loan buy a motorcycle for the transportation business, and to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to transport passengers and goods.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with 4 children of her own. In addition, she cares for 1 orphan. For the past three years, Betty has owned a retail shop in Kayunga. She offers affordable prices for household items, including clothes. She also offers foodstuffs such as sugar, soap, and cooking oil in large quantities. Her business has expanded greatly. She is very hard working and she eventually would like to build another commercial building and get some rental income.
With her loan she plans to buy sugar, soap, clothes, and cooking oil in larger quantities to reduce the cost of transport.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell wholesale

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf K. is a 45-year-old man living with his wife and their three children in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He works at a fueling station (pictured). His family is very poor, but he and his wife have been able to give all of their children a good education because they work so hard. He engaged in sheep-breeding in his houseyard as most people do in the Azeri countryside. He wants to increase the number of his sheep, and thus increase his family income. For this purpose, Yusuf applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $400.

loans.use: To increase his family income by increasing the number of sheep.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Gilda A. is a 46-year-old woman whose estranged husband lives in Spain. Five months ago, her daughter also left for Spain to join her father, who got her a job there.

Once on her own, she decided to set up a door to door apparel business with her savings. She has received several loans from Fundación Paraguaya to buy merchandise—such as cellular phones, blenders, hair dryers, apparel, etc.—for home solicitation sales.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of seasonal apparel such as T-shirts, shirts, skirts, pants, shorts, Capri pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Gilda tiene 46 años, está separada de su marido que reside en España. Su hija también viajó hace 5 meses aproximadamente junto al padre, quien le consiguió un trabajo.

Al quedarse sola ella decidió montar un negocio de venta de ropas a domicilio, juntando un poco de dinero. Ya ha recibido varios créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de las mercaderías como ser celulares, licuadoras, secadores de pelo, ropas, etc. que vende a domicilio.

El crédito que solicita ahora es para invertirlo en la compra de ropas de temporada como remeras, camisas, faldas, pantalones, shorts, bermudas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of apparel such as T-shirts, shirts, skirts, pants, shorts, Capri pants, etc.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José B. A. is a single gentleman, whose business is to sell beef at his place of residence in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua.

He has stood out for the last 19 years for having the ability to succeed in this business. He says he has enjoyed selling beef since he was very young since he was brought up by his father in the countryside; that is how he started his business. These days, his main need is to purchase beef.

In order to better his family's financial situation, Mr. Juan José has worked with CEPRODEL for the last year. He feels very satisfied with the loans that have been granted since they have been extended at opportune moments; they have helped him meet the needs of his business and satisfy customers on a daily basis. He has a record of 3 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan José B. A. es un caballero soltero, el negocio al que se dedica es al destace de res en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega de Nicaragua.

Desde hace 19 años se ha destacado por tener la habilidad de realizar este negocio y nos cuenta que desde muy joven siempre le gusto la venta de carne de res, ya que él se había criado con su papá en el campo y de esta manera comenzó este negocio. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la compra de las reses.

Para poder mejorar la situación económica de su familia y negocio el señor Juan José trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. El tiene un record de 3 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase beef

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena lives in the town of Mikhailovka with her grown daughter, Angela. She has had a small retail business for about eight years and is in the process of expanding it. Yelena sells a variety of clothing and Ukrainian style rubber galoshes in the local market. By offering a range of clothing items, she provides a convenient stop for her customers who often will buy more than just one item from her. Her normal monthly profit is about $800.

Yelena has requested a loan of $1200 to increase her working capital and help sustain her business. Purchasing inventory from wholesalers has required a substantial investment from Yelena which is why she decided to obtain a loan. This loan will give her added flexibility and will help cover some of her growing expenses while she develops a larger business. Additional profits generated by her business will provide her with stable income and the ability to support her family financially.

loans.use: To sustain her clothing and shoe business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam F. is 43 years old and is a married woman with 10 children between the ages of 10 and 30 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 30 years old. Mariam F. has been a clothes seller since 2007, and she works every day from 10 am to 6 pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ndimyake

texts.en:
Ndimyake is married with 2 children, ages 9 and 3 years old. Ndimyake is a chicken keeper; she started in 2005. Every day she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a dedicated tinsmith and painter. He decided to start his business because he is the main provider and his main need is to sustain his family. He began in 2004, by renting a small lot where he built his shop. He is the father of 4 children ages 15, 12, 10, and 8 years old. His wife doesn't work, she is a housekeeper.

He is applying for a $250 US loan which he will pay back in 6 months. He wants to buy a pressurized paint gun for a new application material. Your support will help him to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio se dedica al oficio de hojalatero y pintor, decidio emprender su negocio ya que es padre de familia y su principal necesidad era mantener a su famila. Comenzó en el año 2004, rentando un pequeño terreno y puso ahí su taller. El es padre de 4 hijos de 15,12, 10 y 8 años, y su esposa no trabaja se dedica al hogar.

El solicita un credito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una pistola de presion para un nuevo material de aplicación. con tu apoyo su negocio seguira creciendo.

loans.use: Buying a pressurized spray paint gun for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beauty products and clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio is married and has 3 kids, one is 17 years old, and his two daughters are 12 and 14. He works creating ropes since he was a child because it has been the family business. Now he has his own family and because he needs more income, he decided to work independently and started his own business to manufacture ropes 30 years ago.

He needs a loan of $250 that he will pay in 3 months to buy material and be able to manufacture more ropes and supply more clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Demetrio es casado tiene 3 hijos, uno de 17, y dos niñas de 12 y 14 años. Se dedica a la elaboración de sogas desde muy pequeño ya que este siempre ha sido el negocio de la familia, ahora que el tiene su propia familia y ante la necesidad de tener mas ingresos, decidió independizarse y poner su propio negocio de elaboración de sogas desde hace mas de 30 años.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses par comprar material y asi poder fabricar mas sogas y abastecer mas comercios.

loans.use: To buy work material / comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 35-years-old, is married and has five children. She has been selling clothes and bites since 2004. Farida works from 8AM to 6PM every day, and can earn a monthly profit of $250 from her sales.

Farida has taken out one successful loan to expand her business and now hopes for another loan to buy more clothes to further expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ahonsou

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, monsieur Ahonsou D. est né le 16 Avril 1969 à Accra au Ghana. Il est menuisier de formation. Sa femme est une ménagère. Donc il est seul à faire face aux charges de la famille. Malgré ses efforts il n’arrive pas à sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir des outils de travail pour devenir indépendant. Actuellement il travaille avec un autre menuisier. Ce crédit lui permettra de disposer de ses propres outils de travail.
texts.en:
Married and the father of 3 children, Mr. Ahonsou Danklo was born on April 16, 1969 in Accra in Ghana. He is a trained carpenter. His wife is a housewife, so he is the only breadwinner for the family. In spite of his best efforts, he has not been able to escape the vicious circle of poverty. He is requesting this loan to acquire tools so as to become independent. Right now he is working with another carpenter. This loan will allow him to have his very own tools at his disposal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of the materials he needs to work independently

loans.name: Oit

texts.en:
Oit D. is 45 years old and has bred pigs for sale since 2000, earning about $3.20 per day. Oit is married to Mr. Ul Bun, 46, a rice farmer and mill owner offering grinding services. They have five children, one of whom works in a shopping center earning around $110 per month and helping to support the family.

To increase income, Oit is requesting a loan to purchase both pig feed and more pigs to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to breed as will as pig food.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.en:
Gulrukhsor S. is a widow and has one child. She has a business selling children's clothing items in the central market of Dushanbe. She offers a big assortment of inventory and has a flexible discount system for her loyal customers. Gulrukhsor’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 10 years. Gulrukhsor is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. 
Today, Gulrukhsor is requesting a loan of 3300 Somoni ($975 USD) to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can support herself and her dearest son. She promises that she will repay the loan within 12 months. Gulrukhsor feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her son can stay in school and have a bright future. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: Increasing of working capital with the purpose of development of business.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
M. is married with six children (two of whom are below fifteen) and lives in Sisia III, Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. M. runs a small tailoring workshop with her husband in the Nkwen market. With this loan, she plans to buy more material for sewing. She also plans to do marking (embroidery) of dresses and clothing. Her business plan shows she will invest 10,000 CFA (approximately $20 USD) of her own savings as well.  
 
This will be M.'s third loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2006. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices. She buys in bulk which causes the price to be minimal and sews things herself with the help of her husband. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
Part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of M.'s children. And the other part will be used for medication and food for her large family. M. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments, every two weeks.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying of material, sewing, and marking (embroidery) supplies

loans.name: Kausachun Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa “Que Viva” en quechua, es un Banco que inicia su 41 ciclo con 27 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta cereales, abarrotes en general, comida, frutas, fabricación D. ladrillos, leña, quesos, ferretería.
Las socias tienen diferentes historias es el caso D. Maria que es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Marina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes y artículos D. ferretería, también viaja a L. selva ayacuchana en donD. venD. por mayor los mismos productos, Marina necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que invertirá en L. compra D. clavos D. diferentes tamaños.
Por otro lado Herlinda es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Herlinda vive en L. comunidad D. Compañía en donD. tiene una tienda, venD. verduras, abarrotes, carnes. Herlinda necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Mientras que Herlinda es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Herlinda tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, Herlinda necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. gaseosas, arroz. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 750 soles y 1050 soles, haciendo un total D. 14,250 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.
Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz,  fideo, carne, verduras, trigo, cebada, leña, leche, clavos, medicina.
Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, incrementar sus negocios, ahorrar mucho y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Kausachun" which means "Que Viva" [To Live] in quechua, is a bank that is beginning its 41st cycle with 27 members. The members work in different businesses, such as selling cereals, groceries in general, food, fruit, making bricks, firewood, cheeses, and hardware stores. The members all have different stories. In Maria's case, she is married, is 44 years old and has 5 children. Marina has a store in her house where she sells groceries and hardware items. She also travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells primarily the same products. Marina needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she will invest in buying nails of different sizes. On the other hand, Herlinda has a live-in partner, is 24 years old, and has 2 children. Herlinda lives in the community "Compañía" where she has a store and sells vegetables, groceries, and meats. Herlinda needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she will invest in buying rice, sugar, and noodles. While Herlinda has a live-in partner, is 36 years old, has 3 children, and has a grocery store in her home, she needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will invest in buying sodas and rice. The members all need loans of different amounts. Some loans are for 300 soles, 450 soles, 750 soles or 1050 soles, totaling to 14,250 soles of loans for the community bank. The loans will be used to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, meat, vegetables, wheat, barley, firewood, milk, nails, and medicine. The dreams of the members are that their children will get a good education, expand their businesses, save a lot of money, and have their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, meat, vegetables, wheat, barley, firewood, milk, nails, and medicine

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland I. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. His wife sells fruits such as oranges, pineapples and apples. Roland has a shop where he sells and rent out CD’s and VCD’s. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.
