He is requesting for a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more CD’s and VCD’s to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more CD’s and VCD’s to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling shoes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has two children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her shoe business and pay for her children's school.

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es:
la Sra. C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia que esta ubicada en la comunidad de los Trozos, ella desde que puso su propio negocio ha crecido mucho y le ha ayudado con los gastos del hogar es muy notable que su negocio es muy bueno, la ventaja de ella es que esta ubicado en una zona en donde son muy pocas las pulperias entonces ella no tiene mucha competencia y ahi es donde esta el secreto de este negocio.  la zona en donde ella vive es una zona de muy pocos recursos economicos la mayoria de la poblacion es gente muy pobre, por lo tanto ella tiene que vender su producto a precios muy bajos para poder tener varias ventas.
su esposo se dedica a hacer viajes o transportar cargas con un carro paila que tiene y eso le deja una buena cantidad de dinero para sostener a la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. C. sells popular consumable goods. She has a small grocery store that is located in the neighbourhood of Trozos. Since she established her own business, it has grown also and has helped with the household expenses. It is very clear that her business is very good: her store is located in an area where there are very few grocery stores and as a result she doesn't have much competition and this is the her business' secret. The area where she lives is an area with very few economic resources and the majority of the population are very poor people, which means that she has to sell her products at very low prices in order to make sufficient sales. Her husband also makes journeys or transports cargo with in a pick-up truck he owns and this provides a good amount of money with which sustain her family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase churros, eggs, soup, margarine, butter, beans,rice, sugar, coffee, biscuits, salt etc.

loans.name: Ramadane

texts.en:
Ramadane is a 45-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their one child. Ramadane has owned a home-products shop for the last five years, and is applying for a $1,500 loan to buy a new washing machine for his company. This is the second loan he has requested from us, and he has always made payments on time. 

His clients are people from all over the region region. When Ramadane first started his business, things went smoothly because of his strong commitment to improve his financial situation and to start his own business. In the future, he plans on expanding his small company.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for his business.

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en:
Theodora Y. is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with three children - two boys and a girl. They are currently pursuing education in primary school. Theodora’s husband works with a mining company. She lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities.

Theodora trades in textiles and secondhand clothes. She buys textiles and all kinds of secondhand clothes, most especially skirts and ladies slippers and shoes, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she has a small shed from which she sells. She has been in business for three years.

Theodora wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and shoes. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and, eventually, make very good profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and shoes for her business

loans.name: Zaida Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. ZAIDA, ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años un hijo de 8 años de edad y ella es madre soltera, alternas sus actividades del hogar y de madre, con el comercio minorista en cuanto a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogos, ella solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en la compra de mas productos de belleza y así ubicarlos en la tienda de una amiga para la venta al público en general.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y de la misma manera se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida lives in the San Jerónimo District, thirty minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 32 years old and has an 8 year old son. She is a single mother and takes care of both the home and her responsibilities as a mother. She has a retail business selling cosmetics through catalog orders. She applied for this loan so she can purchase extra cosmetics to sell in her friend's shop. Mrs. Zaida is grateful for the loan, and she promises to pay it off according to the agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetics from catalogs

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a member of the Immaculada Concepcion Village Bank and lives in the small Peruvian jungle town of Pilcopata. She is 36 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Two of her children are adolescents, while the youngest is just a year and a half old. Maria Mercedes works on her family farm, where she has been growing yucca and bananas for the past eight or nine years. After harvesting the crops, she sells them at the local market. Though Pilcopata is a very small town and consists of little more than a few blocks of houses and stores along a dirt road, its market is quite new and modern. Pilcopata receives a lot of traffic, since all travelers coming to surrounding towns come into Pilcopata first by bus. 

Maria Mercedes is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. She will use most of the loan money to pay her field hands. She usually employs two to three people during harvest time, and pays each worker 25 soles per day. Part of the money will also go towards her household expenses, and another part will be used to buy wood. She has pledged to repay this loan on time and in full. 

Maria Mercedes has been a member of her village bank ever since it was founded several years ago. Her goal for the future is to open a big store in Cusco and move to the city.

loans.use: Pay field hands, buy wood, cover household expenses

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
N. Phally, 38, has been involved in a grocery business for nine years in PhN. Penh City, with an income of $10 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, with a daily income of $5, who usually stays at a nearby market to provide transportation services to his customers. Together they have three children: two of them are at school, and another one is a phone repairman.

Phally is really satisfied with her grocery business because she can earn a fair income to make a good living. So she has made up her mind to borrow $1,000 from Kiva to expand her inventory of goods in her grocery business. She hopes her two children will be able to finish their high school and study at a good university.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah, a mother of a 6-year-old girl, is the owner of a small salon that she has been running for more than four years.  A year and a half ago, she relocated the salon to the Kibuye market in Kisumu because she realized that she could charge higher prices there.  Her salon specializes in hair and nails, but also offers clothes and shoes for sale.  She is hoping to purchase more hair pieces, nail polishes, and a large hair dryer.  She has tried to make it with as little inventory as possible, but she has found that her polishes dry out over time and her various chemicals expire.  Her dream is to grow her business to the point where she can purchase more expensive and higher-quality items from Uganda and Nairobi.

loans.use: Wigs, Nail Polishes, Hair Dryer

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
With the hope of improving her family’s standard of living, Nargiza entered the sphere of commerce four years ago. She sells children's clothing in the local market of Dj.Rasulov district. With the profits from her business, Nargiza not only supports her family of four, but also her retired parents. She is lively and cheerful, hard-working and committed to the success of her business and the welfare of her family. Nargiza is requesting a loan of 3000 TJS to purchase inventory for the summer season. She hopes to continue to develop her business and successfully support her family.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase garments to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El señor Pascual M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Guadalupe Condori y sus dos hijos.
El señor Pascual es rentista del magisterio, ingresos mantienen a su familia.
Con anteriores créditos el señor Pascual realizó la construcción de obra gruesa de dos habitaciones que le dará la posibilidad de darles espacio a sus hijos que van creciendo.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de la obra fina de dos habitaciones.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Pascual M. lives in his own home, in the Pasankeri area, west from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Mrs. Guadalupe Condori and two children. Mr. Pascual is retired from the teaching profession and his income supports his entire family. With previous loans, Mr. Pascual was able to complete the rough construction of two rooms, which will provide additional living space for his growing children. The requested loan is for the finish work of these two rooms. This is the fifth time that he has applied for a loan. The socioeconomic research has qualified him, favorably, for access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish work on the construction of two rooms to better accommodate his children.

loans.name: Rosalina Alejandra

texts.es: Rosalina Alejandra L. tiene 52 años. Es una mujer muy responsable tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque su hijo mayor le ayudo para que comprara ciertos productos como calzado y telas y al ver que obtenía suficiente ganancias con esta actividad decide seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos como sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatillas y telas. El sueño de Rosalina es seguirle proporcionado mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosalina Alejandra López is 52. She is a very responsible woman, and she has three independent children. She has been selling general merchandise for over five years. She started the business because her oldest son helped her buy certain products like footwear and material. Upon seeing that she got enough income from this activity, she decided to keep going. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy products like sandals, athletic shoes, shoes, and fabric. Rosalina’s dream is to keep making improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 55 years old and married to Reynaldo, a carpenter and also a farmer in their village. Anita operates a small store in the village. Her desire to improve her store motivated her to request a loan of 9,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase different grocery items for her store.

Anita is hoping to improve her store to assist her husband in sending their children to school. They have four children: Rey Ann, Allan, Michael, and Daniel.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Zenzontle está formado por Elba Rosa Sandoval de 43 años de edad, quien es la coordinadora del grupo; María Teresa L. de 56 años; Milagros F. H. de 45 años y Alma C. L. de 37 años. Todas provenientes de la ciudad de Masaya, del barrio San Jerónimo.

Doña Elba posee una pulpería, la cual ha podido forjar gracias a los créditos que ha tenido con ADIM, es su noveno ciclo de crédito y se siente muy agradecida ya que gracias al negocio que ha podido edificar, tiene la esperanza de terminar de educar a su hijo de 16 años, a quien quiere darle un futuro mejor.

Maria L. trabaja en la Venta de Frutas y comida en su casa de habitación; Milagros F. trabaja en la venta de productos artesanos como los son hamacas y Alma C. trabaja en la compra/venta de pan.

loans.use: Invertir en el crecimiento

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Martín" esta representado por el señor Luis Fernando y conformado por 13 miembros de bajos ingresos muy trabajadoras y con expectativas de lograr mas ingresos. Las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo conociéndose en sus actividades comerciales y como vecinas del barrio. Desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como tienda de abarrotes, venta de pan, pastillas, celulares, zapatos, cosméticos  y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir ya sea en puestos fijos o ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes las socias tienen la facilidad de mover sus puestos y diversificar su mercadería para poder obtener así un ingreso diario para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para invertir en mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar los ingresos diarios como por ejemplo la adquisición de un maquina de coser eléctrica que ayudaría mucho a doña Silvia para entregar trabajos mas rápidos y mejorar cada día mas los ingresos para sustentar a sus hijos y poderles dar todo lo que ella siempre soñó, una mejor educación y un futuro mejor para toda su familia. En cuanto a sus experiencias crediticias las socias van cursando ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando represents the San Martin Group. The group is comprised of 13 members with low incomes. They are very hard-working and have the expectation of achieving more income. The women have had a friendship for a long time; they know each other through their businesses and as neighbors. They work in different types of commercial activities like a grocery store, selling bread, cakes, cell phones, shoes, cosmetics, and making articles of clothing. Some have fixed stands and others are street vendors. If they have competitors, the members have the ability to move their stands and to diversity their merchandise to be able to get a daily income to support their families. The loan is to buy merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them improve their daily income. For example, getting an electric sewing machine would really help Silvie to deliver her work more quickly. This would improve her daily income to support her children. She would be able to give them everything she always dreamed about, a better education and a better future for the whole family. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are in their fourth cycle. They show a great desire to keep growing, honesty, and responsibility in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam M.  is from the village of Butuay. She is 50 years old. Meriam is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Meriam joined PMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and be used as working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Meriam from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma S. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 55 years old. Norma is married and has 4 adult children. Norma owns a business buying and selling coconuts.  Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $171 US) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora T. is a 53-year-old businesswoman from Binondo, Manila.  She got into business many years ago.  She manages her own sari-sari (general) store.  She also maintains a coin-operated video-karaoke machine.  She earns a total net income of more than P11,000.00 a month from these business activities.  She saves most of her profits so she has something to pull out of her pocket in times of emergencies.
 
She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  Teodora applied for a new loan of P12,000.00 as additional capital for her businesses.  She is due to purchase more grocery items for her general store.  Her video-karaoke machine also needs preventive maintenance.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell and to maintain her video-karaoke machine

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence is 34 years old, married with three children, aged 4, 9, and 10 years and she takes care of five dependents from another family. Some of her children and dependents are of school-going age. Esperence and her family live in Kicukiro, a district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Esperence has owned a restaurant for the past three years. She employs 5 people and the working hours are from early in the morning until the last customer leaves.

Esperence is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs for cooking in her restaurant so that she can satisfy her customers since they keep increasing day by day. With this loan, Esperence will also buy some additional equipment and paint the walls of her restaurant so that the area of her business may look smart as well as attracting many customers.

Esperence hopes that if this strategy is successful, she will earn more profit. Esperence will save a portion of any profit earned, since a major goal for her is to pay school fees and provide more food for her children. In addition, she will build a secure financial future for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs and equipment

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 26-year-old married woman who lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She has two children, the older of which is seven. She makes a living as a rice farmer, and works hand-in-hand with her husband. She also raises chickens to earn a little extra money, always making sure to manage her time well so that she can spend time with her family. She is committed to improving her family’s living conditions.

Mary Ann is a member of CEVI and is an active participant at our meetings. She has applied for a loan for PHP 12,000 to invest in her farm by buying seeds, fertilizers and other items she needs to grow a large and healthy crop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a rice farm

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 69 years old and lives on Talim Island, Binangonan, in the attractive province of Rizal. She is married to Sopronio, a 66-year-old kaing-maker (a kaing is a small bamboo basket) and a supportive husband. She and her husband have eight children. The couple is working hard to raise their big family. 

In 2006, Amalia joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a micro-finance institution and Kiva field partner in the Philippines. Amalia makes and sells kaing products and has been in business for more than fifteen years.

Amalia believes that her proposed loan of Php 25,000 will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loan funds to buy bamboo, bamboo strips and other supplies. She also plans to start a fishing business for additional income.

Amalia dreams of sending her children to school and hopes they will complete a degree in college. She believes her big family needs support from ASHI-Kiva so that they can improve their standard of living and build a beautiful house for her family to live in.

Amelia is a positive and optimistic mother who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams. The couple is still dreaming of the best in life and is a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase of bamboo, bamboo strips and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings.

After finishing his education in 2007, Youssef decided to work as a floor layer. During his two years of working in this market, he has been able to obtain good experience and has a growing number of clients. This job helps in ameliorating his economic situation.

Today, Youssef is requesting to borrow $700 to buy a special tile cutter and shears specific for his job. This will enable him to expand his business and be able to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy a tile cutter and shears for his business

loans.name: Miguel Wilfrido

texts.es:
Miguel Wilfrido M. G. tiene 66 años, es casado y se dedica a la agricultura.  Vive con su esposa y 4 hijos.  Tiene 6 hijos en total, 2 de ellos están trabajando en Quito.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Miguel siembra maiz y papas en grandes cantidades y tiene otros cultivos que crece solo para consumir.  Tiene una casa propia y 2 cuadras y media de terreno en las que siembra sus cultivos.  Vende todos sus productos en las ferias en la ciudad de San Miguel.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas.

Su esperanza en la vida es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, pero no siempre es posible por la situación económica.  Los jovenes a veces tienen que ausentarse para trabajar y ayudar a sus padres en la agricultura.

También Miguel es carpintero aparte de la agricultura.  Hace muebles y puertas para casas y le gusta mucho dedicarse a esta actividad.
texts.en:
Miguel Wilfrido M. G. is 66 and married. He is a farmer. He lives with his wife and four children. They have six children in all; two of them are working in Quito. He belongs to the San Jose de las Orquideas Communal Bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community’s residents are farmers who grow potatoes and corn as their primary crops. Miguel plants corn and potatoes in great quantity. He has other crops that grow solely for consumption. He has his own house and two and a half blocks of land where he plants his crops. He sells his products in the fairs in the city of San Miguel. He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies. His hope in life is that his children finish their education. But, that is not always possible because of the economic situation. Young people sometimes have to miss school in order to work and help their parents with the farming. Miguel is also a carpenter. He makes furniture and doors for houses, and he really likes this work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Irene es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Irene vende comida de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además Irene junto a su esposo tienen una renovadora de calzados.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que cera invertido en la compra de plantas de zapatos y tapillas.
Los sueños de Irene son mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She lives with her partner, is 37 and has 3 children. Irene sells food walking around the wholesale food market in the city, and also has a shoe repair business with her husband. Irene needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of shoe soles and heels. Irene's dreams are to improve her business and construct her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoe soles and heels.

loans.name: Bernarda Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Bernarda Guillermina tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres menores de edad, dos de los cuales están estudiando primaria y están a su cargo. La señora Bernarda es dueña de un negocio de venta de comida. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace tres años ante la necesidad de suplir las necesidades de su hogar, sin embargo ella tenía experiencia desde hace 26 años, ya que desde niña su mama le enseñaba que tenía que aprender a ganarse la vida y por ello las mandaba a las calles a vender tortillas y a veces pan. Ella está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de realizar inversión en granos básicos, ya que los precios cambian con mucha regularidad. Algo importante de mencionar, es que la señora ahora posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa, la cual le ha estado ayudando a mejorar sus ingresos. Doña Bernarda tiene el anhelo de ver a sus hijos graduarse de la universidad y que posean todos los estudios que ella nunca tuvo, por ello es que trabaja tan duramente para brindarles a ellos lo que su mama no pudo brindarle a ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bernarda Guillermina is 35 years old, married and has three young children, two of whom are in elementary school and whom she supports. Mrs. Bernarda owns a food business, which she started three years ago in order to help support her family. Even though the business is not very old, she has 26 years of experience selling food. Her mother taught her at a very young age that she had to learn to earn a living and would send her out to the street to sell tortillas and sometimes bread. She has asked for the loan in order to buy a large enough supply of staple grains to avoid the price fluctuations of these items. It is worth mentioning that she also owns a small general store at home, thanks to which her earnings have improved. Mrs. Bernarda hopes to give her children a university education, something she was not able to do. It is with that goal in mind that she works hard in order to provide them with opportunities her mother was never able to provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia I. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Arsenia is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Arsenia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arsenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arsenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chuk

texts.en: The man in the photo, Mr. Chuk S., 66, is a low-income person living in the province of Siem Reap, in Cambodia. He is a domestic fisherman who depends on fishing around the river. He has had this job for many years and typically earns US$ 3 per day. Chuk S. has another earner in his wife who sells a few groceries from home for a profit. The couple has four children; three of whom are single, while another one is married and ready started a new home. Chuk S. faces a small problem; he lacks accessories for fishing. Therefore, Chuk S. is applying for a loan to buy more fishing gear. With some of the loan, Chuk S. will buy grocery items for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fishing gear

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Née en 1950, G. Léonie vit depuis trente ans environs, au quartier Jéricho à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léonie est mère de six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés ; mais Léonie ne vit plus avec son mari. Léonie vit donc seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs charges. Léonie n’a pas été à l’école. Léonie vend des tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique à Jéricho et environs. Mais Léonie achète ses articles à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cette activité lui fait générer des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Léonie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien effectué les remboursements de crédits qu’elle avait obtenus. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Léonie sollicite à nouveau un prêt de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1950, Léonie Bnonlonfoun has lived in the Jericho quarter of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, for around thirty years. She has six children, some of whom attend school; however, she does not live with her husband, but rather looks after her children by herself. She never went to school, and now sells fabric and plastic cooking utensils in Jericho and the surrounding area. She sources these goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and this business enables her to generate revenues which go towards the cost of looking after her children. She has already received loans from ALIDé and has successfully repaid them. In the face of increasing demand from her customers, she is seeking a new loan to boost her stock and better satisfy their demands.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic cooking utensils and fabric

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin D. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Benjamin is single. To make a living, Benjamin raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale in the local community. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Benjamin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Benjamin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Afi Epouse Gbenyo

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce dans la restauration, en 2002 elle a ouvert son propre restaurant qu’elle a appelé « TERMINALIA », les entrants dans son activité de restauration sont épuisés raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  8 sacs de maïs, des tas de tubercules d’ignames  et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is in the catering business. In 2002 she opened her own restaurant that she called “Terminalia”. She has run out of the ingredients she uses in her catering activities. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES for the purchase of 8 bags of corn, piles of yam tubers and various other things.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, yams and others

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from the village of  Naawan Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a specialized retail store, generating revenue primarily from the sale of seafood products, including fish and shrimp. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. By now, she has already successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used for purchasing additional products for sale. Lolita is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of additional products for sale

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn S. is from the village of Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronelyn sells fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of RTW in the local community. Ronelyn has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Ronelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ronelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
       
About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have capital for her fish-selling and RTW retail businesses.

location.town: Liloy-Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Pablina cuenta con 39  años está casada con el señor  Maximino Benitez, poseen  tres hijos una nena en edad escolar y dos varones cursando el secundario.
La señora era vendedora de calzados en una tienda durante muchos años, su marido fue chófer de colectivos, la señora tuvo la idea de abrir su propio negocio con la ayuda de pequeños préstamos consiguió dedicarse a la venta de calzados, actualmente alquila tres salones comerciales con 4 empleados, cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes.
Le gustaría más adelante comprar para su propio local ya que  le va muy bien en las ventas y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad ya que ellos no pudieron por tener que trabajar desde jóvenes dedicarse al engorde de ganado.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de zapatos, zapatillas, calzados deportivos, y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Pablina is 39 years old and married to Sr. Maximino Benitez. They have three children, an infant daughter in nursery school and two sons in secondary school. Pablina has sold shoes from her own store for many years. Her husband was a union taxi driver. She came up with the idea of opening her own business and sought the help of small loans in order to continue selling shoes. She currently rents three commercial locations. Pablina has four employees and several good customers. She would like to get ahead by acquiring her own location. Her sales are doing very well. Pablina has also been raising livestock for fattening since her children were little so that they do not have to find work when they attend university. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, slippers, athletic footwear, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, slippers, athletic footwear, and other products

loans.name: Madine

texts.en:
Madine S. is a devoted mother of 2 children who has bred cattle since her youth. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Her clients are butchers and café owners.

Slowly her number of cows has increased and her clients have started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Tierras Duras del distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la ciudad de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina) el brinda su servicio en los diversos caseríos de la zona y depende de esta actividad para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su  mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para repararla y brindarle mantenimiento el ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona tranquila y responsable, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Santos is a 51 year old father who lives with his family in Tierras Duras hamlet, within the Olmos agricultural district; part of the city of Lambayeque, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years he has been providing transportation services for passengers and cargo in a "mototaxi." (a vehicle consisting of a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment added). He provides this service around the various hamlets within the zone and he depends on this activity for the financial support of his family. The continued use of his unit and the poor shape of the zone's roads have caused his mototaxi to begin to suffer a few faults that need urgent repair to ensure proper operation. In order to repair and maintain [his vehicle], he has seen fit to request a 1,000 PEN ($375) loan through Edpyme Alternativa. Santos is a responsible, calm person. His neighbors and acquaintances within his zone consider his as being trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Ms. Corazon L. is from the Barangay (village) of Mayor’s Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years of age and still single and is shown with her niece. Together with her mother as her business partner, Corazon is presently engaged in selling fried fish crackers: “chicharon” and “ampao” in local terms, sweetened fried rice in English. They have been engaged in this kind of business for ten years already, earning approximately Php 10,000 a month. Corazon also receives regular monthly support from her brother who is presently working abroad as a seaman. In 2008, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under its Regular Loan program, she has successfully repaid a loan of Php 50,000. Corazon is requesting the same loan amount of Php 50,000 as her 3rd loan to be used as additional capital for her chicharon and ampao business with the remaining amount used for a hog-fattening activity. Corazon plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, as savings for future use, for loan repayments, insurances, and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for selling chicharon and ampao, and for hog-fattening

location.town: Tudela-Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Saina

texts.en:
Saina is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 8 years. Her farm produces vegetables, maize, and beans which she sells locally. She also earns income from the sale of bricks in the local market. Saina is 43 years old and married with five children between 11 and 22. Four of them are currently attending school. 

She recently repaid her fourth loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 41,600KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the income from this loan will improve her family's livelihood. In future, she would like to purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production. She faces the challenge of fluctuation in market prices and changes in climatic conditions. She is happy that Juhudi has empowered her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon es un joven con deseo de superación, trabajador que ha logrado mantener su pequeño negocio de venta de accesorios de celular y una variedad que le ha invertido atreves del financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, siendo una oportunidad para el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio.

El cual solo comenzó con la venta de películas y músicas, ahorro de su trabajo como albañil. Hoy en día solo se dedica al negocio, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa, la cual vende enchiladas, tacos y refrescos por las tardes, y  así equilibran los gastos.
Con este préstamo comprara: accesorios para celulares, controles de tv, calculadoras, películas y música para aumentar de inventario, mejorar las ventas  siendo más rentable.
texts.en: Marlon is a young man who desires to get ahead. He is a hard worker who has established a small business selling cellular accessories. He achieved this using the funding from Afodenic, as it was an opportunity to grow his small business. He started off just selling movies and music with savings from his job as a mason. Today he only works at his own business, with the help of his wife. She sells enchiladas, tacos, and refreshments in the afternoons, thus sharing the costs. With this loan, he will buy cellular accessories, TV remotes, calculators, movies, and music to augment his stock, improve his sales, and be more profitable.

loans.use: Cellular accessories, movies, and videos

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.ru:
Firangiz B. 46 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey doch kotoroy 18 let ona  v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 17 let on uchitsya v shkole. Firangiz  i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione. 

Firangiz uje 6 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe produktov.
texts.en:
Firangiz B. is 46 years old. She is married and has two children.  Her daughter is eighteen years old and has started going to university this year.  Her son is seventeen years old and is in school.  Firangiz and her family live in the region of Absheron.

Firangiz has been in the business of selling groceries for six years.  At this time she needs 2000 AZN to expand the store so she can sell more groceries.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux, dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de mariage et de commerce. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés, les quatre prêts précédents, ce groupe est à son cinquième et MAYON D. compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des bassines de savons traditionnels appelé ‘’Gabacourouni’’ auprès des forains venant des grandes villes telles Sikasso et Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de différents villages environnants Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt MAYON D. compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 105.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans les activités et l’autre partie dans les dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group ("Harmony") are married women. On average, they are 37 years old and have four children. They live in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Dougounina of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through ties of kinship and business.

After having properly repaid its four previous loans, the group applies now for its fifth loan. Mayon Diakité wants to use her share of the loan to buy bowlfuls of traditional soap called "Gabacourouni" from traveling merchants coming from large cities such as Sikasso and Bamako. She retails the soap for cash or credit at the markets in the villages of the Bougouni area, as well as from her home. Her clientele is made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Mayon Diakité expects to make a monthly profit of 105,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on household needs.

loans.use: To buy traditional soap

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira I. is from the town of Talibon Bohol. She is 40 years old and has been a food vendor since 2000. She has five children. She works so hard from morning to evening to be able to save enough money for her family.

Funding from CEVI will help her expand her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP. This would make her business competitive and more profI..

The income she will be able to generate will help her family buy adequate supplies of food and other basic needs.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1959 à SAN, préfecture du même nom, région de Ségou, Amadou K. n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, alors il embrassa tôt les activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de céréales avec son père. Il est marié à une épouse et  père de 8 enfants. Il vit chez lui même dans le quartier DALLAN de la préfecture de San.  
Il est dans le domaine du commerce de céréales depuis maintenant 30 ans, et l’exerce actuellement pour lui même au grand marché  de San depuis 20 ans. Il est très sollicité lors  des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environnants.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans.  Il est à son 3ème  prêt individuel. Monsieur Amadou K. compte acheter, 4 tonnes de riz décortiqués, 2 tonnes de petits mils, 3,5 tonnes de mils et 2 tonnes de haricot. Il s’approvisionnait  auprès des commerçants grossistes de San, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller jusque chez les producteurs pour  s’approvisionner. Il vend tous les jours au grand marché de San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, à crédit et au comptant. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser le prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus .
Il ambitionne solliciter un financement plus important qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son activité et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour qu’il puisse améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born around 1959, in the town and prefecture of San, Ségou region, Amadou K. did not have the opportunity to go to school, so early on, he became involved in revenue-producing activities, in particular, selling cereal with his father. 

He is married and the father of eight children. He lives in his own house in the Dallan neighborhood, San prefecture. He has been in the buisness of selling cereal for 30 years now, and he has been working for himself at the grand market of San for 20 years. Amadou is very much in demand during the weekly fairs in San and the surrounding area. 

To increase his business, he decided to turn to micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. He is on his third personal loan. Mr. Amadou K. plans to buy 4 tons of husked rice, 2 tons of pearl millet, 3.5 tons of millet and 2 tons of beans. He obtains his supplies from the wholesalers in San, but with this increase in his capital, he plans to buy directly from the producers. 

He sells everyday at the  grand market in San and at the weekly fairs to customers who are both men and women, on credit  or in cash. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 130,000 CFA francs which he plans to use to repay the loan, pay for his children's schooling, buy food and and invest the rest in other income-producing activities. His goal is to ask for a bigger loan which will allow him to expand his business, increase his turnover and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cereal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food stuffs in her restaurant like rice, sugar, meat, onions, fish, etc. Mary is 28 years old, divorced, and has 2 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more food stuffs in her restaurant like rice, sugar, meat, onions, fish, etc.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. Hong M. is a 28 year old married man, and is a villager who lives in Krabau village in Kandal province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice for a living. With this farming, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to cultivate rice. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, and rice seed and hire laborers to plow his farm. His wife, Mrs. Par Eun, 30 years old, works as seamstress in a garment factory. This couple has two children: One is attending in a local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, and rice seed and hire laborers to plow his farm.

loans.name: Noemie

texts.en: Noemie is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and trisikad (a pedicab or a bicycle with a rider seat attached on the side) operating. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and trisikad businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Noemie is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Noemie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gina Lisbeth

texts.es:
Gina tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo cuenta con una experiencia de más de 1 año en el negocio sus ventas son de forma diaria algunas veces ella  sale a ofrecer sus productos y  deja a pedido y le van pagando de forma diaria o semanal según sea el caso. Clienta realiza dos campañas mensuales. Además cuenta con un stock variado de  productos de belleza que exhibe en su casa. El negocio le hace sentir activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia, solventando sus gastos económicos personales.

Gina desea ampliar sus negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza, ya que durante esta temporada la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gina is 20 years old, single, and resides with her family in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the region and province of Piura, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Gina sells beauty products by catalog. She can count on more than a year of experience in the business. She sells every day, by going out or taking orders. Her customers pay either daily or weekly, as the case may be. Clients participate in 2 campaigns each month. Also she can count on a varied stock of beauty products on display in her home.

The business makes Gina feel active, and with the earnings she obtains, she helps advance her family, covering all her personal expenses. She wants to expand her business by buying more beauty products, since during this season demand has expanded. For that reason, she has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 700 new sols.

loans.use: BUYING BEAUTY PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Rico, who is 44 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 8 to 20 years old. One of the children has his own family and the other two are currently going to school. Annabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 to pirchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and future family needs. Annabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Edwin Jose

texts.es:
Edwin Jose A. P.  tiene 18 años, es  soltero, vive con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.
	
Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Edwin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cría de chanchos. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz además para insumos para los cultivos y comprar de comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un taller mecánico.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Jose A. P. is 18, and single, with no children. He lives with his parents in Chillanes Canton in Bolívar Province. He enjoys sports.
	
The JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS [Together We Make Progress] Communal Bank is located in Recinto Matilde Esther in Chillanes Canton. The communal bank's 12 members do short-cycle agricultural work, planting corn, rice, and passionfruit in small quantities and raising animals such as pigs and hens.

Edwin works farming corn and raising pigs. He buys his products in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells them in the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

He requests the loan so he can plant corn and also rice, to purchase supplies for the crops, and to buy food for the animals. The support of this loan will help him financially meet his needs, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. His dream is to have a mechanic's shop.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old single man who works in construction, specializing in pasting tiles. Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools that help in doing his business faster and in a very professionA. way, some of these tools are used to cut and curve the tiles to fit exactly the requested area in addition to pay for continuing building his house. 

Ali is a talented person. He is an honest builder as his clients describe him. He hopes to expand his business and make a small happy family which he can provide a happy and healthy living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 64 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas, vive con su esposo únicamente pues sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja en su casa, no tiene un horario, y actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y gallinas, pequeños, ya que iniciara el cuido para el proceso de engorde.
Esto le permitirá en el futuro contar con suficientes animales en su granja para vender cuando estén en su peso correcto, permitiéndole recuperar su gasto y teniendo un margen de ganancia.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, ampliarlo, para dar a su familia un futuro más cómodo y estable.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. She raises pigs and chickens. She lives only with her husband, since her children have already made their own homes. This business came from her own initiative. She works at home and does not have a fixed schedule. She currently needs a loan to buy little pigs and chickens so she can start the process of fattening them up. This will permit her in the future to have sufficient animals in her farm to sell when they weigh enough, allowing her to cover her expenses and to make a profit. 
Her aspiration is to grow in her business and expand it, in order to give her family a more comfortable and stable future.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis de 27 años. Es un joven emprendedor que empezó su actividad alquilando taxi y un día tomo la decisión de comprarse su propio vehículo para así ser independiente.

El labora todos los días recorriendo por todos lados. Le dificultad mucho la delincuencia ya que las calles están peligrosas. Es separado tiene 2 hijos pequeños que mantener. Con el préstamo desea comprar otro vehículo para aumentar sus ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 27 years old, a young entrepreneur who began working by renting a taxi and, one day, decided to buy his own vehicle in order to be independent.

He works every day driving all the streets. The problem of delinquency presents difficulties, because all the streets are dangerous. He is separated and has 2 small children to maintain.

With the loan, he wants to buy another vehicle, in order to increase his income and provide as best he can for his children.

loans.use: to buy a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Alicia, ella tiene 29 años la socia es conviviente, ella tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, la socia tiene un restaurante con su tia, pero la socia también alterna esta actividad con sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia es nueva en el banco comunal su tia la invito a formar parte de este grupo y los otros miembros la aceptaron porque ella es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora. La socia desea el crédito para poder implementar su tienda con productos de primera necesidad al por mayor y también el restaurante como las dos trabajan en sociedad deben invertir a la mitad en el mismo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Alicia, 29, is the member.  She has a spouse and two children who are 9 and 6 years of age.  She runs a restaurant with her aunt but she also alternates this activity with running a grocery store.  She is new to the communal bank; her aunt invited her to be part of this group and the other members accepted her because she’s a responsible, hard working woman.

She wants the loan to buy basic need items for her store at wholesale and also for the restaurant since they both work in partnership and have to invest half in it.  She wants the loan to invest in her businesses.

She is grateful and expresses that she will meet her repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store and invest in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-age children. She has owned a small shop for the past five years where she offers her clients all beauty services such as make-up. In addition, she sells different beauty products. Her products are fabricated with premium components and she even offers her clients testers before any purchases to make sure that the products are 100 % clean and don’t cause infections or allergies.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products in order to increase her sales and her income. She is very positive about the future of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles, tiene 28 años, es casada con 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años.
Se dedica a la fabricación de Retablos Ayacuchanos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de: yeso, clavos, goma, pintura, harina. Sandra y su esposo se dedica a la fabricación de Retablos Ayacuchanos, ambos provienen de padres artesanos se conocieron se casaron y desarrollan ese arte, atienden pedidos su esposo viaja a las ferias a exponer sus trabajos. Le gusta FINCA Perú porque les enseñan los valores, a ahorrar y en las capacitaciones le hablan del matrimonio, familia, negocios y es bueno porque aprenden más. Si tuvo algunas dificultades a veces cuando le hacen pedidos no le llegan a pagar en su totalidad. Su sueño es construir su casa y poder exportar sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank Los Claveles. She is a 28-year-old married mother of two. Her children are 8 and 6 years old. She earns her living making Ayacuchan retablos (wooden boxes decorated with images and customs of the area). She plans to use the loan to purchase: plaster, nails, glue, paint and flour. 

Sandra and her husband make Ayacuchan retablos. Their parents are all artisans too. They met, got married and developed their art and now they process orders together. Her husband travels to fairs to show their work. Sandra likes FINCA Peru because it teaches people values like saving money. Also, during trainings they talk about marriage, family and business, which is good because they learn more this way. Sometimes she has had trouble when people order retablos but then can't pay in full. Sandra's dream is to build her own house and export her work.

loans.use: to purchase: plaster, nails, glue, paint and flour.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two grown daughters, Anna and Irina. She is a market vendor from Melitopol. Larisa sells women's clothing in the local ‘Rizhskyi' market. 

Seventeen years of working in the business have taught her to be an efficient manager of her funds and resources. Currently, Larisa has 50,000 grivnyas invested in inventory. Her profit is about 7,500 grivnyas a month. 

Larisa is requesting a loan of 12,000 grivnyas to purchase assorted seasonal clothing for her female customers. Additional income will be re-invested in further growth of the trade as well as in the improvement of her living conditions. 

Larisa is hoping to open one more vending facility in the near future, thus expanding her trade as a result.

loans.use: to purchase summer merchandise

loans.name: Allégresse Plus Group

texts.en:
Léontine is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Allégresse Plus”. It is composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Léontine is 57 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 19 to 41 years old. Only one of her children goes to school. Léontine's main activity is selling secondhand clothing and she has been active in her business for years. She began her business by operating a general store. Léontine also sells drinks. Her business is prospering and it generates a profit of $300 per month. Léontine intends to use this loan to increase her stock of goods by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell at a profit in order to increase her capital. Her ambition is to become a secondhand clothing provider in her area. Léontine works hard in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene; la socia tiene 70 años de edad, la socia es viuda; La socia tiene 5 hijos; la socia de dedica a la compra y venta de verduras  y a la agricultura como primera actividad económica, la socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz blanco para el nuevo cultivo, la socia no produce verduras por lo que ella tiene que comprar de otras personas que le dejan en partes, ella paga la primera parte y le van dando poco a poco las verduras para que estas no se le malogren luego la socia les paga al cabo de un mes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz y el pago final a su proveedor de verduras como zanahoria, tomate, y verduras en general.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Irene, 70, is a member of the “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos” communal bank located in Urquillos District in Calca Province and Cusco Department.

She is a widow and has five children.  She is a vegetable merchant and a farmer; these are her main economic activities.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy white corn seeds for the new crops.  She does not produce vegetables so she has to buy them from others who let her get them in parts.  She pays the first part and then they gradually resupply her with vegetables so that they don’t spoil.  A month later she pays them.  She is asking for the loan to buy corn seeds and to make the final payment to her vegetable supplier for carrots, tomatoes and vegetables in general.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and at the same time commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.
